A strong protest was carried out under the aegis of BNP (Balochistan National Party) on 30 Dec 2010 in Quetta to protest against rampant target killings, abductions and murders of political activists, failure to recover the missing Hindu spiritual leader and missing persons, and continued operation in the environs of Saryab.
Hundreds of labourers and daily wagers of Faisalabad industries on 30 Dec 2010 lodged a strong protest over four-day a week gas load shedding in the city.
Demonstrations supporting the unification of HI and AS have taken place in all districts of Gedo apart from Doolow which is under ASWJ/TFG control.
Shebeen owners protest the forced closure of their pubs.
On December 30, in Mechhardia in Madhukhali Upazila (Faridpur, Dhaka), hundreds of activists staged a demonstration and erected barricades over the accidental death of a child on the road.

Sialkot Chamber of Commerce and Industry (SCCI), Pakistan Readymade Garments Manufacturers & Exporters Association(PRGMEA), Pakistan Gloves Manufacturers & Exporters Association (PGMEA) and other main trade bodies on 30 Dec 2010 staged a peaceful agitation in front of the grand building of Sialkot SCCI during the light rainy weather as a protest against the TDAP for announcing the 3900 percent increase in fee for certificate of Origin by TDAP.

A protest was held in Islamabad on 30 Dec 2010 in front of the Parliament House against the country's blasphemy law and parallel judicial structures, especially the Federal Shariat Court with regards to its recent judgement against the Women's Protection Act (WPA).
300 - 400 bibanja owners (tenants) in Mukono district last evening blocked the Mukono-Kayunga road in protest against their imminent eviction by a landlord.

Hundreds of Kisumu youth took to the streets to protest the alleged involvement of Mombasa businessman Ali Punjani in drug trafficking Thursday. Led by Kisumu Youth Forum secretary general Joshua Omondi, they described Mr Punjani as a successful businessman both in Kenya and internationally, exonerating him from the illicit drug trade.

actor1: MINUCI: United Nations Mission in Cote d'Ivoire (2003-2004)
notes: An incident on Wednesday when UN forces clashed with a hostile crowd. ONUCI formally denied that it fired any shots at the mob.

Ivory nationals and supporters of the Ivory Coasts would-be president Alassane Ouattara, who lost an election due to internationally recognized fraud, begin a protest near the Ivory embassy in Bamako.

Refugees drawn from the Oromo community of Ethiopia but living in Nairobi yesterday took to the streets in a peaceful demonstration over what they termed harassment by the police. The refugees, mostly from Eastleigh and South C estates, say that they are being targeted unfairly.
The residents of Ratta Amral, Rawalpindi on 29 Dec 2010 staged demonstration against low pressure of gas they have been experiencing in their locality for the last two weeks.
The sacked teachers of Fata community schools on 29 Dec 2010 held a protest demonstration and demanded early restoration of their services, most likely in Islamabad.

Upon the late arrival of voting materials a group of PDP supporters threw stones at members of the PDP leadership, believing they were being marginalized in an upcoming primary election. Soldiers responded by dispersing the mob. Note: date not entirely known - the source alludes to activity (in several areas) on "Wednesday last week" though it is not entirely clear if the event in Lafia did indeed occur on this date.

Protests over inadequate housing spread to other suburbs of Algiers, with protesters taking to the streets against the lack of housing in Ennakhil, Diar el Babor and Cervantes. People living in these areas burnt tires and threw stones and Molotov cocktails at police, who responded with tear gas and arrests.
53 people are injured and 29 arrested during a protest over inadequate housing.
FATA teachers protested permanent closure of 956 community schools in various tribal areas, rendering 2,000 male and female teachers jobless in Peshawar on 28 Dec 2010.
On Dec 29, two rival groups of villagers clashed over a land dispute, leaving one person dead and five injured at Parkol village (Baraigram, Natore).
On December 29, in Tejgaon Industrial Area of Dhaka city (Dhaka, Dhaka), rival factions of Dhaka Polytechnic Institute BCL clashed over one group vandalizing the other's room. 10 people were injured.
On December 29, in Magura Upazila (Magura, Khulna), a group of AL activists attacked acting AL mayor of the Magura municipality, leaving him seriously injured.

On December 29, in Brahmanbaria town (Brahmanbaria, Chittagong), activists staged demonstrations and erected barricades demanding dismissal of Deputy Commissioner for making derogatory remark about local religious leaders.

On December 29, in Banti in Araihazar Upazila (Narayanganj, Dhaka), suspected armed robbers and villagers engaged in a clash after the suspected robbers attacked and injured some of the villagers during a robbery. The villagers attacked and killed one of the robbers.
RJ activists staged a protest in Birtamod municipality, East, on 29 December, against an assault on their leader by FLSC activists.
FLSC activists assaulted an RJ leader in Birtamod municipality, East, on 29 December. No injuries were reported.

On December 29, 2010, approximately 50 persons protested outside City Hall in Phnom Penh. The protesters demanded the municipal authority's help after 200 families in Prek Pra commune were given two weeks to relocate.

On December 29, 2010, approximately 50 fishermen from Kampong Klaing commune in Srok Sotr Nikum (Siem Reap) protested illegal fees that were being collected from them by local military police and fisheries personnel. The fishermen had intended to protest at the Siem Reap provincial hall but were blocked by the district authorities.

The residents of the different areas of Hyderabad city including Latifabad, Hussainabad, G.O.R Colony, Qasimabad, Phuleli, Pretabad, Civil Lines and others staged a protest demonstration against administration of the HESCO on 28 Dec 2010.
The activists of the Sindh United Party (SUP) staged a protest demonstration outside the local press club against the load shedding of sui gas in a city in Sindh on 28 Dec 2010.
The activists of the Jeay Sindh Muttahida Mahaz staged a protest demonstration against the killing of their leader on 28 Dec 2010 in Badin.

Fifty activists from the Thailand Sexual Diversity Network demonstrated in front of Government House in Bangkok against the government's abstention on voting for the protection of lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender (LGBT) people.
On 28 December 2010, In separate incidents, at least 10 supporters of the rebel Awami League candidate Azam were hurt in pre-polls clashes in the Sailkupa municipality in the district.
A demonstration in support of unification of HI and AS has taken place in Kismayo.
Scores of primary school teachers on 28 Dec 2010 staged a protest demonstration against the actions of EDO Education Badin.
The lower staff of the Education Department staged a protest in favor of their demands outside the Moro Press Club on 28 Dec 2010.
Hundreds of workers of the Mari Gas Company Limited protested for the acceptance of their demands and removal of contract system in Daharki on 28 Dec 2010.

The growers of Daulatpur and its adjoining areas on 28 Dec 2010 continued their protest for the 4rd consecutive day against provision of low prices of their sugarcane crops here outside the Al-Noor Sugar Mills.
PPP-SB Matli staged a protest against the non-arrest of their leader's killers on 28 Dec 2010.
The members of the Shehri Ittehad staged a protest demonstration against the deteriorating law and order situation after a WAPDA employees house was looted on 28 Dec 2010 in Sindh.
The people of the Khoso Community, residents of village Darl Khoso held a protest demonstration against the occupation of forest lands in Matiari on 28 Dec 2010.
The activists of the Sunni Tehreek staged a protest demonstration against the poor sanitary conditions of the historical Baban Shah graveyard in Sukkur on 28 Dec 2010.
The leaders of various political, nationalist and religious partie staged a protest demonstration outside the Sukkur Press Club against DPO Ghotki on 28 Dec 2010.

The vaccinators of the EPI program staged a protest demonstration against the non-issuance of their salaries and for the regularization of their services outside the local press club in Sindh on 28 Dec 2010.
The members of the Khaki Community, resident of village Khaki near Ranipur staged a protest demonstration for the recovery of an abducted person on 28 Dec 2010.
The residents of Daharki staged a protest demonstration outside the main gate of the Engro Fertilizers for releasing poisonous water into local canals on 28 Dec 2010.

A protest demonstration was staged by the leaders of different political, social and religious parties against the HESCO authorities for continuing the several hours of unannounced load shedding in Badin on 28 Dec 2010.
Looted passengers staged a protest near Bhitshah on 28 Dec 2010 against the robbery.
The Railway Workers Union (RWU) Open Line held a protest demonstration outside the Railway Headquarters in Lahore on 28 Dec 2010 against the proposed privatisation of the Pakistan Railways (PR).

assoc_actor_2: CPN(UML): Communist Party of Nepal (Unified Marxist-Leninist)
notes: Cadres of Federal Limbuwan State Council (FLSC) took control and assaulted central vice-chairperson of Rastriya Janamorcha Nepal. A group of 20-25 Limbuwan activists took control while the group was organizing a meeting in Birtamod of Jhapa. No injuries were reported.

Senegalese police armed with riot shields and batons on Wednesday prevented opposition supporters from holding a banned march to protest the squandering of public funds, an AFP journalist reported.The police awaited the protesters where the march was scheduled to start, and dozens who showed up were pushed back into adjacent streets.
Residents of an informal settlement protest their forced removal from the area.
A pro-new-Constitution group demonstration was forcibly dispersed by police who stopped their march to the ministry responsible for constitutional affairs.

On December 28, 2010, 18 families protested outside City Hall in Phnom Penh. The residents opposed their upcoming displacement in order for a access road to be built. They were also dissatisfied with the compensation being offered.
On December 28, 2010, 40 families protested the clearing of forest and farmlands for the development of acacia and cassava plantations in Ansar Chambak commune (Krakor, Pursat).

Eighteen transport workers associated with Prithvi Highway Bus Management Committee were injured after those affiliated to Gorkha Transport Entrepreneurs' Committee allegedly beat them up following a dispute over bus operation in rural Bhhachheka and Baluwa road section in Gorkha. People representing the Gorkha Transport Entrepreneurs' committee launched an attack on the Prithvi Bus Management Committee members with rods, planks and boulders as they were trying to operate on the road over a breach of agreement.
Ongoing protests
People in Harappa protested against power and gas sufferings as part of a province-wide protest on 27 Dec 2010.
Villagers in Satun province's La-Ngoo district gathered to oppose a deep sea port project, and are calling on the government to explain their plans to construct an industrial estate.

In the city of Palmiers, clashes between demonstrators and security forces continued on the night of Monday to Tuesday [27 to 28 December] when young people threw from the top of a building a bottle of butane gas on the police station located in the former middle school. Residents feel they are excluded from resettlement programs as their homes fall into a state of disrepair and unsanitary living conditions.

Clashes have taken place in the city of Palmiers, Laaquiba and Baraki because of re-housing. In Baraki, the residents of Hai Al-Baraka have still not subsided, despite the vague promises by local authorities. Residents feel they are excluded from resettlement programs as their homes fall into a state of disrepair and unsanitary living conditions.

Clashes have taken place in the city of Palmiers, Laaquiba and Baraki because of re-housing. Residents feel they are excluded from resettlement programs as their homes fall into a state of disrepair and unsanitary living conditions. People living in these areas burnt tires and threw stones and Molotov cocktails at police, who responded with tear gas and arrests.
Rikshaw drivers staged protest against the extortionists at Raja Bazaar Rikshaw stand in Rawalpindi on 27 Dec 2010.

On 27 December 2010, at the Shahjalal University of Science & Technology (SUST) in Sylhet, BCL student activists clashed with another student over a trivial matter. According to sources, the student who was attacked, defended himself with a knife and injured 6 BCL activists. On hearing this information, other BCL men equipped with rods/hockey sticks attacked him again.
On 27 Dec, members of the transgender community held a protest on the occasion of the third anniversary of Benazir Bhutto's death, against the lack of arrest in the case in Rawalpindi.
Khaksar Tehreek Pakistan staged a protest demonstration against price hike of petroleum, electricity and terrorism in Lahore on 26 Dec 2010.

A protest rally was staged against proposed amendments in the blasphemy act in Moro on 27 Dec 2010. The rally was held on the call of Shiite Ulema Council under the banner of Tahafuz Namoos-e-Risalat.
Forty-six vaccinators of district Ghotki protested and have announced boycott the forthcoming anti-polio drive in District Ghotki on 27 Dec 2010 due to unpaid salaries.

The growers of Daulatpur and its adjoining areas on 27 Dec 2010 continued their protest for the 3rd consecutive day against provision of low prices of their sugarcane crops here outside the Al-Noor Sugar Mills.
The activists of the Jeay Sindh Muttahida Mahaz staged a protest demonstration against the killing of their leader in Golarchi on 27 Dec 2010.

Chaos broke out at an anti-drugs demonstration in Kisauni, Mombasa on Monday. A 16-year-old pupil was among four protesters who were seriously injured when unknown people attacked the demonstrators. The protesters, waving placards and chanting slogans against substance abuse, were confronted by a gang of youths who reportedly pelted them with stones next to the Kisauni CDF offices.

On December 27, around Sreenagar Upazila (Munshiganj, Dhaka), activists staged demonstration, blocked the highways, and damaged some vehicles condemning the government policy for building an international airport in their area.

The sacked employees of Bureau of Curriculum Hyderabad and Jamshoro staged a protest demonstration for the reinstatement of their services in Hyderabad on 26 Dec 2010.

Traffic in Kathmandu was halted due to a one-hour road strike called by the Nepal Students Union (NSU). A clash was reported to have taken place between that the NSU cadres and the police, where the groups pelted stones at each other in front of the Tri-Chandra Campus in Ratnapark.

The residents of Baban Shah Colony and G.O.R Colony Hyderabad staged a protest demonstration in the favor of their demands in Hyderabad on 26 Dec 2010.

The members of the Young Citizens Welfare Association Dadu staged a protest demonstration against the administration of the Civil Hospital Dadu for not providing medicines to the people of Dadu in Hyderabad on 26 Dec 2010.

On the call of the Sheheri Action Committee (SAC) Naudero a protest rally was taken out in Naudero, the home town of slain PPP chairperson Benazir Bhutto on 26 Dec 2010 in which workers of more than ten political, social welfare, labour and literary organizations took part.
The members of the Young Citizens Welfare Association Dadu staged a protest demonstration against the administration of Civil Hospital Dadu in Hyderabad on 26 Dec 2010.

The members of the Male Mobilization Action Committee and contract based employees of the Population Welfare Department Sindh staged a protest demonstration for the regularization of their services on 26 Dec 2010 in Hyderabad.
A man suspected of raping a three-year-old girl was attacked and killed by a mob near King Williams Town the day after Christmas.
On December 26, in Rangamati town (Rangamati, Chittagong), ethnic hill track activists staged a demonstration demanding stoppage of land commission activities.

On December 26, in Rajshahi city (Rajshahi, Rajshahi), students of Rajshahi University of Engineering and Technology staged a demonstration and locked the doors of their classrooms, demanding removal of the department head.
On December 26, in Khagrachhari town (Khagrachhari, Chittagong), ethnic hill track activists staged a demonstration demanding stoppage of land commission activities.

Settlers of Karachi Electric Supply Corporation (KESC) Employers Cooperative Housing Society Welfare Association staged a protest demonstration against land mafia and society administrator demanded recovery of 12-acre land from the land mafia on 26 Dec 2010.

On 26 Dec 2010, the Human Rights Commission of Pakistan (HRCP) Balochistan chapter organised a demonstration to protest against the recovery of bullet-riddled bodies, increased incidents of targeted killings and kidnapping for ransom in Quetta.

At least two houses burned in the Nigerian city of Jos amid outbursts of violent rioting, and smoke could be seen coming from another area amid tensions following Christmas Eve bomb attacks that left dozens dead. The unrest was attributed to youth gangs; security forces were deployed to restore calm.

Armed Maasai youths continued to keep vigil at the controversial 2,400-acre Rose Farm in Mau Narok to prevent government surveyors from sub-dividing it. A contingent of security personnel was sent on Saturday night to the disputed piece of land, raising fears of a clash with the armed youths. The youths armed with machetes, rungus, bows and arrows at one point barricaded the road leading to the farm in Tipis trading centre to block the police officers from accessing it.
Doctors and nurses of the Abbaseyya Psychiatric Hospital held a demonstration amid rumours that the hospital will be relocated outside Cairo.

On December 25, in Daulatpur town in Daulatpur Upazila (Kushtia, Kushtia), AL activists clashed with police during a demonstration demanding the arrests of actors involved in bombing of an AL leaders house. 10 activists were injured.

Riots broke out in districts covered by the programme to re-house 10,000 families. on 25 December, inhabitants of Les Palmiers district, in the municipality of Bachdjarah blocked the Oued Ouchayah tunnel to traffic for hours, in both directions, and there were clashes with the forces of order. Residents feel they are excluded from resettlement programs as their homes fall into a state of disrepair and unsanitary living conditions.

Students of the University of Hargeisa demonstrated in the university compound against changes made in the leadership of the institution. Supporters of the changes also gather in the area. Later a clash between the two camps occurred.
Local Thatta students staged a protest demo against the local administration for issuing domiciles to outsiders on 25 Dec 2010.

notes: The Government Secondary Teachers Association (GSTA) staged a protest demonstration and observed a token hunger strike in Sindh on 25 Dec 2010 against the illegal transfer of a GSTA leader.

The people of the Mallah community staged a protest demonstration for the arrest of the killers of their community man on 25 Dec 2010. While talking to newsmen, the protesting leaders said that their community man namely was killed a few days ago at village Pakho Thar near Kadhan.
The activists of Jeay Sindh Tehreek staged a protest demonstration for the release of their party leaders in Sindh on 25 Dec 2010.

The members of the All Parties Alliance continued their protest demonstration for the 100th consecutive day for the recovery of an abducted youth outside the Naushahro Feroze Press Club on 25 Dec 2010.

A protest demonstration was staged by the members of the Pakistan Fisherfolk Forum (PFF) as a part of their ongoing struggle to mobilize farmers, fishermen and labourers against contract system of waters on 27 Dec 2010 in Shaheed Benazirabad.
People in Ghotki held protests against Ghotki police on 25 Dec 2010.
People in Mirpur Mathelo held protests against Ghotki police on 25 Dec 2010.
People protest power cuts by burning tires in suburban Dakar.

A group of youths in Matambalale attacked and killed a policeman. The officer intercepted a young man who was selling food. An angry altercation followed, and when the policeman walked away, he was followed by a group of young villagers.

assoc_actor_1: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship
notes: On 24 December 2010, some 300 UDD red-shirt people staged a noisy protest in front of the 3rd Special Warfare Regiment in Lop Buri province coded at Lopburi city (MLP, LP). The demonstrators cited the leaked reports of the Department of Special Investigation as the cause for the protest. The report blamed the military for the deaths of several red shirts.
Sudanese police used tear gas and batons to disperse a gathering at the headquarters of the opposition Umma party in the twin capital city of Omdurman.
Cocoa farmers protest over the imposition of a traditional ruler in Manyus big cocoa and coffee producing Kembong sub-district and recent arrests against them.

An award winning and internationally acclaimed actor, who tried to have a one-man protest, was arrested by police in Harare on Wednesday. Silvanos Mudzvova wanted to march on Parliament building to demand that MPs and other elected officials should declare their assets before taking office.

At the root of this incident, the intervention of local authorities supported by the police to demolish shacks erected 5 recently (during Ramadan). The slum tried to prevent the destruction of the huts of their new neighbors, throwing stones and other projectiles at police came dislodge. Note in passing that the demolition operation is part of the guidelines of the province to thwart lawless extensions that operate in the slums of sites.

On Nov 2, AL activists injured six people and vandalized offices of Chittagong City Corportation following the removal of six billboards from the city.

On Nov 2, over 100 workers of a Sweater Factory staged a demonstration outside the factory in Siddhirganj, Narayanganj, demanding wage hike. They also ransacked the offices and injured five officials.

Hundreds of protesting Bangladeshi garment workers fought riot police and ransacked a factory north of Dhaka on Tuesday demanding full implementation of a new government-backed wage hike. Factory guards fired blanks from their rifles and police used tear gas and baton charges to break up the 500 protesting workers, leaving at least five people injured including an inspector, police said.

Workers took out protest procession from Bakhtiar Labour Hall, Lahore on 2 November 2010 under the aegis of the Pakistan Wapda Hydroelectric Central Labour Union (PWHLU) against increase in fuel prices, proposed dissolution of Pepco and price hike.

Resident of Abudwak held peaceful demonstration in support for the new TFG Prime Minister who was sworn in at Villa Somalia on 01/11/2010. The new Prime Minister hails from Marehan clan that inhabit Gedo region and Abudwak district of Galgaduud region.
Students gathered in Lahore on 1 November 2010 to protest against the 86-year imprisonment sentence of Dr. Aafia.
On 1 Nov, one person was killed and 50 people injured when rival communal groups clashed at Shibpasha village in Ajmiriganj upazila (Habiganj, Sylhet) over a land dispute.
On Nov 1, A suspected dacoit was killed in a mass beating at Jiranaish village in Chandina upazila, Comilla.

On 1 Nov, students formed a human chain in front of SOS Children's Village at Shyamoli in Mohammadpur thana (Dhaka city). The human chain was one of a number of anti-stalking protests held across the nation.
On 1 Nov, farmers staged a protest at the Singair town (Manikganj, Dhaka) over plans to convert farmlands into a new satellite town in the upazila.

On Nov 1, in Mymensingh, at least 10 people, including cops, were injured in clash between of students of Anando Mohan College and police on campus when students were staging a protest against snatchers.
On Nov 1, at least 15 activists of the ruling part were injured in a clash between Awami League and its youth wing Jubo League over garments wastes trading at Masdair in Fatulla upazila, Narayanganj.
TNRM lead a protest in Lahore on 1 November 2010 to demonstrate against the attacks on the shrines of Data Darbar.
Farmers protest against slow justice over illegal sale of land in Ikolomani.

Protesters managed to close a bridge between Khartoum and Omdurman to complain at the price and frequency of transport in the Sudanese capital. Newspapers in Khartoum reported on Tuesday that some passengers were injured in the protests.
On November 1, 2010, approximately 60 persons protested against the clearing of land by a development firm in Veal Veang (Pursat).

In the wake of a series of murders of colleagues, teachers staged demonstrations across Terai district to press the government to provide them security. Rallying under the banner of Nepal Teachers' Union, the demonstrators demanded a probe into Saturday's murder of a teacher of Mahendra Adarsha School in Chyutaha VDC-9. They enforced a two-hour transport strike at the main chowk of Kalaiya, Nijgadh and Simara.
A small number of residents held a demonstration opposing the reconciliation meeting being held in the town of Widh Widh between the SSC militia and the Somaliland forces.
On 31 Oct, at least 15 people were injured when rival communal groups clashed at Gopalnagar village (Munshiganj, Dhaka) over a land dispute.

On 31 Oct, rioting BCL activists damaged shops and temple idols at Ramna Kali Mandir in Ramna thana, Dhaka city. The incident was reported to have resulted from an internal BCL dispute over posts within the temple maintenance committee.

On 31 Oct, the Thakurgaon NGO Cell, Sammilito Sanskritik Jote and Bangladesh Shikkhak Samity formed a human chain in Thakurgaon district town (Rangpur). The human chain was one of a number of anti-stalking protests held across the nation.
On 31 Oct, the Coastal NGO Forum formed a human chain in Patuakhali district town (Barisal). The human chain was one of a number of anti-stalking protests held across the nation.
On 31 Oct, the Bangladesh Samajtantrik Mohila Dal formed a human chain in Natore district town (Rajshahi). The human chain was one of a number of anti-stalking protest held across the nation.
On 31 Oct, teachers and students staged a procession in Gaibandha district town (Rangpur), as one of a number of anti-stalking protests held across the nation.
On 31 Oct, protesters formed a number of human chains in Barisal city (Barisal), as part of anti-stalking protests held across the nation.
On 31 Oct, local residents blocked the Habiganj-Nabiganj road in Baniachong upazila (Habiganj, Sylhet) and set fire to a vehicle after it killed a local man in fatal collision.
On 31 Oct, rioters attacked security guards at a school in Dhanmondi thana, Dhaka, as they attempted to retrieve their associate who was being held at the school following a stalking incident.

On 31 Oct, students and teachers formed a human chain in front of Rayerbazar High School and College in Dhanmondi thana (Dhaka city). They were protesting against the presence of stalkers harassing schoolgirls as they leave school and an assault the school's chairman.

An enraged mob set a truck on fire after it hit bystanders, claiming a life of a minor boy and leaving five members of a family standing on a footpath wounded in the limits of Landhi Police Station in Karachi on 31 Oct 2010.
Business came to a standstill at the Wakulima Market in Nairobi yesterday after traders took to the streets, protesting against new charges introduced by the city council last week.

On October 31, 2010, approximately 65 persons were detained, photographed and questioned by the police in Siem Reap City (Siem Reap). Villagers from several districts in the province were on their way to Krong Siem Reap to highlight several grievances to Hillary Clinton during her visit to Cambodia. The villagers were released after signing a document to show that they would stop protesting.

The murder of a teacher in Bara district sparked protests in Nawalparasi district at the district headquarters. Locals and members of Nepal Teachers Union demonstrated to demand stern action against the culprits.
The murder of a teacher in Bara district sparked protests in Dhanusha district. Locals and members of Nepal Teachers Union demonstrated to demand stern action against the culprits.
The murder of a teacher in Bara district sparked protests in Mahottari district. Locals and members of Nepal Teachers Union demonstrated to demand stern action against the culprits.
Tehreek Hurmat-e-Rasool (THR) held demonstrations and conferences in major cities including Lahore on 30 Oct 2010 to protest against printing of blasphemous caricatures in the Norwegian newspaper.

assoc_actor_2: BNP: Bangladesh Nationalist Party; Civilians (Bangladesh); Journalists (Bangladesh)
notes: Awami League and BNP activists clashed at Borhanuddin upazila, Bhola district on 30 Oct 2010. At least 50 people including 5 journalists were wounded.

Workers of Masihata Sweater Factory staged a demonstration in front of the factory at Painshail village in Gazipur Sadar on 30 Oct 2010 demanding pay increases. Ten people including factory officials were wounded.
An unidentified group exploded Molotov cocktails at Rangpur Zoo, Rangpur city on 30 Oct 2010.

Two rival factions of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) staged a procession and held rallies on campus at Rajshahi University, Rajshahi city on 30 Oct 2010 defying authorities' ban on such programmes. The groups also engaged in chase and counter chase.

The Dhaka-Phulbari long march ended at Phulbari in Dinajpur on Saturday putting out a call for a greater movement involving the people if the Awami League-led government did not meet the nine-point demands the march pushed for.

Teachers, students and other participants formed a human chain in Abdul Hamid Road, Pabna town on 30 Oct 2010 demanding punishment to the killers of two teachers (Mizanur Rashid and Chanpa Rani) who protested against stalking of female students.
On 30 Oct, students staged an oath taking ceremony at Nawabganj Upazila College at Chapai Nababganj town (Nawabganj, Rajshahi), as one of a number of anti-stalking protests held across the nation.

Teachers, students and other participants formed a human chain in Malanchi Bazar of Bagatipara upazila, Natore district on 30 Oct 2010 demanding punishment to the killers of two teachers (Mizanur Rashid and Chanpa Rani) who protested against stalking of female students.

District-based teachers staged a demonstration in Kalaiya in Sangja, demanding immediate arrest of the guilty and compensation to the victim's family. The family received the body after the local administration assured them to arrest the guilty and provide compensation to the family.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
assoc_actor_2: NC: Nepali Congress; CPN(UML): Communist Party of Nepal (Unified Marxist-Leninist)
notes: Eight people were injured in a clash at Kyakami VDC in Syangja district when UPCN (Maoist) cadres stormed a political mechanism meeting between the NC and the UML and attacked the participants. The clash was triggered by a row between the Maoist and the NC-UML alliance regarding the electrification in Kyakami VDC.

Petroleum transportation entrepreneurs halted the delivery of petroleum at the Amlekhgunj depot of the Nepal Oil Corporation (NOC) and the Raxaul depot of the Indian Oil Corporation. The entrepreneurs, have been demonstrating against the NOC from last week, and launched further protest programs citing the government's apathetic behaviour towards their demands to increase the fares of the petroleum-ferrying vehicles.

assoc_actor_1: JKLF: Jammu and Kashmir Liberation Front
notes: Hundreds of JKLF activists marched from Muzaffarabad to Chakothi to mark the 63rd anniversary of the Kashmir dispute.
1,500 textile workers protest the closure of a factory for more than a month.

Quaid-e-Azam university students from Federal Administered Tribal Area (FATA) and Malakand division staged protest against Higher Education Commission (HEC) corruption in USAID grant released for students of FATA and Malakand war affected areas on 29 Oct 2010.
Students and employees of the Punjab University held protest demonstrations in favour of their demands before the arrival of a dignitary on 29 Oct 2010.
On 29 Oct, a mob of villagers vandalised the property of a local rival at Gopalnagar village (Munshiganj, Dhaka) over a land dispute.
Two rival factions of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) clashed on Dhaka University campus, Ramna area, Dhaka on 29 Oct 2010. Two students were wounded.
Demonstrators torched a bus on Dhaka-Aricha highway in Savar upazila, Dhaka district on 29 Oct 2010 following the death of a clinic employee in a road crash.
Local residents blocked the Lalmonirhat-Mogholhat road and staged a rally at Sakoya Bazar, Lalmonirhat Sadar upazila on 29 Oct 2010 in protest of the killing of a local union parishad member.
On 29 Oct, two groups of villagers clashed over disputed land in Kumridurgapur village (Baniachong upazila, Habiganj district). Around 50 people were wounded.
Rioters torched vehicles and blocked roads in different areas of Karachi after the news about an attack on Sunni Tehreek leader came through on 29 Oct 2010.
A man tried to kill himself by self-immolation after failing to get justice in a property matter. This incident occurred outside the CM's house in Lahore on 29 Oct 2010.
On 29 Oct, two rival groups clashed over disputed land at Gopal Nagar village (Sadar upazila, Munshiganj). At least six people were wounded.
A former premier of AJK gave a speech to a rally of PML-N supporters to mark the 63rd anniversary of the Kashmir dispute.
The Prime Minister of AJK gave a speech to a rally to mark the 63rd anniversary of the Kashmir dispute.
The leader of the UJC led a peaceful march through Muzaffarabad after giving a speech to mark the 63rd anniversary of the Kashmir dispute.

Eight Ugandans were arrested by the police officers on Wednesday for allegedly fishing on Tanzanian waters. But the Ugandan fishermen decided to lay an ambush for the officers. When the officers saw a strange boat on their waters, they approached but were surrounded by the fishermen. A brief scuffle ensued but the officers lost the battle.
On 28 Oct, a Hindu priest was killed during a clash between the management committee of Shonai Kali Temple and its rival group at Nashibganj Bazar (Pirganj upazila, Thakurgaon district).
Violent service delivery protest in Kleinskool for a second day. Police respond with rubber bullets.

notes: Alleged BCL members severely beat up a local Jatiyatabadi Chhatra Dal (JCD) leader at Mostafapur village of Kalapara upazila, Patuakhali district on 28 Oct 2010. The victim was wounded.

A bus helper was beaten to death by a mob in Kanchan area of Rupganj upazila, Narayanganj district on 28 Oct 2010 following a road crash that left a pedestrian injured.

Students of Shahjalal University of Science and Technology (SUST) clashed with transport workers at Kodomtoli area, Sylhet city on 28 Oct 2010, following the incident of transport workers beating students with iron rods after a row. The students vandalised vehicles and set up a barricade on the Sylhet-Sunamganj highway. At least 13 students were wounded.
Students of a university in Mihintale, North Central staged a protest on 28 October against the IUSF.

Teachers and other participants staged a procession and a rally at Natore Press Club, Natore city on 27 Oct 2010 demanding punishment to the killers of Mizanur Rashid, a teacher who protested against stalking of female students.

Angry local residents blocked the Dhaka-Khulna highway at Madhukhali upazila town, Faridpur district on 27 Oct 2010 demonstrating against the killing of a mother as she protested against stalkers of her daughter.
Tehrik Azadi Kashmir held a protest at Lahore Press Club to mark the 63rd anniversary of Indian occupation of JK on 27 Oct 2010.

It was reported that an activist involved with the protest was beaten unconscious by police.
The Bulawayo Progressive Residents Association (BPRA) held a demonstration Wednesday to protest the Zimbabwe Electricity Supply Authoritys unaffordable bills being sent to residents.

Hundreds of tail end growers of Hala, with JSQM and other parties, staged a protest demonstration outside the local press club against acute shortage of water in different branches of region on 26 Oct 2010.

Activists formed a human chain at Chandpai village in Mongla upazila, Bagerhat district on 26 Oct 2010 to raise awareness and protest against stalking.
Sweepers from Jatrabari area besieged Jatrabari police station, Dhaka on 26 Oct 2010 demanding release of detained sweepers.
A reporter of Boishakhi TV was kidnapped from Gulshan-1 area, Dhaka on 26 Oct 2010. He was found alive at Nagarbari-Bogra Highway on 27 Oct 2010.

Pakistan Tehriek-i-Insaf activists on 26 Oct 2010 held a demonstration outside Peshawar Press Club against killing of a party activist in an accident on Ring Road and termed it negligence on part of police.

Demonstrations organized by the Transitional Federal Government of Somalia [TFG] administrations in Banaadir Region in opposition to Al-Shabab and Hisb al-Islam were held in Mogadishu today. Hundreds of Mogadishu residents took part in these highly organized demos in Banaadir Region.
On 25 Oct 2010, a small group of people held a protest against the 2010 election at Yangon's Hledan junction, Kamayut township.

On October 25, 2010, protesters gathered in front of the United Nations Development Programme office in Phnom Penh to request the intervention of UN Secretary General Ban Ki-Moon into alleged land grabbing. Local residents ransacked Sarail upazila power office and blocked the Dhaka-Sylhet and Comilla-Sylhet highways in Kuttapara village, Sarail upazila, Brahmanbaria district on 25 Oct 2010 demanding uninterrupted power supply.

On October 25, 2010, approximately 50 families protested at a Cambodian Red Cross ceremony in Serei Saophoan town (Banteay Meanchey). The protesters questioned the relief supply distribution process.

The flood survivors residing in Bin Qasim Town staged a protest demonstration against the incident of their relief goods catching fire and said that the officials have set go down on fire to hide misappropriation of relief items on 23 Oct 2010.

Hundreds of people on Saturday held rally in Mogadishu to protest against the continuing deadly Islamist insurgency and call for peaceful resolution of the conflict. The rally held at the Somali government controlled part of Mogadishu was organized by the cities local government and was attended by senior Somali government officials.

Police on Sunday began investigations into circumstances that led to the death of fans at the Nyayo National Stadium during a floodlit Premier League match. Over 380 police officers including a 100 man anti riot police contingent had been deployed to Nyayo National Stadium to provide security during the tension packed match. Four bodies including that of a 21-year old Railways Training Institute student were being preserved at the City Mortuary by Sunday afternoon. Another person who died in the stampede has been identified as a Kenyatta National Hospital based taxi driver.

Students of Ruhuna University in Matara clashed for unspecified reasons, resulting in the injury of 10 students.

Benins police forces violently dispersed a marched in Cotonou protesting against the decision of the interior minister to ban all public manifestations regarding the disapearance of Pierre Urbain Dangnivo.
Lawyers of Peshawar took out a protest rally to support chief justice for maintaining supremacy of the law on 12 Oct 2010.

On 11 October 2010, more than 3,000 protesters gathered to protest in tambon Mueang Kao, Mueang Sukhothai district of Sukhothai, Thailand, after the Fine Arts Department issued an objection to the issuance of land deeds for residents living within Sukhothai Historical Zone area. [size=more than 3000]
PML-N protested against former President Musharraf on 11 Oct 2010 in Lahore in front of the Punjab Assembly. They were protesting his previous actions.
Khairpur journalists continued their protest against an attack on one of their colleagues on 11 Oct 2010.
The relatives of a women who was killed in mysterious circumstances staged a protest demo outside Larka Press Club on 11 Oct 2010.
Looted bus passengers staged a protest demonstration and blocked national Highway for traffic flow in the aftermath of a Highway robbery near Bhitshah on 11 Oct 2010.
The flood affected people of several villages of district Dadu protested against the local administration for removing their names from the lists of watan cards on 11 Oct 2010.

The residents of Bakrani staged a protest demonstration against the NHA and Revenue officials for not providing compensation of lands being acquired for the Larkana-Khairpur Link Road outside the Larkana Press Club on 11 Oct 2010.
Tando Adam residents protested against the negligence of HESCO after two donkeys were electrocuted upon touching a live wire on 11 Oct 2010.
New Saeedabad flood affectees staged a protest with PPP Ladies Wing outside the Hala press club, demanding assistance for flood affectees on 11 Oct 2010.
The activists of the Jeay Sindh Tehreek took out a protest rally against EDO Education Naushahro Feroze and others on 11 Oct 2010.

Flood affectees of Thatta with the leaders of different national parties including STTP, SUP, JSQM and others staged a protest demonstration for issuance of Watan Cards and provision of other facilities to them on 11 Oct 2010.
The traders of Khairpur protested against the Manager of Allied Bank Limited Panj Gola Chowk Branch in Khairpur on 11 Oct 2010.
Population Welfare Department Larkana employees staged a token protest in Larkana on 11 Oct 2010 to demand release of funds, salaries and regularization.

Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) threw stones at a derailed Drutajan Express that killed six BNP supporters at Soidabad near Bangabandhu Bridge, Sirajganj Sadar upazila on 11 Oct 2010. The activists also set the train on fire and beat up its driver. At least 100 train passengers were wounded.

The Bander Sramik-Karmachari Federation of dock labourers staged a demonstration at Chittagong Port on 11 Oct 2010 asking for fulfilment of their demands. The rioters attacked workers of a private berth operator, leaving eight people wounded.
A group of youths allegedly belonging to Bangladesh Chhatra Moitree ransacked an office of Workers' Party of Bangladesh (WPB) in Rajshahi city on 11 Oct 2010.
Potato farmers blocked the Dinajpur-Dhaka highway near Boroil village in Dinajpur Sadar on 11 Oct 2010 demanding compensation for the spoilage of their produce due to the negligence of authorities.
A clash erupted between two groups of students attending tuition class in Kalutara. 2 students were injured while the reasons behind the clash are unknown.

Great number of flood-affected women along with their children and male members were present at the hunger strike camp near World Bank office, Islamabad. They chanted slogans against World Bank and the project on 11 Oct 2010.
Rioters blocked Quetta-Chaman road and stopped all traffic to demand early construction of the highway on 12 Oct 2010.

On 11 Oct, four armed members of Purbo Banglar Communist Party (PBCP-ML), Janajuddha faction were beaten to death by a mob of local residents as they tried to attack the Nolkola village (Sadar upazila, Kushtia).

On Oct 11, four cadres of the PBCP-Janajudhha were lynched by a mob at Nolkola village of Kushtia Sadar sub-district in Kushtia District. They hailed from Mirpur sub-district of Kushatia District. No other information reported.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: Nepali Congress (Lalitpur) accused UCPN (Maoist) cadres of attacking and injuring its activists during a program at Himalayan Hotel in Lalitpur. The Nepali Congress party said that workers associated with the Maoist-affiliated trade union attacked members of the NC-affiliated trade union during a function. Two were reported injured.

Hundreds of flood affectees of village Ghogharo, village Gul Buriro, Garhi Khero and Katchi Pul staged a protest demonstration and observed a token hunger strike against the non provision of relief goods and other facilities at relief camp civil hospital Kamber outside the Larkana Press Club on 10 Oct 2010.
JSQm activists staged a protest against the arrest of their party leader on 10 Oct 2010 in Hyderabad.
a reporter with the Masaka-based Top Radio, has survived being lynched by a mob as he was covering the demolition of a house in Butaya village, Kabonera Subcounty.

assoc_actor_1: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship

assoc_actor_1: JCD: Bangladesh Jatiotabadi Chatra Dal; Students (Bangladesh)
notes: Activists of Jatiyatabadi Chhatra Dal (JCD) and Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) clashed at Rajshahi University campus, Rajshahi city on 10 Oct 2010. At least 11 people were wounded.

Local Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) members staged a hartal in Bonpara bazar, Boraigram upazila, Natore district on 10 Oct 2010 protesting the killing of Boraigram upazila chairman and BNP leader (Noor Babu).

Locals of Dharan padlocked the tax department of Dharan Municipality and demonstrated outside, demonstrating against the hiked unified property tax. They demanded that the municipality should take back the decision.

Clashes with separatists erupted in the Sudanese capital on Saturday as opponents of the countries potential breakup in a southern independence vote due in January demonstrated during a visit by UN ambassadors. Police used batons to disperse around 30 southern independence supporters who were staging a counter-demonstration during the government sponsored pro-unity rally, an AFP correspondent reported.
Unidentified assailants attacked a protest of flood affectees on 9 Oct 2010 in Hyderabad, injuring six civilians.

assoc_actor_1: VRRP: Vietnam Reform Revolutionary Party; Women (Vietnam)

Flood affectees of Naushahro Feroze staged a peaceful protest for the provision of Watan cards and facilities; local police baton-charged them without provocation and severely injured several protesters on 7 Oct 2010.

Hundreds of citizens in Sudans North Darfur State shouted slogans, condemning the United Nations Security Council (UNSC) and supporting the Sudanese president upon the arrival of a UNSC delegation in the states capital of El Fasher. The demonstrators raised banners bearing slogans condemning the UNSC, the International Criminal Court (ICC) and the ICC Prosecutor Luis Moreno-Ocampo, and shouted slogans such as "No for ICC," and "we all sacrifice ourselves for you, Bashir."

Hundreds of demonstrators demonstrated outside the Banke District Court in Nepalgunj to vent their rage against the man accused of kidnapping and killing of two teenage boys in the district. The man had been taken to the court earlier that day. Student and locals outside burned tires, demanding he be handed over to them.

Hundreds of inmates at a Nigerian prison rioted over their exclusion from a government amnesty; over 200 prisoners at the jail in northern Nigerias Bauchi state went on the rampage protesting their non-inclusion in a pardon scheme and torched a section of the prison.
Two men, both at least 70 years old, were lynched by their families in central Mozambique because they were suspected of witchcraft.

notes: Police arrested 70 people of the Federation of Community Forest Users Nepal (FECOFUN) while trying to encircle the Department of Forest in Kathmandu. On September 13, 2010, over 60,000 garment workers started a multi-day strike to protest the revised minimum wage in Phnom Penh. There were no reports of violence, but police arrested three people and confiscated microphones.
The people of the Chandio community staged a protest demonstration against attack on a community doctor at the National Highway on 13 Sep 2010.
The residents of Sawai Road and Nooriabad Colony staged a protest demonstration in Shahdadpur on 13 September 2010, demanding shifting of the Bhittai Cotton Factory outside the residential area.
The residents of village Yousuf Talpur staged a protest demonstration against the actions of a local landlord on 13 Sep 2010.
On Sep 13, a suspected extortionist was beaten to death at Kanthalpota village in Gangni upazila, Meherpur, by a mob.

Two Awami League factions clashed at Sadardi village in Bhanga upazila, Faridpur district on 13 Sept 2010 over establishing supremacy in the area. The rivals also looted and burned houses. One person was killed and 40 others were wounded.
Tea farmers boycott over payment at Thumaita tea company in Kirinyaga East and at Mununga tea factory in Kirinyaga Central.
Students riot and pelt stones at parents, protesting the closure of the school over an administration dispute.
tea farmers riot on Kimunye-Kamugunda road, demanding better pay.

On 12 September 2010, more than 10 activists and students dressed up as ghosts and rallied along the sky train line in Bangkok, Thailand, to commemorate the violence against protesters by the police and military forces. [size=more than 10]
Two rival groups of villagers clashed in Kamargaon village (Kendua upazila, Netrakona district) on 12 Sept 2010 over fishing in a water body. One person was killed and 40 others were wounded.

Hundreds of Burmese workers protested for a week from Sept. 8 to Sept. 15 against their employer, Decha Fishing Net Factory in Khon Kaen province, over low wages. The workers complained that they were being paid less than their Thai colleagues.
Farmers protest in Vredendal, accusing the municipality of favouring commercial farming over their practices.
On Sep 11, one person was killed when two rival groups of villagers clashed over a disputed land at Nalduburi village (Shibganj, Chapai Nawabganj).

Sporadic gunfire rocked Namayingo district Police Station yesterday as results for the Bukholi South NRM parliamentary flag bearer were being announced. The charged crowd became impatient and attacked the district registrar to declare the results. Police shot and killed 1 (though other reports state 3)

The heirs of a flood affectee who died of starvation staged a protest demonstration against the local administration for not providing food and other facilities to them in the relief camps on 10 Sep 2010 in Ghouspur.

Hundreds of people in Somalia demonstrated Friday against a US pastors plan to torch Korans to mark the 9/11 anniversary. Chanting anti-American slogans the protestors marched in Kaxda area south of the capital Mogadishu after Friday prayers.
The journalists of Khairpur protested against registration of alleged fake cases on their colleague, the Information Secretary of the Khairpur Press Club on 10 Sep 2010.

The resident of Digri under the banner of the Ulema Action Committee staged a mammoth protest demonstration against the pastor of a church in US who plans to desecrate the Holy Quran to protest against the 9/11 incident and operating of a local wine den in the city on 10 Sep 2010.

The people of different area in Sindh on 10 Sep 2010 protested against the local administration outside the office of Mukhtiarkar on Thursday for not providing them relief goods including food and medical aid.

The heirs of a flood affectee who died of starvation staged a protest demonstration against the local administration for not providing food and other facilities to them in the relief camps on 10 Sep 2010 in Thul.

The flood affectees residing in different relief camps including Mangi Mari, Kabhti Kanwri and Mehmood Channa protested against the Taluka President of PPP Sobhodero and Mukhtiarkar Sobhodero for not providing facilities including food and others in relief camps on 10 Sep 2010.

The events of 10 September began when dozens of motorcyclists gathered to protest against the previous days murder of fellow-motorcyclist Eddie Sengooba. They went to the home of a suspect in the murder and began to attack it, but turned on Kiggundu when they saw he was filming them. Accusing him of gathering evidence for the police, they beat him unconscious despite his attempts to explain that he was a journalist. He died while being taken to hospital.

Residents of Gambat staged a demonstration against the prolonged power outages outside the Gambat Press Club on 9 Sep 2010. The protesters were carrying banners and shouted slogans against the HESCO authorities. They also burnt tyres and pelted stones at vehicles, blocked traffic for over half an hour.
The activists of the STPP staged a protest demonstration against the investigation police of Shahdadpur for releasing accused burglars on 9 Sep 2010.
Flood affectees whose relative died of starvation recorded a protest demonstration and said that his death was due to the negligence of district administration on 9 Sep 2010 in Sujawal.
Hundreds of Roman Catholics and pro-democracy activists staged a march to push for free and fair elections in Nigeria where polls have regularly been plagued by fraud

Villagers in the Borthong district of Chonburi province demonstrated against the pollution of water sources caused by a nearby toxic landfill. They demanded the facility be shut down to prevent further detriments to their health.

Starting from 8 to at least 10 September 2010, more than 1,000 Myanmar factory workers protested in front of the factory in tambon Nai Mueang, Mueang Khon Kaen district of Khon Kaen, Thailand, after the employer revoked the work permit of their fellow colleagues. [size=more than 1000]
On Aug 9, a student of Narsingdi Government University College was shot and injured by unidentified armed men while protesting against eve-teasing near the college gate at Brahmandi in Narsigndi.

Unidentified assailants attacked Noakhali-6 (Hatia) lawmaker and his companions in Hatiya village, Hatiya upazila, Noakhali district on 8 Sept 2010. The lawmaker was unhurt but six of his companions were wounded. The lawmaker blamed supporters of Awami League for the attack.
On Sep 8, workers of Munnu Ataire Limited staged a protest demonstration at Dhaka-Aricha highway, Manikganj, demanding eid bonus.

On Sep 8, a human chain was formed in front of Aswani Kumar Hall in Barisal city protesting the deaths of three children after EPI vaccination.
Protesting students at the University of KwaZulu-Natals Westville and Pietermaritzburg campuses were involved in clashes with police over campus privatization.

On September 8, 2010, approximately 30 persons from Phsar Chhnang commune protested outside the provincial court in Kampong Chhnang City (Kampong Chhnang). The protesters said that their fishing equipment were destroyed by police and fisheries officials.
Protesting students at the University of KwaZulu-Natals Westville and Pietermaritzburg campuses were involved in clashes with police over campus privatization.

JVP staged a protest in Borella, a suburb of Colombo city, Western, on 7 Sept, against constitutional amendments which would allow the president to serve a third term. Police detained some JVP activists.

The relatives of a kidnapped girl staged a protest demonstration for the recovery of the kidnapped girl and arrest of the accused kidnappers on 7 Sep 2010 in Wah.
Some TFG military soldiers withdrew from key positions in Abdul Aziz and Hodan districts protesting delay of salary arrears payment.
Some TFG military soldiers withdrew from key positions in Abdul Aziz and Hodan districts protesting delay of salary arrears payment.

Different protest demonstrations were staged by the flood victims in the relief camps at Municipal Stadium, Pilot School, Girls College, Degree College, Station Road and other areas against the provision unhygienic food and contaminated water on 7 Sep 2010 in Larkana.

A large number of political and civil society activists held a 'press march' in Karachi on 7 Sep 2010 to raise demand for cancellation of all foreign debts of Pakistan in view of unprecedented losses due to human tragedy of recent floods.

Two PPP activists who were continuing their protest demonstration since several days against the Section Officer of the Irrigation Department, his brother and SPO Mehrabpur committed self immolation outside the Naushahro Feroze Press Club on 7 Sep 2010. They were shifted to SB Hospital.

While talking to newsmen, the Protesters said that they were shifting their goods and valuables to Naushahro Feroze after flood in Mehar, the taluka of Dadu district when the armed men looted them. They added that the concerned authorities have not taken any action against the accused men in the incident.

A protest demonstration was recorded by the residents of different areas of Shahdadpur including Mughal Street, Natiya Goth, Sawati Road, Muhajir Colony and others against the HESCO authorities for continuing several hours of unannounced load shedding on 31 August 2010.

The activists of Jeay Sindh Mahaz district Jamshoro chapter protested against the lack of facilities available at the relief camps in Hyderabad on 31 August 2010.

Employees of airline company Biman Bangladesh rioted at Biman headquarters near Shahjalal International Airport, Dhaka on 31 Aug 2010 protesting against the scrapping of pensions and low pay raises.

Delayed polling results for Wakiso NRM flag-bearers yesterday resulted into clashes between supporters of the incumbent district chairman and those of his close opponent. On August 31, 2010, approximately 300 villagers gathered at the electricity company in Anlong Veng (Oddar Meanchey). The villagers complained about an increase in the price of electricity and demanded that the company reinstall their old electricity meters.

Reported on 30 August 2010, more than 50 villagers demonstrated in front of the local irrigation office in tambon Hat Siao, Si Satchanalai district of Sukhothai province, Thailand, to demand the owed wages from an irrigation project commissioned by the Royal Irrigation Department. notes: Prisoners at the New Generation Correctional Centre riot, hold warders hostage, destroy property.

An uneasy calm has returned to a displaced persons camp in the restive region of Kalma Darfur in western Sudan, where clashes broke out last week over tensions related to the current state of the peace process, UN officials said here Monday. Many protesters were armed with sticks and machetes, and sporadic shooting was heard throughout the camp, according to UNAMID, which reported that a number of people were killed during the disturbances.

On 1 Aug, At least 80 people have been injured after Bangladeshi police fired rubber bullets and teargas, and used batons to disperse textile workers (BGMEA: Bangladesh Garment Manufacturers and Exporters Association) demonstrating for a third day against a new minimum wage they say is derisory. Police said a group of rioters gathered at Savar, in the northern suburbs of the capital, Dhaka, blocking a highway for several hours, jeering at police and pelting them with bricks.

On Aug 1, a man was hit by a car and killed and 50 others were injured as garment workers rioted at Jamgora in Ashulia, Savar upazila, Dhaka, demanding cancellation of the newly-announced wage structure. Angry workers vandalized 22 vehicles and damaged as many garment factories in the area during the clash.

Several hundred pro-democracy activists defied a state of emergency in Bangkok to stage a symbolic protest at the city's Democracy Monument. It was the latest sign of simmering discontent since the army killed scores of activists on May 19.

On 31 July 2010, people of the Khoso community staged a protest demonstration at the Shikarpur-Sukkur road in Sukkur city area (Sukkur, Sindh) to protest against the death of a community man at the hands of the SITE Area Police Sukkur.

Sindh Professors and Lecturers Association (SPLA) held a protest demonstration and observed hunger strike against the transfer of 412 lecturers and professors across the province.

On Thursday, all the doctors of public health facilities left their office to protest while chanting slogans against the police and demanding the arrest of the accused which could be identified in a video footage.

Islami Chhatra Shibir activists staged a procession in Motijheel area, Dhaka on 29 July 2010 demanding the release of three arrested top Jamaat leaders. The activists clashed with the police who charged batons and used teargas. At least 15 people including five police officers were wounded. Five activists were arrested.

On July 29, more than 15 people, including 5 cops were injured in a clash between police and the activists of Jamaat-e-Islami and its front organizations in the Dhaka city's Motijheel area. The clash ensued when JeI brought out a procession demanding release of its detained top leaders and activists as part of scheduled countrywide demonstrations.

Enraged crowd protests during rapists court appearance

Students of Chittagong University demonstrated on 28 July 2010 at Sholoshahar Gate, Chittagong city demanding cancellation of fee hikes and withdrawal of cases filed against students.

Police trainees protest food shortage in Eastern Equatoria State/ One policeman, Owen Bosco, told Sudan Tribune that they marched from the learning wing at Himodonge Hills to Torit town, and gathered at the Freedom Square where they delivered speeches claiming that poor living conditions and food shortage had resulted in seven days without food. Bosco also added that trainees did not receive their food rations for about a week.
Students throw stones at police following a raid on the school.
A protest demonstration was staged by the journalists of Talhar against the attacks on journalists and MS of Taluka Hospital Digri for imposing ban on the entry of the journalists on 28 July 2010.

The same group of ex-militants who stormed Abuja, some weeks ago, to protest their exclusion from the post-amnesty programme, renewed their protest in Warri, Delta State. It is alleged that the police beat workers in order for them to resume working. Conflicting reports indicate that 9 workers were injured, however the police deny that there were injuries.

The demonstrators vandalised parts of the factory and set up a barricade on Hemayetpur-Singair road. Demanding refugee status and donors' support for their livelihood, around 50 Bhutanese refugees started a relay hunger strike in Beldangi-I camp [southeastern Nepal]. The joint struggle committee that has been demanding official registration from government of Nepal () and United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) decided to begin relay hunger strike till they get assurances for ration and refugee status.
Protests in Voi over increased insecurity.

On 26 July, students blocked the Dhaka-Sylhet highway in Madhabpur upazila (Habiganj district) after a fellow student of Sayed Sayeed Uddin Degree College started a quarrel with a bus driver. A subsequent clash with the police left seven students and three transport workers wounded. Two students were arrested.

Over 200 women of Yenagoa Local Government Area of Bayelsa State took to the streets of the capital city, to protest the proposed siting of the Nigerian Law School in their community. They demanded that instead of converting the Bayelsa College of Arts and science, BYCAS premises to the Nigerian Law School campus, the sprawling complex should be upgraded to a College of Education or Polytechnic.

On July 26, JeI protested in Dhaka, the issuance of warrants of arrest against its four top leaders who are now detained in jail. Members of garment workers' trade union (Kendra) staged a demonstration at Muktangon, Shegunbagicha area, Dhaka on 23 July 2010 demanding increase of minimum salary and better working conditions.
As part of an island wide protest awareness campaign, the UNP staged a protest against the government's undemocratic moves and the high cost of living in Bulathsinghala town.
On July 22, rioting workers of a garment factory at Nischintapur in Savar upazila, Dhaka, clashed and injured 12-15 workers.

The members of the lower staff of the Education Department continued their protest demonstration for the eighth consecutive day and staged a sit-in protest at the National Highway for the restoration of their services on 22 July 2010 in Sindh.
The employees of the Sindh University Jamshoro held a protest demonstration here on Thursday against vice chancellor on 22 July 2010.
The activists of the Pakistan Peoples Party (PPP) Taluka Ratodero of Larkana district took out a mammoth protest rally against the media trial of MNA Madame Faryal Talpur on 22 July 2010.
The employees of the local court of Ranipur staged a protest demonstration in favour of their demands on 22 July 2010.
The activists of the JSQM Kotri chapter demonstrated against the increasing incidents of robberies and thefts in Kotri on 22 July 2010 in Hyderabad.
The women residents of Hala Naka Hyderabad staged a protest demonstration against the non-provision of BISP forms to them on 22 July 2010 in Hyderabad.
The employees of the Food Department Naushahro Feroze continued their protest demonstration outside the Naushahro Feroze press club in favour of their demands on 22 July 2010.

The people of the Kashi community staged a protest demonstration and demanded of the concerned authorities to take action against the negligent doctors on Taluka Hospital Sujawal on 22 July 2010.
People took to the streets to protest against continuous load shedding in different parts of Karachi and a highly charged mob blocked roads by setting tires on fire on 22 July 2010.
The leaders and activists of different political parties including the heirs of a deceased Pakistan Peoples Party (PPP) leader took out a protest rally for the arrest of his killers on 22 July 2010.

Representatives of different Christian associations and human rights groups protested outside the Hyderabad press club on 22 July 2010 against the slaying of two Christians in a court's premises in Faisalabad and termed it religious extremism as the cause of the homicide.

The lower staff of courts including readers, stenos and clerks took out a protest rally in favour of their demands on Thursday. The participants marched through various roads of the city and reached outside the Sujawal Press Club on 22 July 2010.

A protest demonstration was staged by the members of the Pakistan Human Rights and the Awami Ittehad against the HESCO authorities for not replacing a burnt transformer of Khursheed Colony on 22 July 2010.
The activists of the Sindh Peoples Youth (SPY) took out a protest rally against anti-democratic elements for terming the degree of PPP MNA Madame Faryal Talpur as fake on 22 July 2010 in Talhar.
The residents of village Kot Bulo Pano Akil staged a protest demonstration against the actions of a few influential men of their area in Sukkur on 22 July 2010.

assoc_actor_1: JCD: Bangladesh Jatiotabadi Chatra Dal; Students (Bangladesh)
assoc_actor_2: JCD: Bangladesh Jatiotabadi Chatra Dal; Students (Bangladesh)
notes: Members of a Jatiotabadi Chhatra Dal (JCD) faction severely beat up an activist of a rival JCD faction at Adarsha High School, Rustompur village, Dakshin Surma Upazila on 22 July 2010. The victim was also severely beaten the next day and later died in hospital.

Students of Islamic University (IU) blockaded the Kushtia-Jhenidah highway in Customs area near Shantidanga, Kushtia Sadar on 22 July 2010, protesting blockades and unrest on campus caused by Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL). Around 20 people including an IU teacher were wounded as the police clubbed demonstrators.

Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) activists halted trips of Islamic University (IU) transport vehicles on the Kushtia-Jhenidah highway near Shantidanga, Kushtia Sadar on 22 July 2010 as they demanded immediate release of four BCL leaders.

Garment workers of Nassa Group vandalised two factories in Nishchintapur village, Savar upazila, Dhaka district on 22 July 2010 demanding removal of factory officials and withdrawal of cases filed against workers. At least 40 people were wounded as rioters clashed with the police.
On 21 July 2010, growers of the Sultani Wah and Phuleli Canal staged a protest demonstration in Tando Bago town (Badin, Sindh) against acute irrigation water shortage.

On 21 July 2010, activists of the Pakistan Peoples Party-Ladies Wing (PPP-LW) Tando Allahyar chapter took out a protest rally in Tando Allahyar city (Tando Allah Yar, Sindh) against "anti-democratic" elements for terming the degrees of 2 PPP MNAs fake.

On 21 July 2010, the activists of the Sindh Taraqqi Pasand Party (STPP) staged a protest and continued their hunger strike on the third consecutive day against the reopening of the Chashma-Jhelum Link Canal outside Karachi Press Club in Saddar town (Karachi, Sindh).

A demonstration was staged over the assault of a Kundasale Pradeshiya Sabha member by police personnel. Demonstrators blocked roads with burning tires - subsequent minor clashes with police forces ensued.
The lower staff of the Education Department a protest demonstration in favour of their demands outside the Dadu Press Club on 21 July 2010.

on 21 July 2010 in Tando Bago the employees of different courts of Tando Bago boycotted their duties and staged a protest demonstration against the non-increase in their salaries.
The members of the Mallah Welfare Association took out a protest rally for the arrest of the killers of Shaheed Ghulam Qadir Mallah, who was killed in Sakrand on 21 July 2010.
The trainees of the BBSYDP demonstrated for the provision of their withheld stipends on 21 July 2010 in Tando Bago.
The lower staff of water management protested against the termination of 2,200 employees of water management in Badin on 21 July 2010.
The people of the Khokhar community staged a protest demonstration against Lady Willington Hospital on 21 July 2010 in Khairpur.
The activists of the Awami Tehreek held a protest rally at Hatri Bypass Road on 21 July 2010 against water shortage, proposed construction of Bhasha Dam and other dams on the River Indus.
The members of the Sindh Peoples Hari Committee staged a protest demonstration against the media trial of PPP MNA Madame Faryal Talpur on 21 July 2010 in Tando Bago.
Parents of students protest for better access to classrooms in Greenbushes.

assoc_actor_1: BCL: Bangladesh Chhatra League; Jubo League; Students (Bangladesh)
notes: Activists of Bangladesh Chhatra League and Jubo League attacked a magistrate team at Kanchpur Bridge, Siddhirganj village, Narayanganj Sadar on 21 July 2010 in order to obstruct the eviction of sand and boulder business structures on illegally occupied banks of river Shitalakkhya. Four activists were arrested.

Garment workers of Nassa Group staged a demonstration in Nishchintapur village, Savar upazila, Dhaka district on 21 July 2010 demanding removal of factory officials and withdrawal of cases filed against workers.

assoc_actor_1: JCD: Bangladesh Jatiotabadi Chatra Dal; Students (Bangladesh)
notes: On July 21, police baton-charged the JCD activists in Muktangon, Dhaka city, who gathered to stage a protest demanding release of their leaders.

On July 21, about 50 people, including women, were injured in a clash between rival groups of two villagers at Chakbazar in Dirai upazila, Sunamganj. The clash ensued following an altercation over a monetary issue.

Relatives of a patient beat up doctors and ransacked Renaissance Hospital and Research Institute in Dhanmondi area, Dhaka on 21 July 2010 over the death of a patient, alleging doctor's negligence. The rioters also attacked Medinova Diagnostic Centre in Dhanmondi. At least ten persons including two doctors were wounded.
Students of the Mangosuthu University of Technology protest over assessment of fees. Police were present, though it is not clear if they engaged the protesters.

Relatives, friends, medical and paramedical staff of a hospital staged a protest demonstration outside the hospital as well as Civil Hospital and in front of the Hyderabad Press Club and demanded the safe recovery of a kidnapped surgeon on 20 July 2010.

The activists of the PPP Youth Wing demonstrated against the media trial of the PPP MNA, Madame Faryal Talpur on 20 July 2010 in Sukkur.

At least 10 students have been arrested in connection with a clash between two groups of students on July 20. The reason of the clash is unknown. Police are investigating.

300 farmers gathered at the Government House in Bangkok, demanding that the current government tackle their debt problems.

Teachers of Dullav Higher Secondary School, Ghyampeshal, Gorkha, who had just returned to the district after being gone for 10 days due to threat from Maoists, were attacked on 10 July. According to the teachers, YCL cadre Dhan Bahadur Gurung thrashed them at Satipipal in Gorkha municipality while they were going to Ghyampeshal on a motorbike. The YCL cadre had received instruction on the phone after identifying the pair, and later vandalised the motorbikes as well. He had apparently been following them for some time that night.
The area journalists of Sukkur staged a protest demonstration against the Punjab Government for passing a resolution against journalists on 9 July 2010.
JSQM activists staged a protest demonstration also against the acute water shortage in Sindh and non provision of Sindh's due share of water on 9 July 2010 in Moro.
The Pasban Thatta chapter took out a protest rally for the release of Dr Aafia Siddiqui from the US on 9 July 2010.

JSQM protesters also marched through various roads and chanted slogans against the Punjab Government and IRSA Chairman. A heavy contingent of police was called to maintain the law and order situation in the city. This took place in Ghotki on 9 July 2010.

The employees of the Forest Department staged a protest demonstration outside the Sukkur Press Club against the Circle Officer of the Forest Department for removing their 26 colleagues from their services on 9 July 2010.
A protest demonstration was recorded by the activists of the Jeay Sindh Qaumi (JSQM) Thatta chapter against the release of water into the controversial CJ Link Canal on 9 July 2010.

JSQM activists recorded a protest demonstration against the reopening of the Chashma Jhelum Canal and illegal and unconstitutional demonstrations over Indus Water by the Punjab on 9 July 2010 in Khairpur.

A clash erupted between JSQM activists and the local shopkeepers as they refused to close their shops, leading to injuries. This took place in Hyderabad on 9 July 2010.

On July 9, former students of Jahangirnagar university formed a human chain in front of National Press Club, Dhaka city, demanding congenial atmosphere on the JU campus.

Two rival groups clashed over construction of a road near a mosque in Deobhog area, Narayanganj city on 9 July 2010. The clash involved supporters of a madrasha committee and a mosque committee. At least 20 people were wounded.
On July 9, NFF continued its sit-in protest and fast-unto-death opposite to the UN office in Colombo city against the UN Secretary General and his decision to appoint an advisory panel on Sri Lanka.

Locals of Siraha halted traffic on the East-West Highway demanding resumption of power supply for the second consecutive day. Hundreds of locals have been staging demonstrations, burning tires and chanting slogans against the Nepal Electricity Authority (NEA) at Mirchaiya.
Residents of Tando Masti including women, children and men recorded a protest demonstration against the Tando Masti Police raid outside the office of the DPO on 8 July 2010.
On 8 July 2010, destitute and deserving women of Pangrio recorded a protest demonstration for issuance of funds of the Benazir Income Support Program (BISP) outside the Pangrio Press Club.

The members of Mehran Teachers Association (MTA) took out a protest rally and stage demonstration in Lakhi Ghulam Shah on Sukkur-Shikarpur Road in protest against deduction in salaries and withdrawal of online facility for getting salaries on 8 July 2010 in Shikarpur.
