Teachers of Dullav Higher Secondary School, in Ghyampeshal, in Gorkha, who had just returned to the district after being displaced due to threat from Maoists, were attacked this afternoon. The principal of the school and a teacher affiliated with the Nepal Teachers' Organization (NTO) were assaulted by a Maoist cadre in district headquarters. According to the teachers, a YCL cadre thrashed them at Satipipal in Gorkha municipality while they were going to Ghyampeshal on a motorbike.

Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) activists looted office rooms of an administrative building of Kushtia Islami University (IU) near Shantidanga village, Kushtia Sadar and fired blank shots on campus on 8 July 2010. The incident occurred as a consequence of a feud between two BCL factions. Five students were arrested.

Residents of Modhupur village adjacent to Kushtia Islami University (IU) in Kushtia Sadar barricaded the Kushtia-Jhenidah highway on 8 July 2010, denouncing the arrest of five IU students accused of vandalism. The demonstrators later clashed with the police leaving 20 people wounded, including five police officers. 20 demonstrators were arrested.
The UNP launched the first of a series of protests around the country against the Government's decision to amend the constitution.
On July 8, NFF organised a sit-in protest and fast-unto-death opposite to the UN office in Colombo city against the UN Secretary General and his decision to appoint an advisory panel on Sri Lanka.

The employees of Biratnagar Customs Office obstructed the Mechi checkpoints the on Nepal-India border and refused to work. They were demonstrating against the chief district officer of Morang, Shashi Shekhar Shrestha, for allegedly manhandling customs officer Man Bahadur Poudel, his family, and subordinates.
A large group of protesters march in Nairobi to denounce plans by members of parliament to increase their own salaries.

The employees of Biratnagar Customs Office staged demonstrations at the Jogbani checkpoint on Nepal-India border and refused to work. They were demonstrating against the chief district officer of Morang, Shashi Shekhar Shrestha, for allegedly manhandling customs officer Man Bahadur Poudel, his family, and subordinates.

Hundreds of Federal Government Pensioners yesterday in Abeokuta protested over the ongoing data processing and verification exercise, alleging that it is cumbersome and lacks adequate manpower and equipment.

On July 7, 2010, Thai protesters blocked Cambodian vehicles from transporting goods across the Thai/Cambodia border in Ou Smach (Samraong, Oddar Meanchey) Cambodia/ Kap Choeng, Surin province Thailand. After negotiation they allowed carts to pass their demonstration but motorbikes were prevented from crossing.

BNP activists were attacked by alleged Jubo League and Chhatra League members while participating in a human chain programme on 7 July 2010 in Khulna city. At least 18 people were wounded, including one critically.

Witnesses say Somalis in towns held by Islamist insurgents are protesting a recent decision by East African nations to send 2,000 more peacekeepers to Somalia. Locations identified as Kismayo, Hiran, Gedo, Middle Shabelle, Bay.

The people of the Malik community, residents of village Bachal Rajpar Ranipur staged a protest demonstration outside the Sukkur Press Club for the provision of justice for a woman who was allegedly murdered for her land. This took place on 7 July 2010.

A group of people staged a protest against the police forces condemning the alleged assault of youths, while they were coming back home after a concert.

A clash broke out between a group of people and the police. The incident broke out after a suspected drug addict was arrested and allegedly injured while in police custody. Police forces have arrested at least 20 persons and the army was deployed to bring the situation under control.

Protest rallies were taken out in Hyderabad to protest against the bombing at Data Darbar in Lahore on 3 July 2010.
Protest rallies were taken out in Larkana to protest against the bombing at Data Darbar in Lahore on 3 July 2010.

The employees of the food department continued their protest against the non-provision of uniform allowance, salary difference bill of the past nine years, non-implementation of the father son quota on 3 July 2010 in Larkana.

Activists of Awami League and its front organisations staged a riot in Hizla upazila, Barisal district on 3 July 2010 demanding trial of war criminals. The rioters vandalised inventories of Jamaat-e-Islami local office.

Thousands of local residents vandalised vehicles, torched a textile factory and barricaded the Dhaka-Mymensingh road on 3 July 2010 in Gazipur city in protest of the rumour that the public agency, RAJUK, was acquiring land in order to build a satellite town in the area.

Around one thousand workers of Hilen Sweater factory staged a demonstration at Adamjee Export Processing Zone, Narayanganj Sadar upazila on 3 July 2010 demanding pay hikes.

Over 10 different groups in Plateau State staged a peaceful protest against the suspension of one of their representatives at the House of Representatives, Hon. Bitrus Kaze.
Over 5000 people staged a protest in Lahore after prayers on 2 July 2010 to demonstrate against the Data Darbar attack.
On 2 July 2010, two women fainted as "Aurat Ittehad' activists observed a token hunger strike outside the local Press Club against the non-provision of gas in Talhar town.
On 2 July 2010, over 5000 people staged a protest in Lahore city (Lahore, Punjab) after Friday prayers to demonstrate against the Data Darbar attack.

Hundreds of students of different government primary schools staged a protest demonstration and observed sit-in protest outside the office of the district Zakat Larkana against non-provision of Mora-scholarship on 2 July 2010.

Sindh Para Veterinary Staff Association (SPVA) took out a rally here on 2 July 2010 in favour of their demands and staged protest demonstration outside the Hyderabad Press Club.

Different political, social, and religious parties staged a protest for recovery of an abducted man outside the Jacobabad Press Club. Jamiat Ulama Pakistan, Jamaat Ahl-e-Sunnat and other parties staged protests in Hyderabad and burnt tyres on 2 July 2010.

On the call of the Jeay Sindh Tehreek and the Awami Ittehad, hundreds of enraged people attacked HESCO office, torched tyres and blocked traffic on roads during a mammoth protest demonstration in Dadu on 2 July 2010 against 12-hour-long power outages on daily basis in the city.

Khaksar Tehreek Larkana chapter observed a token hunger strike outside the Larkana press club against the increasing inflation, unemployment, load shedding scarcity of irrigation water and other issues on 2 July 2010.

The residents of different areas of Hyderabad including Agriculture Complex, Latifabad, Sadar, Pretabad, Chandni Center, Tayyab Complex and others staged a protest demonstration against the prolonged power outages and shortage of drinking water on 2 July 2010.
Jamaat activists vandalised and torched vehicles in the Paltan and nearby Fakirapool areas in Dhaka on 2 July 2010 , protesting the arrest of top three Jamaat leaders.
Bus workers clashed with the owners of a private carrier (Nosiman) on 2 July 2010 at Gangni bus stand, Gangni upazila as they protested the illegal provision of services by Nosiman.
Shibir protesters staged a procession in Brahmanbaria city on 2 July 2010 demonstrating against the arrests of top three Jamaat leaders. Several protesters were arrested.
Around one thousand workers of Hilen Sweater factory staged a demonstration at Adamjee Export Processing Zone, Narayanganj Sadar upazila on 2 July 2010 demanding pay rises.
The nursing staff of Matara General Hospital staged a protest against the extension of the period of nursing studies.
Angry protesters took to the streets of Multan on 2 July 2010, condemning the TTP after two suicide attacks killed 43 people at a shrine in Lahore.
One of the villagers arrested during the protest march in Con Dau, Cam Le District, Da Nang Province on July 2 died the next day from injuries suffered during a beating by civil defense forces.

On July 2, 2010, a clash occurred between police/provincial officials and residents of Kien Svay (Kandal). The residents attempted to block the police and provincial officials from enforcing a court ruling over disputed land in Prek Treng village of Samrong Thom commune. It was reported that some residents were beaten and arrested but was later released when the residents blocked the police truck.
On 1 July 2010, women of village Samang protested against the actions of a local contractor for destroying their fields of different vegetables in Khairpur.
Police and civilians clashed as people gathered outside Data Darbar to protest against the suicide bomb attack in Lahore on 1 July 2010. Four policemen were injured in the clash.
A protest was staged by Jacobabad lower education department staff against unfair treatment of employees in the area on 1 July 2010.
Lower staff of the Education Department staged a protest for their demands in Mirpurkhas on 1 July 2010.
Leaders of parties incl. JST, Sindh United, PPP-SB etc held protests against unannounced loadshedding by HESCO on 1 July 2010 in the Hyderabad area.
Former employees of SRTC demonstrated for the provision of their remaining stipends on 1 July 2010 in Hyderabad
The residents of Somar Lathio staged a protest against the occupation of their agricultural lands in Badin on 1 July 2010.
The members of the All Universities Employees Federation protested in favour of their demands outside Hyderabad Press Club on 1 July 2010.
The residents of Mills Colony staged a protest for the replacement of a burnt transformer in Khairpur on 1 July 2010.

The employees of the Food Department staged a protest demonstration in favour of their demands outside the Larkana Press Club on 1 July 2010. They threatened to burn themselves alive if their demands were not fulfilled.
The workers of the PPP Moro chapter staged a protest demonstration against the party leadership for neglecting them on 1 July 2010.
The people of the Khaskheli community staged a protest demonstration against the actions of an influential man of their area in Hyderabad on 1 July 2010.
A riot was held by the growers of Sujawal against the acute shortage of irrigation water on 1 July 2010. The rioters set tyres on fire on the main road, resulting in a traffic jam.

Residents of village Sharbat Khan Brohi protestsed against the closure of a water course on the alleged behest of a PPP leader in Shahdadkot on 1 July 2010.
A young person has been killed during a violent skirmish between protestors and security forces in the south-western town of Gaoua in Burkina Faso.

notes: On July 1, at least seven JCD activists were injured in an attack by BCL activists at Choumohoni Saleh Ahmed Govt College in Begamganj Upazila, Noakhali during freshers' program ceremony.

One person was killed and 33 others including schoolboys were injured on July 1 as law enforcers opened fire on agitating locals demanding a speed breaker on Dhaka-Mawa highway at Kuchiamora under Sirajdikhan upazila of Munshiganj district.

On July 1, at least 30 workers of Annonto Denim Technology Ltd and pedestrians were injured in a clash between police and rioting workers at Kanchpur Industrial area in Sonargaon, Narayanganj. Workers ransacked the offices of company when they were obstructed from entering the premises.

On July 1, a man was killed and two were injured by police firing on rioters at Kuchiamora in Sirajadkhan Upazila, Munshiganj. Locals were staging a protest demanding a speedbreaker when they entered in to a clash with police using brickbats.
On July 1, workers of a garment factory in Ashulia vandalised the factory during a riot for various demands.

An unidentified group ransacked and attempted to torch the house of Awami League General Secretary of Jhenidah on 1 July 2010 in Stadium Para area, Jhenidah city. The perpetrators are suspected to be members of a rival Awami League faction.

assoc_actor_1: ANNISU(R): All Nepal National Free Students' Union (Revolutionary); Students (Nepal)
notes: Angered over the non-fulfilment of their demands, a group of ANNISU-R activists vandalised the building of Sarada Higher Secondary School at Khanar-4 in Sunsari. Their demands pertained to a change in the existing education policy, and the formation of a Teacher-Student Association.

assoc_actor_2: NULGE: Nigerian Union of Local Government Employees
notes: A clash broke out between rival factions of the NULGE at their headquarters in Abuja. Witnesses reported the clash lasted about an hour and was stopped by police from Utako Police Station.

The demonstrators damaged property and pelted brick backs at the police. Three police officers were wounded and 22 demonstrators were arrested.

The suspended teachers and doctors of Bangabandhu Sheikh Mujib Medical University (BSMMU) formed a human chain in front of the university in Shahbagh area, Dhaka on 30 June 2010 demanding the removal of the Vice Chancellor.
Activists of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) of Rajshahi University (RU) unit staged a demonstration on campus in Rajshahi city on 30 June 2010 demanding trial of tree Jamaat leaders for war crimes.
On June 30, at least 10 people were injured when JeI and BCL activists clashed after JeI activists brought out a procession in the Noakhali district town.

notes: Jamaat and Shibir activists staged a demonstration at Baro Bazar, Kushtia city on 30 June 2010 denouncing the arrest of three top Jamaat leaders. The demonstrators clashed with the police who charged batons and arrested over 100 activists.

Several hundred garment workers rioted against the closure of three factories on 30 June 2010 at Rokeya Sarani, Shewrapara, Dhaka. The police used teargas and water cannons to disperse rioters, who threw brickbats and vandalised several cars. At least 25 rioters and 15 police officers were wounded.
Activists of Jamaat-e-Islami staged a procession in Club Super Market area of Chapai Nawabganj city on 30 June 2010 demanding the release of three top Jamaat leaders. 30 activists were arrested.

On June 30, rioting groups of textile workers, who had blocked roads to protest against the indefinite closure of a textile factory, were baton-charged to clear the Mirpur-Sheopara road they had blocked injuring 10 people, in Dhaka's Kafrul area.
Matatu drivers protests raise in parking fees.
Private bus operators staged a protest against the alleged assault of a bus driver by some merchant. The protesters claimed also the arrest of these persons.
Tambo International Airport workers protest a labour issue.

Nepal Chamber of Commerce and Industries Nawalparasi on Tuesday called a district bandh demonstrating the abduction of an 11 year old school boy. They gheraoed the District Administration Office accusing them of negligence on the deteriorating security situation of the municipality and for failure to capture the abductors of Ashish.

Shibir activists clashed with the police at Shaheb Bazaar area, Rajshahi city on 29 June 2010 during a demonstration against the arrest of top three Jamaat leaders. The police charged batons and dispersed the crowd. At least seven people including two policemen were wounded.

notes: Jamaat and Shibir activists demonstrated on 29 June 2010 in Meherpur city protesting the arrest of three top Jamaat leaders. Four activists were arrested.

notes: Jamaat and Shibir activists demonstrated on 29 June 2010 in Kushtia city, Kushtia district protesting the arrest of three top Jamaat leaders. Four activists were arrested.

notes: Jamaat and Shibir activists demonstrated against the arrest of three top Jamaat leaders on 29 June 2010 in Kasba upazila, Brahmanbaria district staging a procession from Araibari Madrasa, Kasba. notes: Jamaat and Shibir activists staged a demonstration on 29 June 2010 starting at Chawk Bazar Jame Mosjid gate, Faridpur city, Faridpur district protesting the arrest of three top Jamaat leaders. Ten people were wounded as the police charged batons at the demonstrators.

assoc_actor_1: JeI: Jamaat-e-Islami; ICS: Islami Chhatra Shibir; Students (Bangladesh)
notes: Jamaat and Shibir activists protested against the arrest of three top Jamaat leaders on 29 June 2010 at Chapainawabagnj-Sonamasjid Highway, Mohananda Bridge area, Chapai Nawabganj town, Nawabganj district. 12 Jamaat activists were arrested.

notes: Jamaat and Shibir activists protested against the arrest of three top Jamaat leaders on 29 June 2010 and into the morning of 30 June in Truck Road area, Chandpur city, Chandpur district. Four Jamaat activists were arrested.

Students of Hajee Danesh Science and Technology University (HSTU) located at Basherhat Dhaka-Dinajpur Highway, Dinajpur Sadar attacked several campus buildings including the vice chancellor's residence on 29 June 2010 demonstrating against the authorities' decision to close the university. 10 students were wounded as the police charged batons.
UNP staged a protest inside the Parliament against government budget for 2010.
More than 150 students staged a protest against two ministers who were attending an opening ceremony at Peradeniya University.

assoc_actor_1: NAWOJ: National Association of Women Journalists; MWAN: Market Women Association of Nigeria; Women (Nigeria)
notes: A coalition of women groups who were on a peaceful protest over the alleged manhandling and suspension of Hon. Doris Uboh and 10 other members of the House of Representatives were barred from entering the National Assembly complex in Abuja.
Protesters gather to oppose a bail hearing for an accused rapist.

Police yesterday arrested some loyalists and supporters of (PDP) governorship aspirant in Akwa Ibom State, Senator James Udoedehe, who staged a peaceful protest in Uyo, the state capital over the arrest and detention of the governorship aspirant by the Nigeria Police Forces.

Tension flared in the Teku area of Kathmandu when the police started to evict the Young Communist League (YCL), youth wing of the UCPN-Maoist from the house of Shashi Shrestha on Tuesday morning. A minor clash ensued when cadres of the YCL prevented the police attempts to demolish the house of Shrestha.

assoc_actor_1: JHU: Jathika Hela Urumaya; Buddhist Group (Sri Lanka)
notes: JHU staged a protest with the support of other Sri Lankan political parties against the appointment of a Panel of Experts by the UN Secretary General Ban Ki Moon to advise him on the alleged war crimes committed during the last phase of the war in Sri Lanka.

Awami Tehreek (AT), Sindh Taraqqi Pasand Party (STPP) and Bheel Ittehad (BI) held a joint protest and blocked the traffic against the kidnapping of a 17-year-old girl on 28 June 2010. This took place in Nabisar.
The activists of the PPP Youth Hyderabad took out a rally in the favour of Senior Sindh Minister for Education Pir Mazhar-ul-Haq on 28 June 2010 in Hyderabad.
Members of the All Sindh Universities Employees Federation took out a rally from SP Chowk to the Hyderabad press club in favour of their demands on 28 June 2010.
The activists of the JSQM Tando Jam chapter demonstrated against a builder mafia in Hyderabad on 28 June 2010.
The members of the Sindh Para Veterinary Staff Association protested in favour of their demands on 28 June 2010 in Hyderabad.
The people of the Bheel Community protested against an influential landlord of their area for not giving their wages on 28 June 2010 in Hyderabad.
The residents of Phuleli staged a protest demonstration against the actions of area police on 28 June 2010 in Hyderabad.

Students of Fine Arts department of Rajshahi University (RU) in Rajshahi city confined university Proctor, Department Chairman and three teachers to their offices on 28 June 2010 protesting an increase in exam fees. Students also vandalised the university's property.

Students of the Hajee Danesh Science and Technology University (HSTU) located at Basherhat Dhaka-Dinajpur Highway, Dinajpur Sadar staged a protest on 28 June 2010 on campus against the punishment inflicted on 15 students for instigating violent clashes on campus during 16 - 17 May 2010.
Matatu drivers protests raise in parking fees.

On June 28, 2010, approximately 50 families from Anlong Veng (Oddar Meanchey) protested in front of Wat Botum in Phnom Penh to draw attention to their lack of infrastructure. The families who were recently relocated said that they no longer had access to farmland, clean water, schools and health centre.
Nigeria Postal Services (NPS) retirees, Ogun State branch, yesterday embarked on a protest, accusing the management of non-payment of their 49 months retirement arrears.

On June 27, during the countrywide dawn-to-dusk hartal called by the BNP, some of its protesting leaders were injured after the police baton-charged them, injuring 20 in Barisal district headquarters.

In Birganj, traders and Hindu groups erupted in demonstration following the murder of the chief the Hindu Yuva Sangh organisation that had become involved in anti-Maoist vigilante activities. It is suspected that the UCPN(M) were involved.
A protest demonstration was recorded by the activists of Sindh Taraqqi Pasand Party (STPP) against different problems outside the Shahdadpur Press Club on 27 June 2010.

In Sukhekhi, scores of people, including relatives of detained Former president of Bank of Punjab (BoP), the main accused in BOP scam case, staged a protest demonstration. The protesters claimed that the accused, using influence of police officers, had clutched 800 canals land of his relatives.

The residents of Lasbela protested against against the prolonged and unannounced loadshedding in their respective areas. The affected residents blocked the traffic for hours and torched tyres to obstruct a prominent Chowk. They also raised slogans against the management of KESC and the federal minister, who had claimed that there is no loadshedding in the country.
People in Kuchlak protested against the increase in transport fares.
The dwellers of Kuchlak staged a protest demonstration against the increase in transport fares.

On May 15, at least 10 activists were wounded after BCL leaders attacked them with lethal weapons when they were protesting against the alleged sexual harassment of a female student by a BCL leader in Sylhet city's Polytechnic Institute.

The residents of Katchi Abadi in Islamabad staged a protest to stop operation against encroachment launched by Capital Development Authority (CDA). The residents of Katchi Abadi in Islamabad staged a protest to stop operation against encroachment launched by Capital Development Authority (CDA).. The protestors were chanting slogans against CDA. against encroachment. The protestors were chanting slogans against CDA. against encroachment would not be stopped on immediately then they would block all roads of Islamabad and stage citywide protest.

Lecturers, political parties and social welfare activists protested in Shahdadkot against the attack on a lecturer of a local government girls' college. Protesters raised slogans against the attackers and called for early arrest of the people nominated in the FIR.

assoc_actor_1: PUASA: Punjab University Academic Staff Association

Three hundred prisoners of District Jail, Naushahro Feroze, protested against the non provision of facilities by the jail administration. Residents of Slave Island staged a protest condemning the removal of their houses by the UDA.
Inhabitants of Kiganda, Bururi, have demonstrated against recruitment of electoral agents from other areas.

Residents of Mkuze protest poor service delivery, demand mayor resign.
Students of Rangpur Cantonment Public School and College blocked the Rangpur-Dinajpur highway demanding action against the driver of the truck which ran over a student, in Rangpur city on May 11.

Protest and violent clashes marred the ruling Unity Partys national convention in Ganta, Saturday with some partisans denouncing the process relative to delegates selection.
On May 11, 2010, 500 residents of Santuk (Kampong Thom) protested the closure of a dam in their district in 2009, which they believe is the reason for the flooding of their farmlands.

Following the withdrawal of the nationwide strike, the Maoist cadres had been prohibited from demonstrating in the area.

A oil spill sparked a protest as hundreds of residents conveyed their displeasure of the incessant oil spills in the region.

Pensioners give the Osun State government 14 days to pay payments owed for 65 months or they plan on organizing protests.

The subordinate staff of the special courts functioning under federal ministry of law and justice observed peaceful protest inside the accountability courts. They pressed their demand for granting and raising certain allowances.
All Pakistan Private Schools Association (APPSA) protested in Islamabad against plans of imposing Value Added Tax on private schools.

Hundreds of value added mill owners, workers and labourers staged a protest demonstration in Multan (indication chowk clock tower not sure if in Multan) to press for their demand for total ban on export of cotton and yarn, which they claimed was harming the value added textile industry. The protestors chanted slogans in favour of their demands and marched on various city roads.

Thousands of UCPN-M members and supporters who came to the capital during the strike took part in the mass assembly.

A rival group of AL activists ransacked a podium raised for a local AL meeting and placed obstructions to stop the motorcade of an AL MP after a dispute over not being invited to the function in the Manirampur upazila of Jessore district on May 8.

YCL cadres assaulted newspaper distributor Chandra KC, and accosted Rabin Kattel, a local reporter of Udgosh Daily, in Dhankuta.

On the fifth day of the Maoist general strike, youth groups demonstrated against the strike in Inaruwa in the morning. They heading to open shops in the markets and throughout the town. Meanwhile, large numbers of security personnel were deployed to contain any unwanted situation.
A peaceful rally calling on the Maoist leadership to withdraw the indefinite strike was held in Tanahun district.

Locals set fire to the tents that were erected by the Maoists, and damaged the food materials there. Locals also smashed the windscreen of two vehicles belonging to the Maoists, and set fire to a Jeep carrying food to the strike enforcers. They also looted gas cylinders, furniture, food and tents from the Maoists' shelter in City Hall.

Residents of the Pulchwok, and Dhobighat neighbourhoods in Patan held anti-strike demonstrations on the fifth day of the nationwide bandh.
In Dhobighat, Patan, locals attacked YCL activists who were seeking donation.

Tensions ran high in Lothar Bazaar of Makawanpur today after clashes occurred between locals from Manahari and Lothar over the death of Sudip Karki. The day before, the Youth Force member, along with other 20 youths on motorbikes, were attacked by Maoist bandh enforcers while on their way to Lothar after opening the markets in Manahari. A similar protest and clash occurred just after the attack. Additionally, Manahari locals vandalized some of the houses in Lothar and set some furniture of fire. Some of the locals fled their homes for the fear of more violence. 200 police personnel were mobilised in the area to avert further clashes.

Hundreds of local residents, professionals, and civil activists participated in an anti-strike rally in Kirtipur, shouting anti-bandh slogans and demanding that the Maoists respect the people's rights to free movement and work.
Residents of several Kathmandu neighbourhoods including Golfutar, Sinamangal, Basundhara, and Galkupakha, held anti-strike demonstrations on the fifth day of the nationwide bandh.

notes: Following an incident between Maoist demonstrators and police earlier in the day, angry Maoist cadres set fire to the police post at the Traffic Chowk in Butwal (Lumbini, West).

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: A clash between Youth Force and UCPN (M) cadres occurred at Dhankuta on the fourth day of the nationwide indefinite bandh.

assoc_actor_1: JSQM: Jeay Sindh Qaumi Movement; Students (Pakistan)
notes: In Khairpur, activists of JSQM and its student wing took out a rally to protest against the target killing of JQSM workers. They carried banners and placards inscribed with anti-government slogans.

On May 5, at least 8 people were injured when two rival groups of villagers from Kholagiri village (Raninagar, Naogaon) clashed with each other over a land dispute and a long-standing dispute to establish supremacy in the area.
On May 5, students of the Jahagirnagar University held demonstrations in front of the VC office for reducing session fees and evicting illegal occupants from the dormitories, in Savar town.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: Trucks protected by armed guards carried food and fuel supplies into Kathmandu on Wednesday, as former rebel Maoists enforced the fourth day of their general strike. Shops, schools and offices were closed except for two hours each evening as Maoists staged mass rallies and threatened anyone who defied the strike. Some demonstrators tried to blockade government offices, but staff were able to get past them.
Residents protest against landlords and eviction notices

On May 5, 2010, approximately 110 villagers from Prey Pdao commune in Takeo province protested in front of the National Assembly in Phnom Penh. Villagers were protesting the alleged violence by the police against the previous day's protesters.

Boat owners and the fishing community in Karachi organised a protest demonstration recently (hence time precision 2) against an increase in diesel prices. As part of the protest, a large number of boats that operate from jetties in Ibrahim Hydri, Rehri, Chashma Goth were not moved to the sea for fish catch.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: In Makawanpur, a member of Youth Force was killed when an group of Maoist demonstrators hit him with stones on 5 May. According to police, 20-year old Sudip Karki, who was riding a motorbike from Manahari to Lothar, was killed after the demonstrators hurled stones at him in Sunachari.
In Syangja, locals held a rally against the nationwide bandh from Gunikhola to Bankhola along the Siddhartha Highway.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: In Pokhara, Maoist cadres set fire to a motorbike, accusing the rider of defying the strike. They also vandalised a barber shop in the Bagar neighbourhood.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: On the fourth day of the nationwide bandh, Maoist cadres set fire to a motorbike and assaulted the bike rider in Mirchaiya, Siraha district.
Locals in Mechinagar demonstrated against the UCPB(M)-imposed nationwide strike.
A group of UCPN(M) aligned YCL thrashed shopkeeper Sharadananda Chaturbedi in Galkupakha, Kathmandu, for allegedly defying the bandh.

In Bara, farmers and vegetable sellers dumped vegetables on the streets of district headquarters Kalaiya. The farmers threw bottle gourd, bitter gourd, lady's finger, and other vegetables. They shouted slogans against Maoist Chairman Puspa Kamal Dahal 'Prachanda' and urged the Maoists to call off the strike, saying they were incurring huge losses due to the bandh. The farmers have not been able to supply their produce to the markets as vehicles are off the road.

assoc_actor_1: MJF: Madhesi Jana Adhikar Forum, Nepal
assoc_actor_2: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: In Janakpur, the cadres of Madhesi People's Rights Forum organised a rally in Janakpurdham demonstrating the nationwide strike. The situation remained tense as the Maoists too held a rally in support of the strike.
Locals in Dhulabari demonstrated against the UCPB(M)-imposed nationwide strike.

In Dhading, farmers of Ghanbesi, Baireni and Khanikhola threw vegetables on the road, while those from Baireni spilled 500 litres of milk. They also stopped a dozen milk tankers heading towards Kathmandu to draw the government's as well as the Maoists' attention towards difficulties facing them. They were demonstrating the fourth consecutive day of the Maoist imposed bandh, which has caused a them great financial loss.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: On the fourth day of the nationwide bandh, Maoist demonstrators assaulted local journalist Kashiram Sharma in Birendranagar, Surkhet district.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: On the fourth day of the nationwide bandh, Maoist demonstrators vandalised the office of Nirdhan Utthan Bank Limited in Bharatpur.

At least two gunshots were heard while the YCL cadres were chasing away the YF cadres after the latter demonstrated against the general strike. The two youth groups were demonstrating from early morning in Bhaktapur Durbar Square. Both sides accused the other of firing, and the conflict was only resolved when police intervened. No injuries were reported.

A protest rally was taken out by the Jeay Sindh Qaumi Mahaz (JSQM), to protest against the target killing of their party workers. Hundreds of participants, carrying flags, banners and placards, chanted slogans and demanded that the authorities arrest the killers of JSQM workers.
Activists of the Jeay Sindh Qaumi Mahaz (JSQM) staged protest demonstrations in Hyderabad against the target killing of JQSM workers.

A large number of city traders staged protested in Rawalpindi against the government's plan of imposing Value Added Tax (VAT), loadshedding, inflation and prices of petroleum products. The protesters carried placards inscribed with slogans against government, loadshedding, VAT and fuel prices, marched and burnt tyres

Farmers and tenants protested against the auction of Evacuee Trust Property Board land in Muzaffargarh. The protesting tenants said they had been cultivating the land for the last 50 years and they had leveled it to make it cultivatable so they were its rightful owners and they alleged that the land was being given to former army and intelligence officials, bureaucrats and the relatives of politicians.

In Lahore, the Daily Passengers Association (DPA) Pakistan Railways and the Lahore High Court Bar Association protested against the manhandling of president DPA by a special ticket examiner in Lahore.
The family of a minor girl, who was abducted from a park, lodged a protest in Lahore. Protesters tried to stop the motorcade of PML-N patron Nawaz Sharif, but the police prevented their attempt.

The MQM staged a protest outsidein Layyah against the auction of prime properties. Protestors condemned selling out of properties, which according to them, was being done to cover up the fiscal mismanagement by the Punjab government
Hundreds of villagers demonstrated against the killings and demanded the arrest of killers who were involved in a tribal clash between members of the Shora and Kori tribes in Sukkur.

An imprisoned leader of PUDEMO was reportedly found, hanged in his cell. The police call it a suicide. PUDEMO, however, believe he was murdered, and publicly accuse the government of Swaziland of murder.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: On May 4, the third day of the nationwide bandh, thousands of Maoist cadres and supporters, staged a demonstration in Kathmandu city. The bandh remained largely peaceful with only minor clashes between police and demonstrators being reported.

assoc_actor_1: IUSF: Inter University Students' Federation; Students (Sri Lanka)
notes: A clash between students and police forces ensued a demonstration organised by the IUSF outside the University Grants Commission asking the reason behind the shortening of the Alight Health Sciences (AHS) degree duration from four to three years. Students were reportedly injured.
Disagreement among students leads to violent riot

assoc_actor_1: JSMM: Jeay Sindh Muttahida Mahaz; Students (Pakistan)
notes: After the arrest of Pakhtoon students for inciting violence, SPSF activists in their support blocked a highway and a railway crossing, and students belonging to JSSF and JSMM staged protest demonstrations outside the university hospital and Jamshoro press club.

Tribal students from Gomal University, Dera Ismail Khan, staged a protest in Islamabad demanding to waive the fee of the students affected by the ongoing war on terror in South Waziristan Agency and elsewhere in the tribal region. Students chanted slogans and held placards inscribed with demands of remission in their fee and other expenses.

assoc_actor_1: NC: Nepali Congress; CPN(UML): Communist Party of Nepal (Unified Marxist-Leninist); Students (Nepal)
notes: In Solukhumbu, students close to the Nepali Congress and CPN-UML staged demonstrations against the nationwide banda. They urged the Maoists to withdraw the strike as soon as possible.

In a clash between Pakhtoon students and nationalist groups at the Liaquat University of Medical and Health Sciences (LMUHS) campus Jamshoro, four students received injuries while eight were taken into custody by police.
On May 4, two rioting AL groups clashed over a failed arbitration meeting in the Barisal Sadar upazila, injuring 15 people.

Jaffna University's Vavuniya Campus students staged a demonstration during which they blocked access to the campus to demand that university authorities provide them with basic requirements such as food and drinking water.
PPP workers gathered outside the Accountability Courts and staged a protest, demanding early arrest of Benazir Bhutto's killers.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: Maoist cadres forced vehicles off the road in Udaypur, on the third day of the strike.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: On May 4 the third day of the UCPN(M) imposed indefinite banda and following rioting by Maoist in the Satungal, Kathamndu more than 3,000 locals emonstrated against the band and allegeldy attacked three Maoist cadres, leaving one critically injured.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: On May 4 the third day of the UCPN(M) imposed indefinite banda, Maoist bandh supporters stopped a driver and vandalised his motorbike on his way to the hospital. No injuries reported.
On the third day of the nationwide bandh, farmers of Salayanghat in Dhading district also demonstrated against the Maoist strike by dumping vegetables on the road.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: In Gorkha, Maoist activists vandalised the District Post Office and the Clean Energy Development Bank during the third day of the indefinite banda.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: Two government offices were vandalised by demonstrators in Rukum district for defying the banda on the third day of the indefinite strike.

assoc_actor_1: MJF: Madhesi Jana Adhikar Forum, Nepal
notes: In Janakpur, Dhanusha, on the third day of the Maoist indefinite banda, Madhesi Janadhikar Forum-Loktantrik (MJF-L) activists took to the streets to protest the strike. MJF-L district chairman, vice chairman, secretary, and various other leaders marched in a demonstration rally that later converged into a corner meeting.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: Maoist banda enforcers vandalised three motorcycles in the morning along the Koshi Highway for defying the strike in Sunsari.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: Maoist demonstrators resorted to vandalism in Hetauda on the third day of the nationwide, indefinite bandh. The Maoist cadres vandalised the Land Revenue Office and the municipality office in Hetauda. The incident led to a loss of property worth Rs 1.5 lakhs.

On the third day of the nationwide bandh, farmers in Chainpur VDC, in Chitwan, spilled vegetables on the road after not being able to sell and transport their vegetables to major market places in Kathmandu and Narayanghat. Even though the UCPN(M) had officially assured the safe passage of vehicles carrying vegetables on the road, Maoist cadres obstructed them in some places.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: Maoist demonstrators resorted to vandalism in Butwal on the third day of the nationwide, indefinite bandh.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: Locals at Pushpalal Chowk in Biratnagat retaliated against the Maoist cadres who were forcing people to shutdown their shops on the third day of the indefinite strike. The locals retaliated after the cadres tried to vandalise a medical shop and a retail shop in the morning. Wielding iron rods, the locals chased away the Maoist cadres. Two Maoist cadres were hurt. Beforehand, the Maoists also vandalised two shops and a motorcycle. The cadres were also asking for donations and food from the locals at Pushpalal Chowk.

On the third day of the nationwide bandh, farmers in Bhandara VDC, in Chitwan, spilled vegetables on the road after not being able to sell and transport their vegetables to major market places in Kathmandu and Narayanghat. Even though the UCPN(M) had officially assured the safe passage of vehicles carrying vegetables on the road, Maoist cadres obstructed them in some places.

On May 4, police clashed with local Catholics at a cemetery in the village of Con Dau, Cam Le District in Da Nang. When protesting parishioners attempted to bury the remains of a local parishioner in a cemetery, which authorities had closed in March, police intervened. Parishioners reportedly attacked police who were blocking the entrance to the cemetery, and violence between police and parishioners ensued.
Students of Thekwini Further Education and Training College in Asherville protested school management.
A group of women to took to the streets of Benin City to protest against government action to force on-street trading to be held to a higher standard on an ascetic level.

On May 4, 2010, a group of villagers in Srok Prey Kabbas (Takeo) protested the construction of a road that would destroy existing fences. The villagers said that three of them were beaten by police but this was denied by officials.

On May 4, 2010, approximately 87 workers at a garment factory in Mean Chey district protested in front of the Ministry of Labour in Phnom Penh. The workers alleged that they were prevented from working or earning a salary for most of April because they were not assigned shifts.
On May 4, 2010, approximately 200 residents of Svay Rieng province travelled to the home of the Senate President in Kamchay Mear (Prey Veng) to protest the detention of a community representative.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: According to the police, Maoist cadres with batons vandalised an ambulance in Kapilvastu.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: Maoist cadres vandalised the office of Nepal Supply Corporation in Kalaiya of Bara on the third day of the indefinite strike.

In Lahore family members and relatives of a man, tortured to death allegedly by 2 security guards of a housing society, staged a protest against the act of the security guards and blocked a main road by keeping the body of the deceased man the middle of the road.

In Gujjar Khan, the workers of PPP took out a protest rally to condemn the alleged high handedness of the tehsil municipal officer (TMO) meted out to the tehsil and city presidents of PPP.The workers blocked a main road and chanted slogans.

Members of the grand Jirga of Khattak elders protested in Karak and demanded withdrawal of a case/FIR registered against the rovincial minister. Protestors claimed that claimed that a fake case had been registered against the minister as he was under treatment at a hospital at the time of the crime.
The All Pakistan Clerk Association (APCA), Upper Dir chapter, protested against the delay in implementation of Pay and Pension Committee's recommendations regarding government employees.
Youths protest a flood that has affected their building, with no State assistance.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: Clashes between Maoist demonstrators and police were reported at Gongabu on Monday evening, where police resorted to blank firing.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: A clash erupted in the Gangabu area of Kathmandu between Maoist activists and police during the second day of the Maoists' indefinite nationwide strike Monday evening. The clash ensued after the agitating Maoist activists vandalised a motor cycle at Samakhus for defying the strike. Police fired two rounds in the air and burst tear gas shells to disperse the angry crowd and take the situation under control. No injuries or other physical damages were reported.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: The second day of general strike called by the Unified CPN (Maoist) as part of its fourth phase agitation against the coalition government saw large number of Maoist cadres brought from various districts to Kathmandu. They staged demonstrations on the streets of Kathmandu by singing, dancing, and occasionally chanting slogans against the government, demanding that it step down. Although the major marketplaces were shut, smaller shops in the city interiors were open briefly in the morning, and emergency services remained functional. For the most part the second day of the strike was peaceful. Maoist activists marked their presence in major thoroughfares of the capital including Kalanki, Koteshwor, Baneshwor, Chabahil. No cars plied the roads.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: While enforcing the second day of the nationwide bandh, Maoist cadres vandalised a bank in Butwal.
Police intervene journalists protesting for an inquiry into the recent death of an editor while in jail.
Members of the NUJ protest the killings of their collogues.
On May 3, a group of rioting BCL activists vandalised vehicles, ransacked shops belonging to AL activists and injured 10 people in the attack, in Pabna district town.
On May 3, BCL activists vandalised six vehicles and left 5 people injured for defying the strike that the BCL called at the Chittagong University to protest the death of its activist.
On May 3, two rival BCL factions clashed with each other over the formation of new district committees, in the Pabna district town, injuring at least 25.
Hundreds of people came out in support of an assaulted local AL leader and demanded the arrest of the assaulters, by placing barricades and blocking the Rangpur-Bogra highway on May 3.
The BNP organised a protest march in Dhaka towards the Election Commission to protest against its decision to hold a repoll in the Bhola-3 constituency, on May 3.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: In Rupandehi, Maoist cadres vandalised Ratriya Banijiya Bank, a garment store, and two motorcycles for defying the nationwide strike.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: UCPN(M) supporters vandalised a drugstore and beat up its operator at Prithvichowk of Pokhara on May 3, while enforcing the second day of a nationwide bandh. A three-year-old boy was also hurt in the conflict.
On May 3 in Prithvichowk, Pokhara, locals resorted to protest after Maoist cadres vandalised a shop and attacked earlier in the day.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: Workers and Maoist cadres in Pokhara participated in anti-government demonstrations on the second day of the nationwide bandh.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: The local office of Nepal Telecom was ransacked by strike enforcers in Bara during the second day of the UCPN(M) imposed nationwide strike.
Locals in Mustang district demonstrated against the UCPN(M) imposed nationwide bandh on the second day, leading the Maoists to agree to lift the bandh in the district.

Vegetable farmers from some parts of Chitwan district demonstrated the ongoing Maoist strike by dumping their produce on the highway. The farmers had no outlet to sell their goods due to the market shutdowns.
Egyptian police detained a protester when scuffles broke out at a pro-reform demonstration in central Cairo.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: On 3 May, on the second day of the anti-government strike, Maoists burnt the effigy of Prime Minister Madhav Kumar Nepal at Tamghas city (Gulmi district, Lumbini).

On May 3, 2010, approximately 200 residents protested in front of the district police office in Romeas Haek (Savy Rieng). The residents demanded the release of representatives who were arrested in connection with an earlier land dispute protest.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: On the second day of the UCPN(M) nationwide bandh, Maoist activists staged demonstrations chanting anti-government slogans in Kupondole, Patan.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: In Sunsari, Maoists clashed with local youths following a dispute over vehicular movement on the second day of the nationwide strike. Two Maoist cadres were injured.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: In Dharan, Maoist activists assaulted Rabin Rai for biking during the second day of the strike.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: On the second day of the UCPN(M) nationwide bandh, Maoist enforcers threatened shop owners in Dhankuta into closing. They also threatened journalist Ramesh Chandra Adhikari not to write against them.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
assoc_actor_2: CPN(UML): Communist Party of Nepal (Unified Marxist-Leninist)
notes: On 3 May, Maoist cadres hurled stones at UML activists participating in a funeral procession in Dhankuta, causing injuries to some of them.

In Dhankuta, shops were opened after Hindu Yuva Sangh and Youth Force cadres took out a rally from Bhimnarayan Chowk to Madan Chowk, appealing shopkeepers to defy the strike. Youth Force district coordinator Prabin Pokharel said they had demonstrated the strike after the Maoists had threatened shop-owners to shut the market.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: On the second day of the strike, Maoist cadres and demonstrators closed industries and business enterprises along the Dharan-Biratnagar corridor. Demonstrators also padlocked Biratnagar Sub-metropolis office.
A large number of people in Hyderabad ransacked the HESCO office, damaged the furniture and tried to set the records on fire in a riot against prolonged loadshedding.

assoc_actor_1: ANNISU(R): All Nepal National Free Students' Union (Revolutionary); Students (Nepal)
notes: The Maoist affiliated All Nepal National Independent Student Union (Revolutionary) obstructed grade XII examinations in six centres in Bhimdatta. They entered the exam halls and tore up all question papers and misbehaved with teachers and students. A clash with police at Mahendra Higher Secondary School left at least one police personnel badly injured. He was taken to hospital with damage to his eye. The Maoists had been enforcing the nationwide bandh throughout the city.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: In Gharipatan in Pokhara, UCPN(M) cadres threw stones at 3 houses after UML cadres attacked them with stones from the roof-top of the houses. Police inspector Puran Puri was injured in the incident. Maoist cadres also threatened bank employees not to open the banks during the bandh.

assoc_actor_1: ANNISU(R): All Nepal National Free Students' Union (Revolutionary); Students (Nepal); UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: A student sustained bullet injuries when police opened fire at a group of protesters in front of Maiya Devi Kanya College in Bharatpur, in Chitwan District on 2 May. Police also fired nine rounds of tear gas canisters to disperse the crowd when cadres of ANNISU-R tried to disrupt the Class 12 examination going on in the college on the first day of the indefinite nationwide general strike called by UCPN(M). Four students and two media persons were also injured.

On May 2, local villagers staged a protest against the resettlement of Burmese Muslim refugees in third countries in front of the Kutupalong refugee camp in Ukhia upazila in Cox's Bazar district, alleging that UNHCR's resettlement program has attracted more refugees into their country.

Punjab University students protested and displayed banners and placards against the forced expulsion of 107 students from the university. The protesters also condemned the target killing of Balochistan University's Assistant Professor.

On 2 May, residents of several villages staged a peace rally to allay fear among people following the recent suicide attack in Mingora. The Protestors asserted that they would not be scared by suicide bombings. Security forces personnel also attended the rally.
Two social organisations-Peace Vision and Brotherhood- came together to form a human chain to protest against the instances of harassment against women in the Brahamanbaria district town on May 2.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: UCPN(M) bandh enforcers stormed local hospitals, forcing them to close. Emergency services, however, were allowed to resume. They also closed several government offices.
A group of at least 40 students were involved in a clash, which resulted in 2 students being admitted to the hospital and eight students being arrested. The reason for the clash is unknown.

In Rawalpindi, people belonging to the Christian community held a protest demonstration against a Member Provincial Assembly (MPA) belonging to PML-N for occupying a church with the help of armed men. Holding banners, posters and placards inscribed with statements for protection of places of worship, the participants were chanting slogans against PML (N), Punjab chief minister (CM), police high ups and district administration.

In Islamabad, the All Parties Minorities Alliance (APMA) organised a rally to celebrate their representation in the Senate and pledged to play their role in nation building. Provincial and National Assembly members, religious leaders, representative of NGOs and different section of the society participated in the rally. Hundreds of people held placards and banners praising the government for empowering minorities in the country.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: The first day of the nationwide indefinite strike called by the UCPN (Maoist) saw some incidents of vehicular vandalism in Palpa district. Bandh supporters also disrupted exams.

notes: The first day of the nationwide indefinite strike called by the UCPN (Maoist) saw some incidents of vehicular vandalism in Rupandehi district.

notes: Maoist bandh enforcers disrupted exams being held in Salyan district by storming the exam halls. Many people were injured in the clashes.

notes: Maoist banda enforcers disrupted exams being held in Gorkha district.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: The first day of the nationwide indefinite strike called by the UCPN (Maoist) remained mostly peaceful in the Kathmandu, with two vehicles (a tourist bus, and a private car) being pelted with stones by demonstrators.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: In Bara district, UCPN(M) banda enforcers vandalised two government offices and padlocked all others, on the first day of the nationwide strike.

notes: Maoist bandh enforcers disrupted exams being held in Dang district by storming the exam halls. Many people were injured in the clashes.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: More than 10 Maoist activists were hurt in Dailekh district headquarters when examinees at Saraswati Higher Secondary School fought back. Four of nine exam centres there postponed the exam due to the clash. The Maoists had been enforcing the UCPN(M) nationwide strike.
Students demonstrated against the UCPN(M) after the exam distruption and clash earlier in the day.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: Maoist bandh enforcers disrupted exams being held in Dadeldhura district by storming the exam halls. Many people were injured in the clashes.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: Banda enforcers vandalised two offices and a shop in Butwal for defying their the UCPN(M) nationwide strike.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: Banda enforcers vandalised a hotel and some shops near Rani Bhansar area in Biratnagar during the first day of the nationwide indefinite strike called by the UCPN (Maoist).

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: The first day of the nationwide indefinite strike called by the UCPN (Maoist) saw some incidents of vandalism in Chitwan district.

Protesters gather, shouting "Down with Mubarak!" One arrested after many began a fight with police after they used batons to push them back. The reason for the protest was to demand an end of a 30 year emergency rule restricting several freedoms.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: A team of UCPN(M) cadres led by Rodh Bahadur closed the office of Human Rights Awareness and Social Development Centre in Tikapur, Kailali, while enforcing the nationwide strike.

Protesters clamoured for a boost to Egypts minimum wage, the latest in a series of demonstrations demanding help for millions of poor Egyptians and greater political freedom in a tightly controlled nation.
On May 2, 2010, approximately 100 residents of Tras commune gathered in front of a rubber company in Romeas Haek (Savy Rieng) to request the reopening of a road that had been cut off for 5 days.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: Estimates of 150,000 Maoist supporters demonstrated in the streets of Kathmandu on Saturday in a large show of force to press the coalition government to relinquish control to the UCPN(M). Security was on high alert amid fears the demonstration could lead to widespread violence or another civil war. Riot police were posted at all major city intersections in the Capital, and thousands of security personnel had been deployed to avert violence. Parts of the city were a sea of bright red flags waved by demonstrators who chanted: "Dissolve this puppet government and set up a national government." Owing to the demonstrations, major commercial hubs in the Kathmandu Valley closed and business activities came to a standstill, although an official bandh was not in place. The protests remained peaceful all day.

notes: On 30 April 2010, around 500 UDD demonstrators blocked all airport exits at Khon Kaen city (MKK, KK) and stopped all outbound vehicles looking for Dr. Tul Sitthisonwong, who had arrived to lead a peace gathering against UDD protests. Also, at the same time a group of red shirts sealed off Khon Khaen's public relations office, demanding that a pro-government TV show be taken off the air.

Muslims riot, targeting Christians and Christian churches in an apparent reprisal attack from an earlier offence.

Traffic was also disrupted in the Capital as a result of the demonstrations.
Lawyers and judicial workers protested against unfavorable working conditions.

The ethnic orgnisations staged rallies in different places in the capital before picketing the CA building. YCL cadres were also present in the demonstration.
ANC members stage a counter protest near a Democratic Alliance celebration/rally. No reported violence.

notes: NSU riots continued another day in the Capital, instigated by the arrest Nepal Students' Union (NSU) Vice President Bishnu Poudel for his alleged involvement in the attack on president of the CPN-UML-aligned All Nepal National Free Students Union (ANNFSU) Samik Badal and three other ANFSU leaders with sharp-edged weapons on Tri-Chandra College premises on April 12. Police clashed with students and journalists outside Trichandra College during which they also lobbed few tear gas shells and charged with batons to disperse the striking mob. Journalists of Shahpur Jahania protested outside their local press club against an attack on one of their colleagues.
