Workers of the Mazari oilfield took out a procession and blocked the station road in TMK to demand payment of their salaries and regularization of their services.

At least 25 people were injured when a group from Sriramkandi village clashed with a group from Danga village over a dispute around the payment of wages, in the Danga village of Tungi Para upazila in Gopalganj on April 25.

The students of Pabna University of Science and Technology put up barricades on the Dhaka-Pabna highway to protest against the increase of fees, in front of the university campus in Pabna district town on April 25.
The PML-Q held a rally and sit-in involving hundreds of demonstrators at the Chauburji Chowk against inflation and the imposition of the value-added tax.

assoc_actor_1: ANNISU(R): All Nepal National Free Students' Union (Revolutionary); Students (Nepal)
assoc_actor_2: ANNFSU: All Nepal National Free Students' Union; Students (Nepal)
notes: Students of UML-aligned ANNFSU and Maoist student wing ANNISU-R clashed on Sunday at the Institute of Engineering in Lamachaur of Pokhara, leaving 3 hurt. Sunil Pokharel and Shreedhar Tamata of the ANNISU-R and Chakra Thapa of the ANNFSU sustained injuries in the clash that ensued when the two sides were on their way to lock up Campus Chief and Assistant Campus Chiefs Sailendraraj Khanal and Loknath Pudasaini in their respective offices for not fulfilling Free Students Union's 12-point demand. Following the clash, ANNFSU students vandalised the FSU office.

assoc_actor_1: ANNISU(R): All Nepal National Free Students' Union (Revolutionary); Students (Nepal)
notes: 5 activists of the ANNISU-R, under the leadership of ANNISU-R District Treasurer Suman Rokka, vandalised Roji Boarding School for defying the strike call at Lamahi in Dang on Sunday. They broke windowpanes, furniture and caused damage of about Rs. 40,000.

assoc_actor_1: ANNISU(R): All Nepal National Free Students' Union (Revolutionary); Students (Nepal)
notes: All private schools across the country were called to stay shut on Sunday due to the indefinite nationwide closure instigated by the ANNISU-R. ANNISU-R activists vandalised a school bus belonging to Bhanu Memorial School in Biratnagar, reportedly because the school refused to pay a large donation to the group.
Barbaig women protest governmental allocation of land
200 ex-militants protest their lack of payment promised by the government to end their active militancy under amnesty.

assoc_actor_1: ANNISU(R): All Nepal National Free Students' Union (Revolutionary); Students (Nepal)
notes: All private schools across the country were called to stay shut on Sunday due to the indefinite nationwide closure instigated by the ANNISU-R. In Dhangadhi, ANNISU-R activists assaulted several principals of different schools defying the bandh, in addition to vandalising Malika Boarding School at Campus Chowk.

assoc_actor_1: ANNISU(R): All Nepal National Free Students' Union (Revolutionary); Students (Nepal)
notes: All private schools across the country were called to stay shut on Sunday due to the indefinite nationwide closure instigated by the ANNISU-R. Maoist cadres vandalised Siddhartha Memorial Academy, and New Environment Ever shining School in Butwal, for defying the bandh.

assoc_actor_1: ANNISU(R): All Nepal National Free Students' Union (Revolutionary); Students (Nepal)
notes: All private schools across the country were called to stay shut on Sunday due to the indefinite nationwide closure instigated by the ANNISU-R. In Surkhet, vandals targeted Adarsharaj Memorial Boarding School in Birendranagar for defying ANNISU-R the bandh and carrying out admissions.
People of New Pind held a massive demonstration in protest against delays in construction of an overpass.

A JI organized march from Lahore to Rawalpindi against power outages, inflation, imposition of the value-added tax and US interventions in Pakistan arrived at Rawalpindi Railway Station where they demonstrated.
The PTI held a protest rally against power outages and inflation.
Truck drivers blocked the Quetta-Jacobabad highway to protest against the kidnapping of 2 drivers in Sibi district.
Members of the Owevwe community protest the Delta States non-construction of a 13-kilometer road in the area.

The Punjab University Academic Staff Association staged a demonstration to demand the arrest of IJT students allegedly involved in assaulting a member of the university's staff who was involved in expelling IJT students.
Journalists staged a demonstration to protest the increasing incidents of police "high-handedness" against media people.
Female health workers serving at different Sindh Government Hospitals staged a rally in front of the Karachi Press Club to protest against their transfer to the interior of Sindh.
Journalists of Larkana protested outside the local press club against the arrest of TV reporters of Taluka Thull.
Journalists protested against the alleged torture of their colleague Ghulam Hussain Soomro and demanded the authorities take action against those responsible.

Baloch students in Islamabad staged a protest demonstration against the alleged killing of a woman and abduction of more than 250 residents of Killi Qambarani after a search operation conducted by FC personnel. The demonstrators included activists of the National Students Federation and Workers Party Pakistan.
Contract-based employees of the Education department protested for the regularization of their services (specific locations not given).

Two groups of PPP members protested against each other over differences related to the appointments of primary school teachers. Other PPP members also protested against the EDO Edcuation of allegedly selling jobs to favoured candidates.
Activists of the STPP protested against the shortage of water and prolonged power outages. The demonstrators blocked roads and staged a sit-in outside the HESCO office.

Police from different areas of Naushahro Feroze allegedly barged into the Budh community, disrespected women and children, and arrested a 12 year old boy. The community then protested on the National Highway against the actions of the police.
Residents of Mehar protested against HESCO officials for prolonged power outages.
2 people were killed in a clash over a land dispute in Girgit village of UC Khan Jo Goth near Mehar.
The Shehri Ittehad Action Committee protested against HESCO after they were assured of substantial reductions in power outages which did not materialize.
"A protest demonstration was staged by deserving and downtrodden women of New Saeedabad against what they call unfair distribution of lands".
On April 24, at least 100 people were injured when two rival groups of villagers clashed over a land dispute at Dighli village (Chhatak, Sunamganj).
On 24 April, at least 50 people were injured after two rival groups clashed a paddy harvesting dispute at Diara Char (Matlab upazila, Chandpur).

Decrying the UCPN (Maoist)'s act of torching CPN-UML's district office in Nawalparasi, all the political parties active in the district staged a joint protest rally. Activists and district leaders from Nepali Congress, Tarai Madhes Loktantrik Party, Madhesi Janadhikar Forum, Madhesi Janadhikar Forum-Loktantrik, CPN-ML, Rastriya Janamorcha, Nepal Sadbhawana Party, among other parties, came together against the Maoist in the demonstration.
Muslim youths riot, targeting Christians seeking revenge for the death of a Muslim teenager.
Hundreds of people including a large number of women from Kot Ghulam Muhammad protested against water shortages.
A large number of KESC workers staged a demonstration outside the Karachi Press Club against the recent sacking of 294 of their colleagues and to demand their reinstatement.
Residents attacked the city's water works office and vehicles due to water shortages and based on alleged corruption in the offices.

Residents of different areas of Hyderabad, including Phuleli and Pritabad, protested in front of the local press club against corrupt health department staff after veterinary medicine was used by local health officials.
The Rawalpindi Rickshaw Association staged a protest demonstration against the "'bhatta' mafia" and to demand the authorities do something to free the rickshaw drivers from their control.
The All Pakistan Truck and Trolley Motor Owners Association staged a protest and token sit-in at Shah Alam Chowk against the government for not apprehending killers of their president.

Residents of Dhullay area of Gujranwala protested, blocked GT road and the railway track, and set fire to a train after 2 people were killed in a crossfire between 2 rival groups in the area. Police used batons and tear gas to disperse the protesters who placed the bodies of the deceased on the tracks.

Large numbers of residents of Darmalak, Hoti, and Chanda Fateh Khan villages who were blocking development work on the expansion of a gas supply facility to demand gas supply for their area held a protest after talks between their elders and the MOL company failed.

A 72-hour protest camp was set up outside the Parliament House in Islamabad, attended by parliamentarians from tribal areas, political workers and "common tribesmen", including JI and JUI-F members to demand reforms for tribal areas.

Leaders and activists of different political and business groups blocked Karakoram Highway in Battagram to block the visit of the Hazara Province Movement, whom they blame for recent violence, to the adjacent Kohistan district. They were peacefully dispersed.

assoc_actor_1: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship
assoc_actor_2: Health Workers (Thailand); Police Forces of Thailand (2008-2011)
notes: On 23 April 2010, UDD guards demanded entry to the Chulalongkorn Hospital in Pathum Wan district (PW, Bangkok) to search for a pro-government physician, Tul Sitthisomwong, and his "multicolour groups". They stormed in with metal pipes and sharpened bamboo stakes. Police were incapable of removing them and they were allowed to search the first floor of the hospital. Afterwards, they withdrew.

assoc_actor_1: ANNISU-R: All Nepal National Independent Students' Union-Revolutionary; Students (Nepal)
notes: On 23 April 2010, at least eight school buses were set ablaze or vandalised when UCPN-Maoist-affiliated All Nepal National Independent Students Union-Revolutionary went on a rampage in the capital. Private schools were the target after allegedly defying the group's orders and opening the account sections of the schools without their consent. The group had been attempting to keep them shut via padlock in an attempt protest tuition hikes.
Police fired on supporters of a defeated gubernatorial candidate who attempted to destroy a radio station.
Supporters of a defeated gubernatorial candidate attempted to destroy a radio station.
Youths protest outside a shopping centre to demand employment.

Different protests occurred in Lahore: The Revival of Heritage NGO organized a peace walk attended by large numbers of youths and activists. They marched from the Holiday Inn Hotel to the Lahore Press Club; the Punjab University Academic Staff Association protested for a violence-free academic atmosphere on campuses and to demand the arrest of those allegedly involved in the attack on a professor at their university by IJT students.
After local police conducted a raid on a naroctics den in Mohallah Pathan in Pakpattan, people of the Pathan community protested against the arrest of men from their community.

Activists of Nepal Students Union (NSU) staged a chakka jam to protest the arrest of its cadres at 9 am on Friday in Kathmandu. The students affiliated with the NSU of the Tri-Chandra, Padma Kanya, Shanker Dev, Pashupati and Amrit campus staged a chakka jam for an hour demanding the unconditional release of the vice president of Free Students Union (FSU), Tri-Chandra Campus Bishnu Prasad Poudel and leader Santosh Neupane.
The lower staff of the education department staged a protest in favour of their demands outside the local press club.

assoc_actor_1: STPP: Sindh Taraqi Pasand Party; Labour Group (Pakistan); Marri Communal Group (Pakistan)
notes: Different protests occurred outside the Hyderabad Press Club: members of the Pakistan Small Unit Power Looms Association protested against the prolonged power outages; employees of a private cold drink company protested against non-provision of bonuses; activists of the STPP protested against the WAPDA SDO of their area for lodging cases against STPP leaders; people of the Marri community protested against the occupation of residential land; drivers of the Zubaida College Hyderabad protested against the former Additional Director of the college; people of different areas protested against HESCO authorities for power outages.

assoc_actor_1: ISO: Imamia Students Organization; Students (Pakistan); Hakro Communal Group (Pakistan)
notes: Different protests occurred in Sukkar: residents of different areas protested against power outages and water shortages; people of the Hakro community protested against the actions of the Bagirji police, setting tires on fire and blocking traffic; workers of the Imamia Students Organization protested against bomb attacks across the country.

Leaders and workers of the PPP party staged a rally which started at the District Council offices and marched to the local press club to express solidarity with the president and support for the 18th amendment.
A large number of female candidates who passed the PST tests protested against the non-issuance of job offers.
Dozens of "destitute and deserving persons" organized a protest rally outside the local press club against the Ushr & Zakat district chairman.
Local residents protested against the authorities of the BHP oil company for not carrying out development works in the region.
After 2 people were electrocuted in Makrari village near Moro, the relatives of those who died protested against HESCO officials.
A protest demonstration was organized by farmers against the actions of the local food inspector for alleged corruption.
A protest demonstration was staged outside the local press club by the residents of different villages against the engineer of the Rohri Irrigation Department nepotism.
On April 23, at least 27 people were left injured after AL and BNP activists clashed with each other in Dhaka's Mirpur area.

BCL activists from the Rajshahi University of Engineering and Technology barricaded the Dhaka-Rajshahi highway to protest the arrest of two BCL leaders for a factional clash at the university two days ago, on April 23.
On April 23, dozens of AL and BNP activists were injured in clashes, in Bhola's Lalmohan upazila, a day ahead of the by-elections in the local Bhola constituency.
On April 23, one person was killed and 15 injured when AL and BNP activists clashed with each other over a land dispute in Bokter Char, in Keraniganj upazila of Dhaka district.
On April 23, the opposition BNP brought out a procession to protest against the Election Commission's conducting of the Bhola-3 by polls, in Dhaka.
Embilipitiya school principal was assaulted by the parents of some students.
2 protest rallies in favour of the Hazara province were held after Friday prayers in Abbottabad and organized by the IJT.
Students at administrative centre in Ruyigi province throw stones against colleagues over interrupted lessons.
In Songkhla Province, people gathered to voice support for the monarchy, the Abhisit-led administration, and the military force.
In Satun Province, a group of 4,000 people marched through local streets to express support for the monarchy and the nation.
There was a pro-government rally in the southern province of Nakhon Sithammarat, aimed a demonstrationing against red-shirt activity in Bangkok.

assoc_actor_1: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship; Black Shirts
notes: On 22 April 2010, 500 PAD demonstrators gathered at the Saladaeng intersection in Bang Rak district (BR, Bangkok) to demonstrate against the Red Shirt demonstrations. Both sides hurled rocks, bottles and petrol bombs and fired slingshots. Riot police intervened and badly beat some PAD demonstrators. At around 8pm, three M79-launched grenades were fired towards the PAD demonstrators presumably by the Black Shirts. They caused limited damage. Two more were fired which killed at least one person and injured 78, including several foreign nationals. Pro-government demonstrators then started looking for UDD red shirts and beat up at least four suspected supporters and tried to lynch them. The police came to stop them which caused the pro-government demonstrators to clash with them. The police chased them behind military lines and blocked the road so no more pro-government demonstrations could take place.
On 22 April 2010, a large number of WAPDA employees protested in Mehrabpur city (Naushahro Feroze, Sindh) against the mugging of a WAPDA official and demanded those involved be arrested.

Tension ran high on several Kathmandu college campuses including Tri-Chandra, Shankar Dev, Padmakanya, and Amrit Science, after police arrested Nepal Students' Union (NSU) Vice President Bishnu Poudel for his alleged involvement in the attack on president of the CPN-UML-aligned All Nepal National Free Students Union (ANNFSU) Samik Badal and three other ANFSU leaders with sharp-edged weapons on Tri-Chandra College premises on April 12. NSU cadres pelted stones at police personnel while the latter lobbed teargas shells to disperse the mob. NSU affiliated students also clashed with police in Putalisadak, Kathmandu, after some of them pelted stones at Chief Justice Ram Prasad Shrestha.

At least seven people including a police official were injured when local entrepreneurs and youths demonstrating prolonged power cuts clashed with police in Rajbiraj. The clash ensued when police tried to bar the demonstrators from padlocking the local office of Nepal Electricity Authority.

Army and police personnel who left service during the armed conflict, called a western region bandh (shutdown protest), during which enforcers set a truck on fire and vandalized three other vehicles at Ghansikuwa.

assoc_actor_2: BCL: Bangladesh Chhatra League; Jubo League; Students (Bangladesh)
notes: On April 22, 5 protesters were injured after their protest against the crisis in the power and water supply was attacked by the BCL and Jubo League activists in Dhaka city.

About 300 people composed of women and children held peaceful demonstrations in Boondheere, Shangani and Hamar Weyne districts in Mogadishu region. The demonstrators condemned the disputes between the TFG Executive and the Legislative. A2/Demonstration/ (0/10)/ (00)/Mogadishu/Banadir/20100422.1023

About 300 people composed of women and children held peaceful demonstrations in Boondheere, Shangani and Hamar Weyne districts in Mogadishu region. The demonstrators condemned the disputes between the TFG Executive and the Legislative. A2/Demonstration/ (0/10)/ (00)/Mogadishu/Banadir/20100422.1023

About 300 people composed of women and children held peaceful demonstrations in Boondheere, Shangani and Hamar Weyne districts in Mogadishu region. The demonstrators condemned the disputes between the TFG Executive and the Legislative. A2/Demonstration/ (0/10)/ (00)/Mogadishu/Banadir/20100422.1023
A protest demonstration was taken out by the social workers of Thatta against the local police for arresting the husband of one of their colleagues.
After a girl died at a hospital in Mirpur Khas, her family staged a demonstration against the district authorities for allegedly not providing the proper health facilities to the local people.

Police raided houses of the Jatoi community, at which point the people present resisted them. The police resorted to a baton charge and critically injured 5 women and 4 men. The police also allegedly tortured people during the raid.
Jatoi community members protested against the actions of police during a raid on their community's houses where they say they tortured men women and children.
Activists of the PPP-SB protested outside the local press club against power outages and water shortages.

Aerial firing was reported in the localities of Nagin Chowrangi and Korangi following an attack on an SSP activist. A large number of the activists and sympathizers of the SSP staged a protest march with the man's body from the hospital to the activists home while chanting against the authorities.
Students block Ijenda-Matana commune road, tear political parties flags to protest lack of classes for a month.
On April 22, at least 5 BCL activists were injured in a clash between two rival BCL factions over establishing supremacy in Rajshahi's Rajshahi University of Engineering and Technology.
On April 22, rioting AL activists clashed with BNP activists who were holding a demonstration in Dhaka city.
On April 22, AL and BNP activist clashed with each other in Bachamara village of Dawlatpur upazila in Manikganj over a land dispute, injuring 5.
Thousands of indigenous (adivasis) brought out a procession and held a rally to push for their 5-point demand centred around land rights in the Nawabganj district town on April 22.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
assoc_actor_2: CPN(UML): Communist Party of Nepal (Unified Marxist-Leninist)
notes: Cadres of the UCPN(M) and CPN(UML) parties clashed in Ghatgaun on 22 April. Six persons from both sides were injured. The CPN-UML claimed that the Maoist cadres had come from Birendranagar, the district headquarters, to attack them, while the UCPN-Maoist accused the cadres of CPN-UML of attacking its cadres after pulling them out of their houses.

assoc_actor_1: ANNISU(R): All Nepal National Free Students' Union (Revolutionary); Students (Nepal)
notes: ANNFSU supporters today took out a demonstration rally in Diktel bazaar and staged sit-ins in front of District Police Office and District Administration Office, demanding the release of Mahesh Rai, one of their members arrested after a clash with ANNISU-R member earlier the same day.

assoc_actor_1: ANNISU(R): All Nepal National Free Students' Union (Revolutionary); Students (Nepal)
assoc_actor_2: ANNFSU: All Nepal National Free Students' Union; Students (Nepal)
notes: At least two students were injured when ANNISU-R cadres clashed with ANNFSU cadres in Diktel Multiple Campus. The clash flared up after ANNFSU students demonstrated Maoist-affiliated ANNISU-R activities, claiming that the organisation worked against the agreement in the passing out ceremony.
Protests occurred in Sukkar against power outages.

Different protests occurred in Lahore: The All Pakistan Truck Association staged a protest at a truck stop in Lahore; dozens of PPP workers demonstrated outside the Lahore Press Club in support of the Chairman of the Evacuee Trust Property Board and vowed to counter moves to oust him.
Residents protested against power outages.
Protesters in Bahawalpur blocked roads and burned tires while demonstrating against power outages.
Transporters protested the "growing tragic incidents of highwaymen blocking the national highway" after a turck driver was kidnapped at gunpoint in the Dera Murad Jamali area.
Arua vendors riot over oders to relocate

assoc_actor_1: NEHAWU: National Education, Health and Allied Workers Union
notes: NEHAWU protests at the office of the Premier over wage discrepancies.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: On April 21, the UCPN (Maoist)-aligned Trade Union Federation (Revolutionary) imposed a shutdown and staged demonstrations in Gaidakot, Nawalparasi district to protest the death of its worker injured in yesterday's clash with the CPN-UML affiliated labourers at the Gorkha Brewery.

assoc_actor_1: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship
notes: On 21 April 2010, several hundred UDD supporters in Khon Kaen district (MKK, KK) blocked the rail line to Bangkok preventing the departure of a railway carrying military vehicles and equipment to Bangkok.
A group of approximately 2,000 multicoloured shirts gathered at Wong Wien Yai Monument to demonstrate opposition to the red-shirt movement.

assoc_actor_1: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship
assoc_actor_2: Labour Group (Thailand); PAD: People's Alliance for Democracy
notes: On 21 April 2010, the pro-government protesters made up of the Silom Road local business community, and the 'Multi-Coloured Group' which was PAD, skirmished with anti-government Red Shirt activists at Saladaeng intersection outside the Dusit Thani Hotel in Bang Rak district (BR, Bangkok). From 6-11pm shouts and insults were exchanged but little violence occurred. Around 11pm a group of 20 or so pro-government demonstrators began throwing rocks and firing slingshots which prompted the UDD red shirts to respond with homemade rockets, beer bottles, rocks and marbles. A number of people were injured in the clashes. After 11:45pm, police finally deployed to end the violence after the pro-government demonstrators attacked and beat a foreigner with a black armband.
Rioters clashed with police. Rioters set tires on fire to protest pres. Election results. Police responded by beating rioters.

At least fifty people including policemen, newsmen and garment factory workers were injured in a four-hour long clash between police and workers at Kanchpur area on Dhaka-Sylhet highway under Sonargaon thana in Narayanganj district on April 21.

assoc_actor_1: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students; Students (Nigeria)
notes: Rioting students prevent police from arresting a politician.
Markazi Anjuman Tajran organized a hunger strike camp against power outages, inflation and the proposed value-added tax at Fowara Chowk in Rawalpindi.
On 21 April 2010, 300 women staged a protest against the shortage of electricity in front of a SPDC building in Sittwe, Rakhine State.
School teachers staged a protest demonstration against delays in the resolution of teachers problems, including "unjustified deduction from salaries and 100 percent enhancement of the wages".

Different protests occurred in Larkana: Members of the Shaheed Benazir Bhutto Insaaf Committee observed a token hunger strike outside the local press club; a protest demonstration was staged by the local journalists against the Larkana police for a raid staged against one of their colleagues.

Different protests occurred in Dadu: The relatives of two abducted women staged a protest demonstration for their recovery outside the local press club; lower staff of the education department protested outside the local press club for regularization of their services and withheld salaries; people of the Shahani community protested outside the local press club against the killing of Ghulam Mustafa Shahani.
"Destitute and deserving women" protested outside the local press club to demand zakat funds.
Farmers of Puran Branch continued their protest at Kanti-Tyre Khakhar road against shortages of irrigation water.
A demonstration was staged by the residents of Sehwan Sharif against power outages and water shortages.

Different protests occurred in Moro: Residents of Chhutal Shah and relatives of a man protested to demand the arrest of his killers outside the local press club; residents of Abdullah Buriro village protested against police after a police raid where women were allegedly violated.
Members of the Highway Employees Union staged a protest rally and march against the District Officer of Roads for perceived corruption.

Activists of the JSQM staged a protest rally for provision of compensation to the family of their deceased colleague who committed suicide. They marched on various roads and staged a sit-in on Chhati Chowk (specific location not given).
Former KESC employees held a protest rally in front of the Karachi Press Club against "their illegal retrenchment". The rally was later dispersed peacefully.

Members of the Sathiyo community, residents of Khalifa Soomar Sathiyo village, demonstrated against the TMK police outside the TMK press club after the death of a man during a police raid a few days ago.
A 2-hour token hunger strike and demonstration were staged by the JSMM outside the local press club against alleged police failures to arrest the killer of a student leader.
On April 21, at least 15 people were injured when two rival groups of villagers clashed at Uttar Chailla village (Sadar upazila, Manikganj) over a land dispute.
At least 30 people were injured when two rival BCL groups clashed with each other after an altercation between two rival group members in Savar's Jahagirnagar University on April 21.
Students of Eden Girls College and Dhaka College blocked the Azimpur-Mirpur road on April 21 to protest against faulty examination papers in Dhaka city.
On April 21, 12 people were left injured when two rival groups of villagers clashed with each other over a longstanding land dispute at Zadurchar (Savar upazila, Dhaka).

assoc_actor_1: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students
notes: Large numbers take to the streets protesting the witch-hunting of a politician by his opponents.

On April 21, 2010, over 100 residents of Thmei commune in Sen Sok district protested outside the Prime Minister's house in Phnom Penh. The residents opposed a planned drainage system that they believe would negatively affect 600 families.

Demonstrations were held in Sunwal, demanding compensation for the family.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: On April 21, the UCPN (Maoist)-aligned Trade Union Federation (Revolutionary) imposed a shutdown and staged demonstrations in Daldale, Nawalparasi district to protest the death of its worker injured in yesterday's clash with the CPN-UML affiliated labourers at the Gorkha Brewery.
Residents of Malhal Mughlan protested against cement factories in the area for allegedly causng intense water shortages.
Residents of Pind Dadan Khan besieged the WAPDA offices to protest against power outages. The protesters burned tires as well.
Hundreds of traders and residents of "three-marla scheme" and Islami Colony of Islamabad blocked Airport road to protest against power outages. Protesters were peacefully dispersed.

Different protests occurred outside the Hyderabad Press Club: PPP-SB Hyderabad members protested against the registration of cases against their party leader; members of the Syed community protested for the recovery of a child from the community; members of various social organizations protested to demand peasants in the area be given their due by landlords; members of the Solangi community protested against the superintendent engineer of the irrigation department.
A group of locals in Songkhla gathered to oppose the red-shirt demonstration, stating that the demonstrators are hindering the nation's progress.

assoc_actor_1: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship
notes: On 20 April 2010, the red shirt group of demonstrators barricaded all six entrances to their protest site on Ratchaprasong intersection in Pathum Wan district (PW, Bangkok) and continued to demonstrate despite warnings from the government that force would be used to disperse them.

Over 5,000 people from various public groups gathered in front of Chon Buri's provincial hall to urge the prime minister not to disband the House and to show their support for the Thai police and military.

In Phuket, about 500 peoplegathered to submit an open letter addressed to Prime Minister Abhisit Vejjajiva. The letter stated that Phuket citizens support the prime minister and oppose House dissolution.

Over a thousand people from various districts gathered in front of Nakhon Si Thammarat provincial hall to express their concerns regarding national security and to voice their opposition against red shirt demonstrations as well as the actions of red shirt core leaders.
In Krabi, 200 people gathered in front of Krabi Hospital to read a statement that condemned the red-shirts' threat of violence to pressure the government to disband the House.
In Payao, over 100 people read a statement condemning the red-shirt group's breach of the Constitution and its threat of violence.

assoc_actor_1: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship
assoc_actor_2: Labour Group (Thailand); PAD: People's Alliance for Democracy
notes: On 20 April 2010, large groups of demonstrators, including local residents and vendors, led by PAD leader Sittisomwong staged counter demonstrations to the UDD red shirts on Silom Road outside the UDD red shirts protest camp at Saladaeng junction in Bang Rak district (BR, Bangkok). The two sides had a series of small clashes during that night. PAD sent out their supporters in both yellow shirts and plainclothes to give the impression that ordinary Thais were reacting to UDD red shirts protests.
A university student is gang-raped by six men. Students, angry of the violent action gather on the local magistrates court when a suspect was receiving a hearing to protest the action.

Protest demonstrations occurred for a 2nd day during a cultural show at the Islamic International University. Student demonstrators demanded the university administration expel an IJT student who allegedly "thrashed" female students.
On April 20, members of the Muttahida Irrigation Federation protested outside the Civil Hospital of Sukkar city (Sukkur, Sindh) against an attack on their colleague by unidentified men.
On April 20, locals protested in Sukkur city (Sukkur, Sindh) against a kidnapping.
The members of the All Sindh Education Department Lower Staff rallied in favour of their demands in front of the local press club.
JI members protested against the Peshawar bomb blast on Monday that targeted their rally against power outages.
Activists of the PPP protested in Hala and Bhitshah against the DCO Matiari for alleged favouritism.
Farmers of Kandh Kot protested outside the local press club against the non-provision of seeds and their inability to sell their wheat for reasonable prices.
Activists of the PPP protested in Hala and Bhitshah against the DCO Matiari for alleged favouritism.

The inmates of the Central Jail of Hyderabad staged a protest against the jail administration for allegedly not implementing the orders of the President of Pakistan in terms of remissions of sentences.

Different protests occurred in Khairpur: residents of Rahuja village protested against poor sanitation conditions; residents of WAPDA Scrap Colony protested against "non-supply of drinking water" to the area for twenty days; police officials protested against the non-provision of salaries; members of the Shiite Rabita Council protested against the bombings of Quetta, Kohat and Peshawar.
Farmers of Puran Branch staged a sit-in protest at Kanti-Tyre Khakhar road against shortages of irrigation water.
Two inmates are killed, countless others injured during a riot and attempted prison break at Kaduna prison. Many are attributing the riot to severe overcrowding.

assoc_actor_1: JCD: Bangladesh Jatiotabadi Chatra Dal; Students (Bangladesh)
assoc_actor_2: JCD: Bangladesh Jatiotabadi Chatra Dal; Students (Bangladesh)
notes: Twenty people were injured when two rival JCD factions clashed with each other after an altercation over being denied entry into the conference room to meet the opposition's chief whip in Nilphamari district town on April 20.

BCL activists set afire a bus meant to carry teachers of Chittagong University to the campus near Sholoshahar area in Chittagong as part of the ongoing strike called by the BCL in the university on April 20.
Traders of Rawalpindi staged a big protest rally against power outages.
Dozens of demonstrators rallied in front of Egypts parliament on Tuesday to vent their anger over an MPs call for security forces to open fire on pro-reform demonstrators.

On April 20, 2010, approximately 600 villagers from Om Laing commune continued blocking National Road 52 to protest an on-going land dispute and what they claim to be inadequate efforts by the company to resolve the disagreement.

assoc_actor_1: CPN(UML): Communist Party of Nepal (Unified Marxist-Leninist)
assoc_actor_2: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: At least 12 people from both sides were injured when a clash ensued between the cadres of UCPN-M and CPN-UML regarding the appointment of employees at Gorkha Brewery, Bhedabari, Nawalparasi. Maoist cadre Buddhiram Mahato later died in hospital from his injuries.
On April 20th, hundreds of people from civil organizations and lawyers staged a protest demonstration in New Mirpur city in support of Chief Justice of Supreme Court of AJK Reaz Akhter Chaudhry.
Police open fire and kill ten attempted jail break/rioters in a Kaduna State Prison.
Residents protested against power outages at Chappar Stop and Multan rod, as well as other areas of Lahore.
JI members demonstrated to protest against Monday's bomb blast on a JI rally in Peshawar. A complete strike was also observed by the business community for the same reason.

assoc_actor_1: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship
notes: On 19 April 2010, at the Ratchadamri intersection in Pathum Wan district (PW, Bangkok), several thousand UDD red shirts assembled to face more than 1,000 military personnel armed with automatic rifles who were on guard to prevent the demonstrators from taking over the financial district. Although tense, no violence erupted at the scene.

assoc_actor_1: PPP-SB: Pakistan Peoples Party-Shaheed Bhutto; JSQM: Jeay Sindh Qaumi Movement
notes: Different protests occurred ioutside the Hyderabad Press Club: residents of Tajpur protested against the EDO Education district Matiari; the activists of the PPP-SB protested against the registration of cases against their party leaders; activists of the JSQM protested to demand the arrest of accused killers; residents of Bhatti Goth protested against a builder for allegedly occupying the land of a graveyard.
Multi-color-clad pro-government demonstrators gathered at Chatuchak Park in Bangkok to demonstrate against the UDD's continued protest in the city.

Khon Kaen's online Facebook community arranged a gathering at a local shrine with over 500 participants, including entrepreneurs, state officials and local vendors. The group opposed further red-shirt demonstrations and said that all Thais should unite to protect the Monarchy.

Five cops and two Chhatra League (BCL) activists were injured in a clash between the law-enforcers and the BCL men after BCL men attacked the station with bats at Swarupkathi thana premises (Pirojpur, Barisal) on April 19.
City service delivery protester/rioters kidnap an ANC official to demand answers.
Service delivery protesters kidnap four ANC members in Soshanguve; shots reportedly fired.

Protest demonstrations occurred during a cultural show at the Islamic International University. Student demonstrators demanded the university administration expel an IJT student who allegedly "thrashed" female students.
Farmers of Kandh Kot protested outside the local press club against the non-provision of seeds and their inability to sell their wheat for reasonable prices.
HESCO officials attempted to disconnect illegal power connections, leading to a clash between the officials and some residents of Bodla Mohalla in the Ranipur area.

Different protests occurred in Sukkar: a protest was staged by members of the Pakistan Veterinary Medical Association against an attack on one of their colleagues; residents of different areas of Sukkar protested against power outages.
Protests continued against power outages in Bahawalnagar, Badin, Mirpur Khas, Larkana, Thatta, Ghotki, Dera Ismail Khan, Hangu, Karak, Swat (Mingora), and Muzaffarabad.
On April 19, lawyers formed a human chain to protest the inclusion of a Jamaat-e-Islami leader into the list of war criminals, in Sirajganj district town.

Demonstrators gather outside the Parliament building to protest a decision by its members to shoot they and others if they assemble.
Hundreds of Coptic Christians attacked a police station in an Egyptian village after a Muslim man allegedly tried to convert a Christian.
400 Coptic Christians surround a police station and pelted it with stones after it is learned that a Muslim man tried to convert a Christian.

assoc_actor_1: NANS: National Association of Nigerian Students
notes: Large numbers take to the streets protesting the witch-hunting of a politician by his opponents.
Khon Kaen locals gathered to oppose further red-shirt demonstrations and voice their concerns about the political unrest at a local shrine.

assoc_actor_1: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship
notes: On 18 April 2010, about 500 red-shirt UDD members gathered at a local red-shirt radio station in Pathum Thani province, coded at Pathum Thani city (MPT, PT) after hearing a rumor that the military were coming to shut down the station. Pathum Thani's red-shirt demonstrators blocked the entrance of the radio station with old tires, causing heavy traffic congestion around the area but no military officials came.
Multi-color-clad demonstrators gathered Victory Monument in Bangkok to support the Democrat-led government and oppose the movement of the United Front of Democracy Against Dictatorship (UDD).
At least 15 persons were injured when two factions of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party clashed using sticks at Paturia ferry terminal in Shivalaya Upazila in Manikganj on 18 April.
The Chittagong city unit of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party brought out a protest procession on Sunday, demanding uninterrupted supply of water, gas and power.
Residents of Ghaghara in Peshawar protested against the occupation of 50 acres of land belonging to the Higher Education Commission.
A protest demonstration was staged by activists of the Jaffaria Students Organization at Koto-Moto Chowk against bomb blasts in Quetta.

The Nepal Students Union (NSU) called for a general strike in Nuwakot district on Sunday to protest the Maoist attack on 5 of its members on April 11th. NSU supporters demonstrated in Bidur municipality to enforce the strike.

assoc_actor_1: Dalit Caste Group (Pakistan); Students (Pakistan); Teachers (Pakistan); Journalists (Pakistan)
notes: Different protests occurred outside the Hyderabad Press Club: the Sindh Peoples Youth organization protested against the arrest of their party's leaders; members of the All Schedule Caste Students Forum of Sindh University in Jamshoro protested against the Sindh Minister for Minority Affairs for not taking steps to help minorities; members of Dargah Syed Sakhi Muhammad Shah Bukhari Jamaat protested against influential men for occupying plots of the Dargah; former PSTs who passed the IBA test protested for the reinstatement of their services; local journalists protested for the provision of financial assistance for the families of journalists killed in the suicide blast in Quetta.
Shopkeepers protested, closed their shops and set tires on fire against prolonged power outages.
Hundreds of people, including many youths, protested and blocked Mirwah road against what they believe are inflated bills despite ongoing power outages.
Activists of the JSSF protested against the proposed creation of new provinces.
The watchmen of the Food Department of NF protested against the torture of their colleagues outside the local press club.
Activists of the ASWJ protested outside the local press club against the killing of their leader.
After armed men of the Jamro community killed a youth and injured others over a matrimonial dispute, the heirs of the deceased staged a sit-in with the body on the National Highway.
Different social and political leaders protested against the occupation of a waiting room in Shahpur Jahania.
Residents of different villages including Shah Ludhani protested against HESCO officials for disconnecting their villages' electricity.

On April 18, BNP activists came under attack from an unidentified group of rioters while they were on their way to attend a BNP rally, in Benapole, located in Jessore district's Sharsha upazila, injuring 25.
Protestes against prolonged power outages continued in Jehlum, as well as in other areas including Multan.
Protestes against prolonged power outages continued in Jehlum, as well as in other areas including Multan.

Activists of the Hindu Yuva Sangh (HYS), a newly formed outfit demanding the revival of Hindu nation status, torched copies of Kantipur daily and Annapurna Post at Birgunj, Parsa district headquarters. They set the newspapers ablaze for not covering their issues.
Disgruntled students protest to demand the return of fees.

assoc_actor_1: CPN(UML): Communist Party of Nepal (Unified Marxist-Leninist)
notes: Cadres of the ruling CPN-UML citing the party's apathy in the suicide of veteran cadre Digendra Rajbanshi staged demonstrations in Jhapa district on Sunday. Hundreds of relatives and well wishers of the deceased Rajbanshi and UML activists chanted slogans against the party and staged demonstrations in Charali section of the East-West highway since morning.
Villagers demonstrated on the National Highway in protest against perceived police inefficiency and negligence following a death caused in a kidnapping attempt by unidentified men.
Protests continued against power outages.
Traders staged a demonstration at Fowara Chowk against power outages. They also burned tires and blocked traffic.
A rally was taken out by members of the JI against inflation and power outages.
Hundreds of protesters took to the streets in Garhi Habibullah and blocked the Kashmir road for 2 hours.

Protests continued in Hazara district in Abbottabad, Manshera and Haripur. Roads were blocked by protesters, traders closed their shops and the Karakoram Highway was blocked. A large police presence was noted..

assoc_actor_1: BCL: Bangladesh Chhatra League; Jubo League; Students (Bangladesh)
notes: On 17 April, local Jubo League men of Durgapur upazila in Netrokona attacked central BNP leader Kaiser Kamal and kept him confined on Saturday. A number of BNP men were injured in the attack, he said adding members of Jubo League and Chhatra League set fire to shops belong to BNP supporters.

On April 17, at least 20 people, including eight policemen, were injured in a clash between police and locals in Mollah Bari area of Chandpur district town. The clash occurred when Sadar Model Thana police held a youth from the area for being involved in abducting a girl. Police raided the house and arrested him. When the police were returning to the thana local people intercepted them, leading to a clash.
Journalists of Qazi Ahmed protested outside the local press club against an attack on a senior journalist.
Students of the Quaid-e-Awam University of Engineering, Science and Technology Shaheed Benazirabad staged a sit-in protest on Shaheed Benazirabad-Sakrand road against prolonged power outages.
Hundreds of citizens, traders, lawyers, workers and students rallied in Kamalia against prolonged power outages. The protest was led by Anjuman-e-Tajiran.

A complete strike was called by the Anjuman-e-Tajiran and protests were held in Quetta against the suicide attack that hit the Civil Hospital by the Balochistan Union of Journalists and Quetta Press Club members.

assoc_actor_1: PPP-SB: Pakistan Peoples Party-Shaheed Bhutto; Oud Communal Group (Pakistan); Journalists (Pakistan)
notes: Different protests occurred outside the Hyderabad Press Club: activists of the PPP-SB protested against the registration of cases against their party leader; members of the Oad community protested against the actions of an influential man in their area; residents of Ali Mirjat district protested against the actions of an influential man; activists of the SPSF protested against the controller of exams in Sindh; journalists protested against the death of a journalist in a Quetta suicide attack.
employees of the Public Health Engineering Department of Dadu protested outside the local press club in favour of their demands.
Local contractors protested against the Executive Engineer of the Provincial Highway Division Mirpur Khas due to alleged favouritism.
Residents of Chakar Khan Shahani village of Karachi protested against the killing of a community member during a raid by Darkhshan police.
Members of the Latif Government Contractors Association staged a protest demonstration against the non-issuance of their withheld dues (specific location not given).

Employees of the TMA boycotted their duties and protested against the arrest of an encroachment inspector. The employees said that the leaders of the Vendor Labourers Union had assauled the inspector and supported the occupants who had resisted the anti-encroachment drive during which the inspector had been injured.
Watchmen of the Food Department of Naushahro Feroze protested outside the local press club against the torture of their colleagues.
A protest demonstration was staged by the residents of Shahbaz and Lawyers' Colonies in Karachi against prolonged power outages.
A protest demonstration was held by the residents of Mehar against the officials of the Tamachani police station for inaction against criminals.

Different protests occurred in Bhitshah: PPP workers protested against the EDO Education and TMO outside the Bhitshah Press Club against their alleged negligence; a woman and her family protested against the actions of local police who she accused of attempting to rape her daughter and occupy her home.
A protest demonstration was staged by farmers outside the Badin Press Club against acute water shortages in Alkram Wah and other areas around Badin.
On the call of the Shahri Ittehad, a complete strike and protest demonstration were held against prolonged power outages.
Scores of residents of Thatta staged a sit-in protest at the Thatta-Karachi road against prolonged power outages.

Different protests occurred in Mirpur Bathoro: Fruit vendors protested against the arrest of one of their colleague, which led to his release; a complete strike and protest demonstration was staged against the killing of a man and a demand for the police to arrest his killers.

Different protests occurred in Sukkar: residents protested against power outages and water shortages, setting tires on fire; members of the Lakhan community protested against the Old Sukkar police for allegedly robbing them during raids.
Activists of different political and social parties protested outside the National Press Club of Dadu against prolonged power outages.
A clash broke out between ANP and Sindhi nationalists, including STPP, JSMM, JSQM and SUP among other parties, over the renaming of the locality of Bhittaiabad in Karachi to Khyber Pakhtoonkhwa.
A protest rally was taken out against shortages of water and power outages. The demonstrators set tires on fire and blocked roads.
Dozens of camels and horse owners marched from Clifton beach to the Karachi Press Club to demonstrate against perceived extortion in terms of various cost-of-living expenses.

Local committees of Karachi and Sindhi fishermen unions staged a protest at the Karachi Press Club against the forceful inclusion of Younisabad into the Manora Cantonment Board's periphery and the imposition of new taxes.
On April 17, at least 12 people were injured when two groups of villagers clashed at Nayagaon (Sadar upazila, Munshiganj) after the local Imam delivered a sermon on the trial of war-criminals.
People rallied and blocked traffic by staging a sit-in at Jinnah Bagh Chowk, including JSQM leaders, in support of Sindh nationalism.
Traders staged a protest rally at Fawara Chowk and blocked Liaquat road for 2 hours against power outages. The protest was organized by Anjuman-e-Tajiran.
Leaders of the Hazara province action committee protested outside the Lahore Press Club against the renaming of the NWFP. The demonstrators blocked traffic.
Local residents besieged the local WAPDA office to protest against prolonged power outages.

Different protests took place in Peshawar, including a demonstration and the burning of tires after the kidnapping of a young boy, a rally by the B.Tech Engineers Association for not being given the full stasus of engineeers, and a procession by students from Khyber Agency for protection for their communities.
Residents of Par Hoti and Mohib Banda areas of Mardan staged a demonstration against the use of sub-standard construction materials in the construction of Mohib Banda-Yar Hussain road.
The business community observed a strike and staged a protest against prolonged power outages in the Jabori area.

Members of the Committee for Hazara Province set up a token hunger strike camp at the main chowk with participants including political workers, local traders, transporters, union leaders, NGO workers and other walks of life.

Protests continued in Hazara district in Abbottabad, Manshera and Haripur. Roads were blocked by protesters, traders closed their shops and the Karakoram Highway was blocked. A large police presence was noted..
Lawyers organized a hunger-strike and engaged in protests in Garhi Habibullah and Balakot to seek a Hazara province and protest against the renaming of NWFP.

Protests continued in Hazara district in Abbottabad, Manshera and Haripur. Roads were blocked by protesters, traders closed their shops and the Karakoram Highway was blocked. A large police presence was noted..
Hunger strike camps were set up in Abbottabad, Manshera and Haripur over the renaming of the NWFP and the creation of a Hazara province.
The teachers of the Benevolent Public School staged a protest on Sher Shah Suri Road in Manshera against the firing of their colleagues and delays in payment.

Anti-parliament dissolution supporters reached the 11th Infantry Regiment to demonstrate against the demands of the United Front of Democracy Against Dictatorship (UDD) that has pressed the government to dissolve the lower house and call for fresh elections.

The relatives of a minor killed in a road accident four days ago staged demonstrations in Kathmandu on Friday. They were demanding action against the guilty, and compensation to the family of the victim in Koteshwor Chowk. At least a dozen agitators were injured when police charged at them with batons and fired tear gas shells to bring the situation under control. Earlier, demonstrators had pelted rocks at the police.
Over 100 people including four policemen were injured in a clash between two rival groups in Sirajganj town on April 16 over renaming a graveyard.
The banned Islamist outfit Hizb ut-Tahrir Bangladesh on April 16 brought out a procession in Chittagong city protesting US military exercise in Chittagong.

On April 16, villagers and Bangladesh Chhatra League activists clashed at the Station Chattar assumed in Hathazari (Chittagong) during the Pahela Baishakh festival. One student died after being stabbed by the locals, five other BCL members were injured in the clash.
On April 16, a mob beat three persons to death in Koibortiapara village of Boalkhali upazila of Chittagong suspecting them of being bandits.

Over 300 students of the Government College Univesity of Faisalabad boycotted their classes and held a demonstration to protest the arrest of their fellow students and "non-availability of cold drinking water on the university premises".
Nurses of the Taluka Hospital Shahdadpur demonstrated and boycotted their duties against the attiudes of the DSM of the area.
Employees of the Public Health and Engineering Department rallied and march to the local press club to protest against the Sindh government's failure to regularize their services.
On April 16, members of the Green Rural Development Organization protested outside the Hyderabad Press Club in Hyderabad city (Hyderabad, Sindh) against the actions of an influential landlord.
On April 16, residents of Khairpur Nathan Shah protested outside the Hyderabad Press Club in Hyderabad city (Hyderabad, Sindh) against the actions of influential men in the area.
On April 16, employees of the Revenue Department protested outside the Hyderabad Press Club in Hyderabad city (Hyderabad, Sindh) against the non-payment of their salaries.
On April 16, activists of the Sindh United Party protested outside the Hyderabad Press Club in Hyderabad city (Hyderabad, Sindh) against the administration of the Taluka Hospital of Kotri.
On April 16, members of the Pakistan Railway Employees Union protested outside the Hyderabad Press Club in Hyderabad city (Hyderabad, Sindh) in favour of their demands.
On April 16, activists of the JI protested outside the Hyderabad Press Club in Hyderabad city (Hyderabad, Sindh) against the social problems facing people.
Farmers of Kandh Kot protested outside the local press club against the non-provision of seeds and their inability to sell their wheat for reasonable prices.
The owner of a gold shop protested against the ransacking of his shop by Machhi community members and blocked the National Highway with a sit-in, which stopped traffic for a few hours.
Protests occurred against frequent power outages and water shortages and included residents of Godhra, Shafiq Morr, Al-Noor Morr and other areas. Police peacefully dispersed the protesters.
Relatives of Khairpur Central Jail inmates protested against the jail administration following a search operation and the jail administration preventing the relatives from seeing the inmates.
Activists of the JSSF protested against the administration of the PPL Gas Field for allegedly neglecting the local residents.

On 16 April, an anti-encroachment drive was met by force from the residents of the area who pelted the team with stones, attacked an Encroachment Inspector and protested outside the A-Section police station in Khairpur (Sindh). Rioters blocked the road until they were peacefully dispersed by the words of a PPP leader.
The Human Rights Foundation of Pakistan protested outside the Karachi Press Club against the ban on pillion riding.
Government contractors have staged a protest demonstration against the Roads Department for not issuing their dues (specific location not given).
A protest demonstration was staged by political, social and religious parties against prolonged power outages and poor sanitary systems.
Residents of Shahdadkot protested against prolonged power outages.
A protest rally was organized by the Haq Sach Social Welfare Organization against the sale of drugs in the area. A sit-in was also staged outside the DCO office.
Activists of the PML-N staged a sit-in protest on the Hyderabed-Badin road against the arrest of Nawaz Ali Khuwaja.

A clash erupted between the residents of two villages. According to the police, an argument had resulted in the clash, causing at least the wounding of 20 people and the damage of other private properties.
A group of people linked to a former minister attacked the convoy of DPF leader and some of his supporters. No injuries were reported and police are investigating.

PML-Q members organized a protest at Topi bazaar against the renaming of NWFP. The demonstrators marched through the streets, burned tires and blocked traffic.
Workers of "Pakistan Railways' concrete sleeper factory" held a demonstration at the main gate of the factory against the firing of 70 daily wage workers.
Hundreds of people including local traders, industrialists, exporters and lawyers participated in 2 separate rallies against power outages under the leadership of the PML-N and PTI.
Dozens of employees joined the hunger strike camp of the UHS contract employees on its 23rd consecutive day of operation.

Protests occurred in different places in Lahore, including on Ferozepur road, Ismaelnagar and Ravi Road, against prolonged power outages and water shortages. The protest in Ismaelnagar was dispersed by police.

Protests occurred against severe power outages. Residents of Deena, a neighbourhood of Jehlum, clashed with police and set an office, an ambulance and a fire engine on fire. Police used baton charges to disperse the protesters, injuring 5.
Industrialists and trade organizations took out rallies and protests against power outages.
Hunger strike camps were set up in Abbottabad, Manshera and Haripur over the renaming of the NWFP and the creation of a Hazara province.

At least eight people were injured when a clash ensued between police and Nepali Congress (NC) cadres in Nuwakot. The clash broke out when police restricted the NC cadres from entering the district administration office. The NC cadres were there to submit a memorandum demanding action against YCL cadres, who had attacked NC activists four days ago after disagreements surfaced during Bageshwori Higher Secondary School management committee election.

assoc_actor_1: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers Union
notes: SAMWU protests in Durbans city centre.
On April 15, at least two people were killed and more than 100 injured in a clash between two rival groups of villagers over establishing supremacy in Gazaria union (Bhairab, Kishoreganj).

assoc_actor_2: Civilians (Bangladesh); Police Forces of Bangladesh (2009-) Bangladesh Ansar
notes: At least 50 were injured and a factory was vandalized as the police clashed with workers rallying for their 10-point demands at Nishintapur Ashulia at Savar in Dhaka on Thursday. The workers attacked an Ansars camp inside the factory and assaulted some officials, including the managing director, executive director, production manager and general manager, of the factory.

Bay, Dinsoor: AS arrested 13 elders of two sub clans of Rahanwen clan near Dinsoor following the latters failure to resolve dispute between their respective sub clan. AS Vs clans/ (0/10)/ (00)/Dinsoor/Bay/20100416.984 Note- Members of the subclans later demonstrated against AS arrest of their leaders and AS released the leaders telling them to solve the dispute in a short period of time. It also threatened to fight both communities if need be.
Students violently protest against classroom overcrowding over two days in Malmesbury; engage in clashes with police.
The Joint Acton Committee of Punjab schoolteachers staged a protest criticizing the government for not increasing their salaries.
The members of the Lower Staff Association of the Shaheed Benazirabad Education department protested outside the local press club in favour of their demands.

Different protests occurred in Hyderabad: PPP-SB activists protested to demand the arrest of accused murderers; people of the Lund community protested to demand the arrest of those accused of attacking their village; members of the Soomro community protested to demand the arrest of people who attacked them; people of the Jamali community protested against the Deputy Director of the National Highway Authority.
A protest demonstration was staged by PPP workers against the EDO of Matiari outside the Bhitshah Press Club.
Several hundred local residents formed a human chain to demand better supply of water, gas and electricity in Dhaka's Gulshan area on April 15.
DPF leader denounced the attack against two of its campaign teams in Nawalapitiya, which injured several people.

assoc_actor_1: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers Union
notes: A Kempton Park petrol station owner was whipped and stoned by protesting members of the South African Municipal Workers Union (Samwu) when he tried to extinguish a fire they had started around his filling station. The union was on a labour strike.
On Apr 15, the banned Islamist outfit Hizb ut-Tahrir Bangladesh brought out a procession in the city protesting US military exercise in Chittagong District.
Activists of the JSQM and Baloch Rabita Committee held a demonstration outside the local press club against the disappearance of a JSQM leader and other activists of nationalist parties.
Protest demonstrations were organized by trade organizations in Dera Ghazi Khan, Khanewal, Ahmedpur, Sharqia (lat/longs/not available), and Vehari.
Dozens of supporters of Tehreek-e-Hazara Sooba staged a rally outside the Lahore Press Club against the renaming of NWFP and demanded a Hazara province.

Hundreds of industrialists, entrepreneurs, traders and shopkeepers staged a protest against power and gas outages. Around a thousand workers also joined their employers in the protest, which included a march through the city.

The APCA organized a demonstration of at least 400 employees who blocked The Mall and held up traffic. They later surrounded the Punjab Assembly to protest against inflation and low salaries, and to demand raises.
Protest demonstrations were organized by trade organizations in Dera Ghazi Khan, Khanewal, Ahmedpur, Sharqia (lat/longs/not available), and Vehari.
Demonstrators protesting against power outages allegedly went on a "rampage" in Gujranwala.
Protest demonstrations were organized by trade organizations in Dera Ghazi Khan, Khanewal, Ahmedpur, Sharqia (lat/longs/not available), and Vehari.
Protest demonstrations were organized by trade organizations in Dera Ghazi Khan, Khanewal, Ahmedpur, Sharqia (lat/longs/not available), and Vehari.
Traders marched and burned tires at Suekarno Chowk to proest against power outages.

2 police officials were beaten by residents of a "katchi abadi" who fought against anti-encroachment personnel who had arrived to move the residents to a different locality. The residents used sticks and stones to attack the officials.
Hundreds of PML-N workers launched a protest outside the Burewala Press Club against the nomination of a former nazim for a vacant seat in the area. They burned tires and blocked traffic.

On 14 April, violent demonstrations continued in Manshera town (KP) against the renaming of the NWFP and to demand the creation of a Hazara province. Demonstrators set tires on fire and threw stones at PML-N offices.

assoc_actor_1: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship
notes: On 14 April 2010, UDD red shirt leaders relocated all demonstrators from Phan Fa Bridge to Ratchaprasong Intersection in Pathum Wan district (PW, Bangkok) in anticipation of another government dispersal operation.
A PML-Q leader accused the police of torturing peaceful protesters against power outages in Gujranwala (specific date not given).
Student protesters clashed with police; 3 protesters were injured.
Farmers and other workers protest against crime.

Twenty people were injured as rival BNP groups with sticks in Pabna city on April 14 locked in a clash when Opposition Chief Whip Zainal Abedin Farroque went to appear before a court to seek bail in a defamation suit.
Students violently protest against classroom overcrowding over two days in Malmesbury; engage in clashes with police and light fires.

assoc_actor_1: SAMWU: South African Municipal Workers Union
notes: Municipal workers protest, spreading refuse throughout the streets. Police intervene, dispersing the group.
The Kinnaird College faculty staged a demonstration against the non-payment of salaries to contract teachers and to demand the new registrar be given charge of her post.

The business community observed a strike and staged a protest after a man died of bullet wounds after doctors allegedly refused to treat him. The demonstrators rallied in the main bazaar and brought the body of the man with them.

Different protests occurred in Sukkar: a protest was stages by people of different areas of Sukkar against water shortages; the All Sindh Education Department Lower Staff Association protested for the regularization of their services and increased salaries; the people of the Syed community demonstrated against the actions of "Mukhtiarkar Rohri and Tapedar of Deh Seroja"; workers of the NPIW protested to demand the regularization of their services and withheld salaries.

notes: Different protested occurred in Hyderabad: members of the Sindh Para-Veterinary Staff Association protested against DO Livestock District Matiari for withheld salaries; members of the All Sindh Lower Staff Education Department of Hyderabad protested for the regularization of their services and withheld salaries; the activists of the JSQM protested against the actions of Mukhtiarkar Hala; PPP activists protested against the EDO of the Matiari education district; scores of women from Kari Mori protested to demand the recovery of a kidnapped girl.
Members of the Municipal Employees Union protested against the occupation of property in the city.
A protest demonstration was staged by residents of Shahdadkot against prolonged power outages.
A traders fraternity staged a protest demonstration against the Value Added Tax (VAT) outside the Karachi Press Club.
Residents of Hayat Marri protested outside the Qazi Ahmed Press Club against HESCO officials after they allegedly tortured a farmer.
After a high tension wire killed a woman, the residents of Pipri protested against the alleged negligence of KESC officials.

People of the Narejo community demonstrated against the Gambat and Agra police outside the local press club following a raid on their homes by these police forces; employees of the TMA protested outside the local press club for the regularization of their services and a salary increase; hundreds of students protested outside the DCO to demand the opening of the newly constructed Sachal Sarmast Library; members of the fruit vendors union protested after the TMA allegedly took many of their goods during an anti-encroachment drive, during which time one of their members had a heart attack and later died.
11 people were injured in a land dispute between the Rajput and Unar communities at Jam Unar.
Different political, social and religious parties continued their protest against the occupation of a waiting room in Shahpur Jahania.
9 people were injured in a clash between the Kaka and Jamali communities at Deh Pingharo over a water dispute.
Traders in Mehar went on strike and protested, including engaging in a sit-in on the National Highway, following the kidnapping of one of their colleagues.
Hundreds of people protested against prolonged power outages. They set tires on fire and blocked traffic.

A complete strike and protest were observed in Hyderabad related to the killing of 2 MQM members. A few unidentified armed men involved in the demonstration engaged in aerial firing, while during the funeral of one of the men, more firing occurred leading to severe injuries to 3 MQM members.
Residents of different villages in the Ilyas Jat area protested to demand the release of a man accused of kidnapping and torturing a villager.

Protest demonstrations by farmers occurred in many areas of Sindh including Naushahro Feroze, Khairpur, Ghotki, Larkana and Dadu over non-availability of gunny bags and their alleged sale to wheat traders. In some cases these led to clashes between the farmers and police (specific cases not mentioned).
Traders took to the streets to protect against power outages and marched on The Mall, blocking traffic. At least 2 other demonstrations about the same issue were reported in other parts of the city.

A joint action comittee of the Tehreek-e-Sooba Hazara held a protest rally involving hundreds of Hazara natives outside the Lahore Press Club against the renaming of the NWFP and demanded a separate Hazara province.
On 14 April, protesters blocked roads in Oghi city (Mansehra, KP) during ongoing demonstrations in the region against the renaming of the NWFP and to demand the creation of a Hazara province.

On 14 April, traders, shopkeepers and residents protested in different places in Peshawar town (KP), including in front of the local press club, against power outages, inflation and the deteriorating law and order situation.

On 14 April, violent demonstrations continued in Abbottabad town (KP) against the renaming of the NWFP and to demand the creation of a Hazara province. Demonstrators set tires on fire and threw stones at PML-N offices and the police resorted to firing tear gas and aerial shots.
Rioting prisoners battle police and guards
Members of the JUI-F protested against the controversial letters which have been sent to non-local peshimams/prayer leaders asking them to leave the provincial capital.
A huge protest rally was organized in Sukkar against power outages and water shortages.
Hundreds of employees of the TMA Khairpur protested and observed a token hunger strike in Sukkar against delays in payment.
