The APCA organized a protest camp for increases in salaries. They also engaged in a march from Shamsabad to Faizabad Chowk.
Hundreds of farmers staged a rally to protest against irrigation officials for allegedly registering fake cases against the farmers.

After a man was killed in an accident with a bus in the Old Anarkali area of Lahore, passengers and local residents of the area burned the bus, and the victim's relatives later reached the spot and blocked the road in protest, demanding the arrest of the driver.

Traders of Lahore protested against power outages, inflation, and the proposed Value Added Tax (VAT). They marched on The Mall and other streets, blocking traffic. The demonstrators also burned tires and threw stones before being dispersed by the police.
A complete strike and march were organized by the Markaz-e-Anjuman-e-Tajiran group against power outages.
Residents of Tajori protested against the collection of loading and unloading taxes by the TMA of Lakki Marwat.
The Anjuman-i-Dokandaran staged a protest demonstration at Kernel Sher Khan Chowk to demand the transfer of the TMO and ACO within three days.
Prisoners staged a protest in the district judicial lockup against a boycott of the courts by lawyers.

Demonstrators angry about the renaming of the NWFP and the killing of protesters on Apr.12 again took to the streets in Manshera. They also blocked roads and observed a complete strike. Rioting also allegedly took place.

On 13 April 2010, 500 government supporters gathered at the Victory Monument in Ratchathewi district (Ratchathewi, Bangkok) to oppose the UDD red shirts movement's call for early House dissolution. During the gathering a group of UDD red shirts motorcyclists rode past the group and the two sides said abusive words but no violence occurred.
University of KwaZulu-Natal students protest over inadequate housing. A similar protest occurred at the Durban University of Technology the previous day.

Displaced people in the outskirts of Mogadishu have today staged demonstrations in opposition to recent statement by Banaadir Regional Administration which said local the aid agency, DBG, does absolutely nothing for the civilian population.

assoc_actor_1: JeI: Jamaat-e-Islami; ICS: Islami Chhatra Shibir; Students (Bangladesh)
notes: On April 13, a clash between police and activists of Jamaat-e-Islami and Islami Chhatra Shibir left at least 15 including four policemen injured when police halted their attempt to bring out a procession at Andarkillah in Chittagong as the activist demanded the release of their leaders. The agitators pelted stones and brickbats at police.
Students of the music department of Sindh University and those associated with the "JEAMIST ideological committee" held a demonstration and sit-in against the alleged closure of their department.
Punjab University teachers continued their protest to condemn the violence carried out by IJT members on their campus. The rally was organized by the PUASA.
Residents of different villages in the Ilyas Jat area protested after the kidnapping and torture of a villager from Ilyas Jat and demanded the arrest of those involved.
UPFA politicians and supporters have reportedly been attacked by JVP supporters who assaulted them and set fire to the van they travelled in. Six people were injured.
Prisoners riot
On April 13th, large number of people from civil organizations and lawyers staged a protest demonstration in New Mirpur city in support of Chief Justice of Supreme Court of AJK Reaz Akhter Chaudhry.
Inmates of the Hyderabad Central Prison allegedly stiched their lips and started a hunger strike against the perceived 'selective remission' announced by the President of Pakistan.

The relatives of a girl who was assaulted and killed as well as scores of residents of Rachna Town staged a protest on GT Road in Sheikhapura and blocked the local highway for 6 hours. Police attempted to disperse the mob with tear gas and batons, which led to clashes and resulted in injuries among the protesters and police.
Demonstrations against power outages occurred in Rahimyar Khan, Bahawalnagar and Sargodha. In Sargodha, the PML-N rallied alongside traders.
Demonstrations against power outages occurred in Rahimyar Khan, Bahawalnagar and Sargodha. In Rahimyar Khan, a complete strike occurred as well.
PTI activists staged a protest rally against power outages, inflation and unemployment. They marched from Najaf Colony to Bheekhaywala Mor on Wahdat Road.

UHS employees continued their protests in front of the Punjab Assembly to demand regularization while the APCA protested in solidarity and also demanded higher wages. Demonstrators also blocked The Mall.
Traders of the Rehmat Market in Lahore protested against power outages.
Residents of Ferozewala town in Lahore protested after a young girl was assaulted and killed in the area.
Demonstrations against power outages occurred in Rahimyar Khan, Bahawalnagar and Sargodha. In Bahawalnagar, a hunger strike camp was begun alongside their demonstrations.
Tribesmen led by JUI-F activists condemned the killing of civilians by air strikes in Sra Vella and rallied outside the Peshawar Press Club.

Complete strikes were observed and barricades consructed of burning tires erected to block traffic in Abbottabad and Haripur to protest against the renaming of the NWFP and the killing of protesters on Apr.12. Demonstratos alsso blocked the Karakoram Highway. In Haripur, demonstrators also attacked the offices of the PML-N, PML-Q and the TMO.
Activists of the JI and PPP staged a protest against the renaming of the NWFP.

Complete strikes were observed and barricades consructed of burning tires erected to block traffic in Abbottabad and Haripur to protest against the renaming of the NWFP and the killing of protesters on Apr.12. Demonstratos also blocked the Karakoram Highway. In Abbottabad, violent protests also occurred throughout the city, including the looting of a weapons shop, the torching of a PML-N member's office, and the throwing of stones at Nawa Shehar police station. At least 1 demonstrators was killed and 4 injured during the protests and clashes with police, which included baton charges.
Hundreds of youths march demanding that acting President Jonathan implement electoral reforms to ensure credible polls in next years election.
Egyptian police detained one protester and scuffled with others among a group of about 200 demonstrating for an end to President Hosni Mubaraks 29-year rule.

Student organizations blocked roads in Manshera while staging a protest against the renaming of NWFP. The Manshera Union of Journalists also took out a protest rally against the renaming of NWFP and the creation of a Hazara province.

assoc_actor_1: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship
notes: On 12 April 2010, UDD red shirts demonstrators paraded their dead through Bangkok streets to represent the demonstrators killed in clashes with anti-riot troops. They also threw objects, tore down signs and banners, and reportedly attacked two men and the car of another woman. Police had to intervene repeatedly to keep violence from escalating during the procession.
Student rioters demonstrated for better schools and colleges. Rioters threw stones at police and set up barricades of burning tires. Police arrested rioters.

At least 20 people were injured in a clash between the adherents of Sunni and Wahabi Sects at Ghatiara village under Brahmanbaria Sadar upazila April 12. Religious intolerance of the Sunni adherents towards the Wahabi adherents was learnt to be the cause of the clash.

Residents of two Dhaka University halls staged a demonstration demanding an end to the prevailing water and power crises. The female students of Kuwait Moitri hall brought out a procession outside the hall at around 10:00pm Monday and those of Sheikh Fazilatunnesa hall inside their hall at the same time.

Tehreek-e-Sooba Hazara activists gathered at Fawara Chowk, alongside PPP, JI and JUI-F members, to protest against the renaming of NWFP. After the protesters refused to disperse, police used batons and tear gas to attempt to disperse the demonstrators, as well as allegedly firing directly on the crowd in self-defense after protesters attempted to storm police stations and vans, leading to 8 killed and over 100 injured.

Different protests occurred in Lahore: Hundreds of people protested outside the shrine of Data Sahib against power outages; a rally was organized by the Disabled Rights Development Organization against the chairman of Ushr & Zakat, where a man attempted self-immolation to demand their rights.

Members of the Federation of All Pakistan Universities Academic Staff Associations from the Islamia University Bahawalpur, Government College University Faisalabad, National University of Modern Languages Islamabad, and Kohat University protested in their respective cities.

Members of the Sindh Students Federation observed a token hunger strike outside the Larkana Press Club to demand the release of Begum Bhutto from what they see as unofficial detention.
Sanitary workers held a protest rally against the registration of a case against their colleagues and demanded the immediate release of those arrested.

assoc_actor_1: APCA: All Pakistan Clerks Association; Labour Group (Pakistan)
notes: A protest rally was taken out by members of the APCA against the Directors Colleges Larkana for transferring their colleagues. They marched and blocked the national highway.
Members of the Public Health Engineering Staff Welfare Association (PHESWA) staged a protest to demand regularization of their services (specific location not given).
After the arrest of a notable from the Shahani community, members of the community protested to demand his release.

A clash erupted among the activists of the ANP and Sindhi nationalists parties, including the STPP, JSQM, PPP-SB and others, after ANP members attempted to put up a gate in the Bhittai Abad area of Karachi which had the name Khyber Pakhtoonkhwa on it. The nationalists prevented the ANP from putting the gate up, as ANP activists have been renaming many streets and localities Khyber Pakhtoonkhwa following the renaming of the NWFP.
Mirani community members staged a protest against the actions of police after they raided a Mirani home and allegedly violated the respect of the women and ransacked the house.

Inmates of the Hyderabad Central Jail staged a protest against the jail administration for not implementing the remission order of the president. Inmates started a hunger strike in favour of their demands.
A joint protest demonstration was staged by activists of the JSQM, MQM, JI, Shehri Ittehad and other parties against people involved in occupying their spaces in Shahpur Jahania.

Activists of various nationalist parties, including the STPP, JSQM, PPP-SB and other parties, protested against the ANP's renaming of cities and localities as Khyber Pakhtoonkwa following the renaming of NWFP.
After armed bandits robbed some traders, citizens and businessmen staged a protest against insecurity on the national highway (specific location not given).
A protest demonstration was staged by JSQM activists against the "Mukhtiarkar Hala" for alleged corruption and falsification of documents (specific location not given).
Local area residents under the leadership of PPP activists protested against the provisional minister. The demonstrators marched and staged a sit-in on the national highway.
Activists of the JSSF staged a protest demonstration outside the Matli Press Club against the registration of cases against the chairman of the JSQM.
Gutka suppliers of Thatta staged a demonstration at Thatta-Sujawal road against the arrest of their colleagues. Police released the specified people after the protest.

Different protests occurred in Sukkar: Employees of the TMA protested for the issuane of withheld salaries; activists of the STPP protested against the Kandhra police for registering allegedly fake cases against their party leaders.

Protests continued across Pakistan related to power outages, including demonstrations in Multan, Gujranwala, Bahawalnagar, Sukkar, Badin, Mirpur Khas, Larkana, Thatta, Ghotki, Dera Ismail Khan, Hangu, Kurk, Swat and Muzaffarabad.

Nelson Mandela University students protest high food prices on campus.

On April 12, at least 30 people were injured and six houses were vandalised when two rival groups of villagers clashed over a longstanding dispute to establish their supremacy at Shilaur village (Sadar upazila, Brahamanbaria).

Punjab University academic staff staged a massive rally in front of the Lahore Press Club against violent acts allegedly carried out by IJT members on campus. IJT activists from various universities, and allegedly not from Punjab University, also gathered at the Lahore Press Club and attempted to hijack the protest and turn it against the administration of the university but were rebuked by the academic staff.

IJT students protested against actions taken by academics against them, including "black day" movements and protests carried out by academic staff against violent acts allegedly carried out by IJT members on campuses.

CPN-UML cadre Gulam Hussain Salmani, sustained fatal injuries in a clash between them and Nepali Congress activists at Naurigaudi village in Betahani VDC of Banke district. Some nine other people were injured in the clash. A minor dispute over the construction of a road in the village led to the clash.

assoc_actor_1: ANNISU(R): All Nepal National Free Students' Union (Revolutionary); Students (Nepal)
assoc_actor_2: ANNFSU: All Nepal National Free Students' Union; Students (Nepal)
notes: Cadres of the Maoist (ANNISU-R), and UML-affiliated (ANNFSU) clashed in the district on Monday. Seven people were injured in the scuffle, two critically. The clash ensued after the ANNISU-R dismantled the stage set by the ANNFSU for the sixth district convention of the UML, saying that political programmes cannot be held in the educational institutions. Police beefed up security in the district following the clash.

assoc_actor_1: ANNISU(R): All Nepal National Free Students' Union (Revolutionary); Students (Nepal)
notes: Following an attack on Samik Badal earlier today, irate ANNFSU activists, demanding action against the guilty, staged a demonstration and resorted to vandalism. The FSU office incurred minor damage when a mob set fire to it. The activists obstructed vehicular movement in the vicinity. They said protests would continue until the culprits were brought to justice. The flare-up ended in the afternoon.

assoc_actor_1: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship

The group is also urging the Thai monarch to intervene in the crisis.

On 11 April, cadres of Sanyukta Jatiya Mukti Morcha (SJMM) damaged and torched the office of Chhatredeuli VDC, causing damage to the property. The SJMM earlier had asked for donations in the various VDCs of the district.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: UCPN (Maoist) activists attacked State Minister for Energy Chandra Singh Bhattarai's vehicle at Dhaibung VDC in Rasuwa district. Hundreds of Maoist activists waved black flags and pelted stones at the vehicle the minister was riding in, as well as a tourist vehicle which was mistakenly flagged as belonging to NC activists. Two policemen were injured in the incident.

Wielding sticks, youths and businesspersons rallied around the town shouting slogans against the main opposition, which had called a strike in the town to press for the release of party cadre whom police had arrested for Friday night's assault on local Nepali Congress (NC) leader Ramchandra Air. They were defying the bandh and demonstrating in response to what they called 'unabated excesses' of UCPN (Maoist) activists in enforcing the shutdown. The demonstrators besieged the Maoist party office and turned their wrath on police when the latter intervened. The demonstrators then picketed the District Police Office, demanding to know on whose side the law enforcement authority was with.

assoc_actor_1: JeI: Jamaat-e-Islami; ICS: Islami Chhatra Shibir; Students (Bangladesh)

On April 11, activists of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) attacked the houses of BNP political opponents, vandalising 15 business establishments of BNP activists and looting valuables from the establishments at Atpara upazila headquarters. [size=no report]

On April 11, members of Progressive Teachers' Society (PTS) protested the incident of assault on teachers by Chhatra League cadres. They also demanded immediate punishment for Chhatra League activists.

assoc_actor_1: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship
notes: On 10 April 2010, at the Ratchaprasong protest camp in Pathum Wan district (PW, Bangkok), UDD red shirts leaders and demonstrators barricaded the camp with trucks and cars to prevent riot police from dispersing them. Three unarmed plainclothes police tried to present arrest warrants to the UDD red shirts leaders behind the mainstage and were attacked by demonstrators, with UDD red shirts leader Wichaidith urging the demonstrators on saying they weren't real police. Red Shirt Guards intervened and led them to safety. Riot police unsuccessfully tried to breach the barricade and eventually withdrew around 5:30pm.

assoc_actor_1: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship
notes: On 9 April 2010, red shirts demonstrators broke soldiers' barricades and entered ThaiCom uplink station's compound and were trying to enter the staton's buildings in Lat Lum Kaeo district (LLK, PT) to restore the People's Channel signal. The demonstrators raided the site as soldiers used shields, batons, water cannons, rubber bullets, tear gas and fire bombs to stop them. The demonstrators threw objects at soldiers and the buildings in response, and seized police trucks parked inside. The clash injured 16 demonstrators and 5 soldiers. Eventually security forces retreated and the clash ended when the People's Channel signal was reconnected.

Postgraduate doctors continued their protest in front of the Hyderabad Press Club, demanding resolution of their grievances.

After a train derailed near Tangwani, affected passengers staged a protest against the railway administration.
Leaders of different social and political parties protested outside the local press club against the DDO Revenue agency.

Different protests occurred in Mirpur Khas: JI members protested against targeted killings targeting their party; peasants who escaped the private jail of a landlord protested outside the local press club to demand protection by the authorities.

Different protests occurred in Sukkar: Candidates for the posts of constable and head constable of the Anti-Encroachment Force protested for alleged favouritism in choosing candidates; the lawyers of Sukkar protested against the killing of lawyers in Karachi on Apr.9; JSSF members protested against the registration of cases against Bashir Khan Qureshi; people of Ghanghro community protested the arrest of accused men involved in burning down a poultry farm; activists of the JSQM protested to demand the arrest of accused murderers of one of their party leaders.

Different protest occurred in Hyderabad: Activists of the JI staged a protest against the targeted killings of its leaders and activists; residents of Latifabad protested to demand the removal of occupiers from agricultural land.

source: Centre For Monitoring Election Violence CMEV

notes: A clash between supporters of two different UPFA candidates took place in Rihena.

On April 9, villagers from Chengrakandi and Charvatera village clashed with each other over a land dispute after a failed arbitration meeting in Daudkandi upazila (Comilla), injuring at least 20 people.
On 9 April, Hundreds of villagers in Chandura village in Bijoynagar upazila of Brahamanbaria placed physical barricades on the Dhaka-Sylhet highway to demand continuous power supply.
On April 9, Jubo League activists vandalised several shops in the Raipur market and looted them, in the Raipur upazila of Lakshmipur, injuring six people.
On April 9, the BNP's women, the Jatiyabadi Mohila Dal, demonstrated in Bogra town against the erratic power supply in the town.
A clash erupted between supporters of two UPFA candidates. The clash left three persons injured.

JUI activists protested in front of the Karachi Press Club to demand the arrest of those involved in killing 2 of their members on Apr.9.

A 'black day' was observed, including strikes and a protest rally, in Abbottabad and throughout the district against the renaming of the NWFP. PML-Q, PPP, JI, PTI, HQM and other bodies were present at the rallies, while which also occurred in Manshera, Balakot, and Garhi Habibullah.

People demonstrated outside the District Food Controller's offices against the State Minister for Food and Agriculture and his brother after they allegedly threatened him when he refused to provide more food to the Minister's brother.
After the derailment of a train, passengers engaged in a protest rally against the railway authorities.
"People took out a procession from Panj Gulla Chowk and marched up to the DCO office here on Friday to protest against long hours of electricity loadshedding."
Activists of Pasban staged a protest rally to demand the PM make Dr. Aafia Siddiqui's release a key part of his agenda during his trip to the US.

A Chhatra League leader was killed in a clash between two factions of the ruling Awami League's student group over leasing of a pond on 8 April.
Postgraduate doctors protested for the 2nd day against the non-payment of their salaries.
Punjab University faculty continued to stage protest rallies against the violence carried out by the IJT on their campus.
Dozens of students from the University of Veterinary and Animal Sciences protested to oppose the shift of their faculty to the Ravi campus in Pattoki.
Hundreds of Seraiki students and political activists staged a demonstration to demand Seraiki demands be included in the 18th Constitutional Amendment.

Activists of the Nepali Congress Regional Working Committee of Ramechhap district staged a sit-in outside the NC headquarters in Sanepa. They staged demonstration demanding action against the district president and scrapping the active membership being distributed with irregularities. The activists chanted slogans and created obstacles in front of the office, where a central committee meeting was underway.

Residents of Korangi in Karachi protested against power outages. They burned tires to block roads and threw stones at passing vehicles . Police peacefully dispersed the demonstrators.

On April 8, 2010, over 80 families from Choeung Ek commune in Dangkor district protested outside Wat Botum in Phnom Penh. The villagers requested the Prime Minister's intervention in settling a land dispute between themselves and other villagers.
JUI-F activists protested, blocked roads and threw rocks at passers-by and police officers following the targeted killing of 2 of their members. Rangers and police personnel restored order.

Activists of the PTI continued their protest against power outages and rising gas prices.

APCA members and UHS employees protested outside to demand regularization of UHS employees. UHS employees also continued their hunger strike camp outside the Punjab Assembly, while APCA member protested on The Mall and blocked traffic.
Relative of an abducted women protested to demand the police register a case about her disappearance.

Protests against the renaming of the NWFP continued for the 8th consecutive day in Abbottabad. Protesters also clashed with police and attacked the office of the ANP. Calls for a Hazara province were also made.
Civil society activists protested against what they called the sidelining of the judiciary and the rising prices of basic necessities.
Demonstrations against the renaming of the NWFP continued in Hazara division, including in Abbottabad, Manshera and Havelian.
Hundreds of people demonstrated on the streets and blocked Balakot road to protest the suspension of construction of the Jagir-Gul-Dari road.

Different protests occurred in Multan: Activists of the PML-N held a demonstration in support of a Pakistani cricketer and Indian tennis star who are to be married in mid-April; residents protested against lengthening power outages.

Contractors with the Punjab government staged a protest demonstration after cheques they had received from the District Accounts Office bounced. They blocked roads and attempted to force entry into the District Accounts Office, but a heavy contingent of police arrived to restore calm.

assoc_actor_1: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship
notes: On 7 April 2010, UDD red shirts red shirts demonstrators stormed into the Parliament in khwaeng Dusit (Dusit, Bangkok), claiming that they wanted to search for the Deputy PM. They forced their way inside the barred gate with a truck, forcing riot police to retreat. Demonstrators assaulted a military police officer and seized his weapons. Cabinet ministers and MPs fled the compound by helicopter.

Agitating students of Jahangirnagar University (JU) on Wednesday night vandalized a Dhaka bound bus of Borak Paribahan on Dhaka-Aricha high-way adjacent to the university main gate over an issue regarding the bus fare, injuring around 20 passengers.

The supporters of Sociological Chhatra Front of Jagannath University (JnU) unit April 7 formed a human chain in front of Shaheed Minar in Dhaka city, demanding exemplary punishment to the culprits who are physically assaulting the female students in different schools, colleges and universities.

Postgraduate students of the Liaquat University of Medical and Health Sciences protested on the civil hospital road and outside the local press club to demand a monthly salary raise and release of withheld salaries.
The Punjab University Academic Staff Association held a protest rally against the IJT for their violent acts committed on university ground earlier.
On April 7, locals in Dhaka's Uttar Khan area staged demonstrations demanding punishment in the rape of a young girl in the area.

At least 15 Jubo League activists entered the Ghorashala municipality office in Palash upazila and assaulted a female councillor along with other employees for alleged delay in payment of bills, on April 7.

White and black groups, protesting each others cause nearly clash when they gather outside a Venterdorp court as two murder suspects appeared before magistrates for the murder of Terre Blanche. Police helped restrain the two groups.
Municipal workers carried the body of a dead colleague into Libreville city hall to protest an ongoing labor dispute.

On April 7, 2010, villagers from Kiri Vong district staged a land-dispute protest in the capital Phnom Penh. The residents claimed a NGO planted acacia trees on their land. The protest was broken up by police.
Growers held a demonstration to protest against the failure of the food department to provide them gunny bags for wheat procurement
Members of the Sui Southern Gas Officer's Association protested in front of the sSGC head office against the killing of a senior SSGC office in Quetta on Apr.5.
Scores of activists of the Sunni Rehbar Council blocked the MA Jinnah road for several hours to demand the government resolve their grievances.
People and political activists held a demonstration on Phakka-Khudabadlink road in Dadu to protest against the shifting of the venue of a proposed cadet college from Khudabad to Kakar.
A Christian group staged a protest demonstration outside the National Press Club after unidentified armed men attempted to occupy a church but were prevented by police.

Relatives of 3 women killed by criminals protested on Lahore Ring Road after police failed to hand over the bodies to the relatives. A heavy police contingent baton charged the protesters and "brutally tortured" them.
Lawyers blocked roads and staged a protest demonstration against the failure of police to recover the stolen car of one of their colleagues.

IDPs from Orakzai blocked Pajagi road in Peshawar to protest after problems occurred during their registration. While protesting, local residents forced them to open the road at gunpoint, with IDPs dispersing.
Demonstrations against the renaming of the NWFP continued in Hazara division, including in Abbottabad, Manshera and Havelian.
Demonstrations against the renaming of the NWFP continued in Hazara division, including in Abbottabad, Manshera and Havelian.
A Ogwa trade union protests the lack of security in the State.

Protests continued in Hazara divison in Abbottabad and Manshera against the renaming of NWFP. Roads were blocked (including the Karakorum Highway), marches were engaged in, billboards were smashed and tires were burned. PML-Q members were also present during the protests.

assoc_actor_1: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship
notes: On 6 April 2010, UDD red-shirt demonstrators gathered to demonstrate in front of the King Naresuan shrine in Mae Sot (MS, Tak), demanding a House dissolution and verbally attacking the Privy Council President.

On April 6, 2010, vendors protested near Psar Leu market in Sihanoukville (Preah Sihanouk). The vendors are unhappy with restrictions that have been implemented to manage traffic in the area because their businesses are being negatively impacted.
200 protesters gather at Tahrir Square to protest the Mubarak regime. Police move in and beat with batons and arrest 90, many others fight back.
On April 6, human chains were formed in Sirajganj (assumed city) protesting the killing and sexual abuse of two schoolboys.
A group of activists of Bangladesh Chhatra League on Tuesday ransacked the office of Kushtia Government College, demanding that a leader of the ruling party-backed student body be freed on bail.

On April 6, students of different schools and their guardians staged a human chain on Airport Road in the Sylhet city's Chowdekhi area demanding immediate arrest of the accused in the murder and rape of two school boys.
Gay and lesbian rights activists gather at a courthouse to oppose the bail of a man who raped a lesbian.

On April 6, Jubo League activists assaulted a councillor and some employees of the Ghorashal Pourasava office after a delay in payment of their bill on, in Palash upazila's Ghorashal.
The DNA staged a protest against the Government's detention of General Sarath Fonseka and the forcible removal of a Buddhist monks protest.

notes: Chairman of the Madhesi Janadhikar Forum (MJF) Upendra Yadav led a sit-in staged by his party at Sunsari District Administration Office.
Egyptian police beat up demonstrators demanding an end to the emergency law that dates back to 1981 and arrested dozens of protesters.

assoc_actor_1: PFUJ: Pakistan Federal Union of Journalists; Journalists (Pakistan)
notes: The PFUJ, as well as the Punjab, Faisalabad, Gujranwala, and Lahore journalist unions, as well as leaders of oppositions parties, members of bar associations and other civil society members staged a peaceful protest rally which marched from the Lahore Press Club to Charing Cross, ending in a sit-in, to demand freedom of the press, to protest violence by doctors against journalists last week, and the withdrawal of cases against journalists following the clash at Jinnah Hospital.

On April 6, 2010, approximately 100 market vendors protested outside the market in Banan (Battambang). The protest related to the attempted forced eviction by the police and military police. The vendors were previously given notice to vacate the site and that deadline had passed.

Protests continued in Hazara divison in Abbottabad and Manshera against the renaming of NWFP. Roads were blocked (including the Karakorum Highway), marches were engaged in, billboards were smashed and tires were burned. PML-Q members were also present during the protests.
A violent protest demonstration and complete strike occurred in Larkana, organized by the JSMM.
Hundreds of people of the Phulpoto community engaged in a protest-rally against lawlessness in Khairpur. There was a march from Sardar House to the local press club.

Numerous towns across Sindh, including many of the larger districts HQs, have engaged in complete strikes on the call of nationalist parties, who engaged in a peaceful rally against what they call atrocities committed by the paramilitary forces.
Dozens of PTI activists staged a rally to protest against rising gas and electricity prices.

The activists of major political parties, including the PPP and PML-Q, staged a protest rally against the poor law and order and what they see as the unjustified arrests by police. Protests occurred outside the local press club.
Traders, commuters and civil society activists staged a demonstration against the government for not starting the construction of Gondlanwala road.

assoc_actor_1: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship
notes: On 5 April 2010, UDD red shirts demonstrators attacked seven officials of the Bangkok Metropolitan Administration (BMA) in Phra Nakhon district (PN, Bangkok) who were carrying out their duty to provide mobile toilet services to demonstrators at Phan Fa bridge.

assoc_actor_1: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship
notes: On 5 April 2010, UDD red shirts demonstrators stormed the Election Commission's office in the Chaeng Wattana Government Centre in Lak Si district (LS, Bangkok) to demand an early decision in the alleged donation scandal involving the ruling Democrat Party. The demonstrators managed to break past the police cordon and gathered in front of the EC office in protest.

A group of Buddhist monks staged a protest demanding the release of General Sarath Fonseka. Demonstrators were manhandled and violently removed from a group of people who were allegedly protected by the police.
A 17 year-old was shot dead after police used live ammunition to quell a service delivery riot in Highveld, Mpumalanga.

On April 5, local people staged a protest and blocked the Dhaka-Chittagong rail line at Khanabari railway station at Raipura upazila in Narsingdi, demanding stoppage of Titas commuter train at the station.
Doctors engaged in post-graduate studies protested outside the OPDS against the non-payment of their salaries.
The nursing staff of the Pakistan Institute of Medical Sciences staged a 6-hour demonstration against the torture of their colleagues after a man slapped a nurse.
A hunger-strike camp has been maintained for the 5th day in front of the Punjab Assembly by contract employees of the University of Health Sciences.

actor2: Police Forces of Pakistan (2008-2013) Pakistan Rangers
notes: On 5 April, two sacked security guards of the Fauji Fertilizer Company attempted self-immolation outside the gates of the company in Mirpur Mathelo city (Ghotki, Sindh) during a demonstration by workers against the termination of 56 security guards and the registration of cases against 106 workers who had protested against their services. Rangers were deployed and used batons to disperse the demonstrators.
On April 5, about 100 people were left injured when two rival groups from Rahmatganj and Natun Bhangabari areas in Sadar upazila, Sirajganj clashed over establishing supremacy in the area.

Hundreds of aggravated students from Omar Samatar secondary school held a demonstration against Piracy and dumping toxins by foreign ships in the water of Somlia.The demonstrators who were chanting with banner written "We do not need NATO and EU ships in Somalia water" and other words marched in the streets of the school.
Hundreds of people, including large numbers of students, formed a human chain in Sirajganj town to demand exemplary action against people accused of sexually abusing a school boy on April 5.

Students of the Noakhali University of Science and Technology (NUST) put up barricades in front of the institution, on the Sonapur-Akter Miar Hat road, demanding uninterrupted power supply on April 5.
Different organisations formed a human chain to protest the harassment of a schoolgirl who later committed suicide, outsider her residence in Dhaka city on April 5.
600 protesters, led by Mohamed el-Baradei, call for government reform.
Demonstrators burnt tires and put up black flags in Damana, Padiyatalawa, Uhana and Dehiattakandiya to denounce election-related violence.

Supporters of UPFA Gampaha District candidate staged a protest in Mirigama to denounce the alleged assault on them by supporters of another UPFA candidate.
Demonstrators burnt tires and put up black flags in Damana, Padiyatalawa, Uhana and Dehiattakandiya to denounce election-related violence.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: A minor disagreement over a business deal between local Maoist cadre Ram Chanda Ghimire, who owns a private business in Simikot, and NC cadre Ravi Basnet took a turn for the worse, leading to a violent clash between the two parties. Cadres of both the parties vandalised each other's offices. A curfew was imposed on the district in response.

Brohi community members protested outside the Jinnah Bagh against a local PML-N leader for allegedly destroying wheat crops and agricultural implements, as well as injuring 3 people in a bid to encroach upon their land.

On April 5, 2010, 5 families from Prek Tanuo village in Chakangre Leu commune protested at City Hall in Phnom Penh. The families are facing eviction and alleged that commune officials threatened to destroy their homes if they did not accept the offered compensation.
On April 5, 2010, approximately 300 villagers continued protesting for a second day in Kandal Steung (Kandal). The villagers are engaged in a land dispute with a private company.
Residents of Gheto Noorani Goth and adjoining villages held a demonstration outside the Hyderabad Press Club against an attack on the head of the Indus Development Organization.
Former nazims organized a rally for the creation of a Bahawalpur province, under the platform of the Bahawalpur United Front organization.

A large number of members from civil society organizations staged a protest demonstration on The Mall against an attack by IJT members on Punjab University, including the severe injuries done to a professor there. They blocked traffic, and the protest as attended by many groups, including the WPP. Teachers from the Punjab University also staged a peaceful protest march.
The Karakorum Highway remained blocked for more than 9 hours while protesters blocked roads and engaged in complete strikes across Hazara Division against the renaming of the NWFP.

Members of the All Pakistan Habib Ex-Bank Workers Action Committee staged a protest outside the National Assembly against the removal of lower employees during the privatization of the Habib Bank Limited.
SSGC employees rioted and blocked Samungli road in protest after the killing of an SSGC manager by unidentified gunmen. Police fired tear gas to disperse protesters.
A rally was staged, primarily by political workers and local government representatives, in the historic Gor Gathri neighborhood of Karachi against the renaming of the NWFP.

assoc_actor_1: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship
notes: On 4 April 2010, a large number of UDD red shirts gathered to demonstrate in front of the National Broadcasting Television (NBT) on Vibhavadi-Rangsit road in Phaya Thai district (PT, Bangkok) against the current government administration.

On 4 April, leaders and activists of the local unit of the ruling Awami League staged a demonstration in Gomostapur upazila headquarters (Nawabganj, Rajshahi), demanding withdrawal of the officer-in-charge of Gomostapur police station, Babar Ali.

At least five persons were injured in a clash between the police and hawkers on North South Road of Suritola in Old Dhaka on April 4. The clash occurred when the police tried to dismantle the makeshifts shops built by the hawkers on the pavement and some portions of the North South Road.
Punjab University faculty continued to stage protest rallies against the violence carried out by the IJT on their campus.
A hunger-strike camp has been maintained for the 4th day in front of the Punjab Assembly by contract employees of the University of Health Sciences.
On April 4, at least 20 people were injured when two rival groups of villagers clashed over a land dispute at Bangalpara village (Chilmari, Kurigram).
On April 4, locals in Manikganj district town protested against the insufficient power and water supply in the town by staging a demonstration.
On April 4, rioting locals vandalised vehicles and placed barricades on roads against the death of a person in a road accident in Dhaka's Keraniganj upazila town.
On April 4, at least 10 people were injured when two rival groups of villagers clashed at Kodda village (Sadar upazila, Brahamanbaria) over establishing supremacy in the village.
A clash broke out during an election meeting between two group of UPFA supporters - one of the groups was led by the chairman of the Maho Pradeshiya Sabha. The clash caused several wounded.
The People's Action for Free and Fair Elections (PAFFREL) reported the assault of the residence of a JVP member in Thambuttegama and of the JVP office in Matara in what seemed to be isolated acts.
A clash between supporters of two different UPFA candidates erupted in Ampara town and led to a number of injuries.
The People's Action for Free and Fair Elections (PAFFREL) reported the assault of the residence of a JVP member in Thambuttegama and of the JVP office in Matara in what seemed to be isolated acts.
On Apr 4, An ICS cadre was lynched by a mob in Hathazari sub-district of Chittagong District for attempting to abduct a college girl.

JSMM activists attempted to hoist their party's flags at Gulshan-e-Hadeed chowk in Karachi, but were prevented by police. They then protested by blocking the National Highway and threw stones at passing vehicles and law enforcers, injuring a member of the Rangers. Security officials then used tear gas to disperse the demonstrators and arrested 13 JSMM activists.

On April 4, 2010, approximately 400 persons blocked the National Road 2 in Kandal Steung district, Kandal province. The residents protested that clearing equipment was sent days earlier to a contested rice field. Conflicting reports indicate that the military police had used violence to disperse the protesters by beating some with batons.

assoc_actor_1: MJF: Madhesi Jana Adhikar Forum, Nepal
notes: The Madhesi Janadhikar Forum (MJF) took out a torch rally in Rajbiraj as part of their second phase of Madhes agitation. The rally that started from the local Shiva temple was led by MJF Chairman Upendra Yadav, Co-Chairman Jayprakash Prasad Gupta and Treasurer Renukumari Yadav. The party claimed that they would make the government implement the earlier agreements.

On April 4, 2010, residents in Prampi Makara (Phnom Penh) assaulted two men with rocks and staves. The men were suspected of earlier stealing a mobile phone. The police intervened and ended the assault.
Protesters, mostly farmers, demonstrated in Nghe An province on April 4 against evictions due to rural land acquisition by the government and were met by threatening police forces.
A protest demonstration occurred against rising inflation and poverty, which was addressed by the leader of the Tehreek-e-Khaksar.

After doctors and hospital guards attacked the attendants of a female patient and then refused to continue to treat patients, other relatives of patients clashed with doctors, leading to some injuries. Police later arrived to restore order.
The protest against renaming the NWFP continued for a 4th day in Abbottabad. Traders also started a complete strike across the Hazara region.
Transporters in Islamabad blocked roads to protest against parking tickets given by police.
Students of the Islamia University engineering college protested for the 2nd consecutive day against the varsity administration for taking action against students and the former principal.

On 3 April 2010, more than 20 activists, including students, demonstrated in front of the Chinese Consulate in tambon Phra Sing, Mueang Chiang Mai district of Chiang Mai, Thailand, to protest against the construction of several dams in China that would negatively impact the Mekong river. [size=more than 20]

assoc_actor_1: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship
notes: On 3 April 2010, UDD red shirts demonstrators at Rajprasong Intersection in Pathum Wan district (PW, Bangkok) numbered at 30,000 as they continued their protest against the current government's administration.

Leaders and workers of a faction of main opposition BNP here knocked down a stage on April 3 where central leaders were supposed to address a rally on April 4 at Chandpur Hasan Ali Govt High School in Chandpur. They also attacked the BNP men who tried to prevent the vandalism, leaving five workers injured and burnt an effigy of central BNP leader Shah Moazzem Hossain, a former deputy prime minister and Jatiya Party leader.

Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) men allegedly abducted a cosmetic shop owner on April 3 evening and beat him up. Locals told that Chhatra League men led by its Shahjahanpur upazila unit general secretary Asaduzzaman Liton picked up Layeb Ali, 40,from his shop at Noimail under the same upazila.
Punjab University faculty continued to stage protest rallies against the violence carried out by the IJT on their campus.
A hunger-strike camp has been maintained for the 3rd day in front of the Punjab Assembly by contract employees of the University of Health Sciences.

Students of the Government Girls Degree College in Quetta Cantonment continued their protest against the administration. The girls ransacked the college, attacked teachers and locked the principal in a room to demand their grievances be resolved.
FRAC protested election results
Protesters demonstrated against a statue to be set up in Dakar for Senegals independence day. The statues regarded as obscene and expensive.
Police forcibly disperse rioters by firing teargas into the crowd.
Youths riot against the killing of a man by police.
IJT members staged a protest-rally following an alleged attack and abduction of their members by PkSF members. They marched from the Government Commerce College to the Karachi Press Club.

Workers of the Fauji Fertilizer Company demonstrated and staged a sit-in, blocking the entrances and exits to the management offices and residential colony of the FFC for about three hours against the sacking of security guards.
ANP members staged a rally following the arrest of one of their activists for possessing a weapon. The demonstrators blocked Shorab Goth road with burning tires and threw stones at passing vehicles.
Heirs and relatives of 2 murdered traders rioted in the Domala neigborhood of Sialkot, burning down a police post and destroying some vehicles. They were protesting alleged inaction by the police.
A group of farmers marched from Rajanpur district to protest in Lahore against chronic water shortages in their area. They engaged in a sit-in at the local press club.
Residents of Abbottabad protested against the changing the name of the NWFP for the third day. They burned tires and blocked roads.

IJT members staged a demonstration to express solidarity with teachers of Punjab University against IJT members who attack a professor and ransacked offices. They say the incident was part of a conspiracy to malign the IJT.
Students of the Islamia University engineering college protested against the varsity administration for taking action against students and the former principal.

assoc_actor_2: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship
notes: On 2 April 2010, pink-shirted demonstrators held rallies at Lumpini Park in Pathum Wan district (PW, Bangkok) to express their opposition to the UDD red shirts demand for House dissolution. A small clash occurred when a Red Shirt activist on a motorcycle was attacked by pink-shirted demonstrators as he passed.

On 2 April 2010, protesters, including teachers from Chulalongkorn University, wearing pink shirts gathered in kwaeng Lumpini, Pathum Wan district of Bangkok, Thailand, to demonstrate against the UDD demonstrations and the parliament dissolution, and to demand peace. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship
notes: On 2 April 2010, two men wearing red shirts and carrying a UDD flag drove by the site of the pink-shirt protest, comprised of teachers, in kwaeng Lumpini, Pathum Wan district of Bangkok, Thailand. They were beaten by the pink-shirt protesters. [size=no report]

2 ASWJ activists were wounded during a march towards the Karachi Press Club where they had planned to demonstrate the murder of their leaders and members. A rival sect began shouting at them, and gunfire then allegedly broke out targeting the ASWJ rally. Angry ASWJ youth members then burned tires and blocked traffic until police assured them they would arrest the culprits. The march continued and the demonstration still occurred.
On 1 and 2 Arpil, residents of Sylhet city staged protest demonstrations and blocked different roads in the city and on its outskirts demanding immediate restoration of power and water supply.
Two groups of traders of Chandni Chawk Market in Dhaka city on April 2 were locked into a clash, leaving at least 10 traders injured.

On 2 April, leaders and activists of the Jubo League, youth front of the ruling Awami League, attacked a sub-inspector of the police and vandalised the Shyamnagar upazila police station (Satkhira, Khulna), after a drug related investigation by the inspector in which they were involved.
A large number of varsity teachers from Punjab University protested against the actions of IJT activists who attacked a professor and ransacked offices after some IJT students were expelled.

A large number of people, including shopkeepers and activists of political parties, assembled outside the police station and hospital to engage in a protest demonstration after the death of a young boy in a crossfire between police and criminals.
A hunger-strike camp has been maintained for the 2nd day in front of the Punjab Assembly by contract employees of the University of Health Sciences.

source: Centre For Monitoring Election Violence CMEV
notes: A group of UNP supporters attacked other UNP supporters following a different candidate. Some of them were hospitalised.
On April 2, at least 16 people were injured after two rival groups from Maria and Nausera villages clashed with each other over a land dispute in Nausera Village (Bagatipara, Natore).

actor2: CPJP: Convention of Patriots for Justice and Peace
source: AFP; Radio Ndeke Luka; Africa Research Bulletin
notes: CPJP members attacked a group of teachers that were staging a protest against violence following the murder of a teacher by the CPJP. CAR forces protecting the town responded and subsequantly clashed with the group, leaving around a dozen killed. Hundreds of people fled the town after the clashes.

actor1: CPJP: Convention of Patriots for Justice and Peace
source: Radio Ndeke Luka; AFP; Africa Research Bulletin
notes: CPJP members attacked a group of teachers that were staging a protest against violence following the murder of a teacher by the CPJP. CAR forces protecting the town responded and subsequantly clashed with the group, leaving around a dozen killed. Hundreds of people fled the town after the clashes.
On April 2, bus workers barricaded the Sherpur-Dhunot road after a bus worker was assaulted by locals, in Durgapur's Chowbaria area.
On April 2, a rioting group of people demonstrating against the lack of smooth power supply clashed with police officials in Alfadanga upazila headquarters, injuring 5 people.
UPFA supporters clashed with each other while they were returning home after a rally attended by President Rajapaksa. Ten supporters have reported injuries.

assoc_actor_1: CPJP: Convention of Patriots for Justice and Peace
notes: Members of the CPJP attack a group of teachers who were protesting against them.

Protesters, including members of the PML-Q and JI, engaged in demonstrations against the changing of the NWFP's name, including blocking the Karakoram Highway for four hours and engaging in a complete strike in parts of Hazara division.
Protesters attacked the TMA office in Sukkar, breaking windows and ransacking furniture, due to an acute shortage of drinking water for over a month.
An "Elite Force" official at the Prime Minister's House was found strangled and burnt to death along Chakwal-Rawalpindi Road after going missing after his return from duty.
Residents of Mussiari protested outside the TMA offices against the alleged occupation of their land by the Punjab government.

A protest rally led by a former president of the Supreme Court Bar Asssociation marched through Quetta and ended in a sit-in outside the Provincial Assembly. The demonstrators demanded the recovery of a kidnapped lawyer.
IJT student members protested against the expulsion of some of their fellow student members from Punjab University on Canal Road.
Shopkeepers and activists of various politician parties including the Citizens Action Committee protested against power outages.

The Chunikhel VDC in Kathmandu district became tense after a truck killed a minor on Thursday afternoon. Irate locals took the vehicle under their control and demanded that the truck driver be brought in front of them, staging a demonstration in the area. Police became involved, leading to a minor clash.

A protest organised by students from Sabaragamuwa University (of the IUSF) was organised in from of the University Grants Commission in Colombo City and was moved to the town hall after being dispersed by police forces.
students of the University of Liberia reportedly tore down schedules for the new semester in protest of the rise in tuition and fees.
Moderate Islamists in the Somali capital staged a demonstration against al Shabaab, vowing to fight the radical group.

Jubo League activists on Friday laid siege to Sudharam police station in Maijdee in Noakhali district and blocked the road, demanding release of a Jubo League leader who was arrested Thursday night. Riot police were deployed to bring the situation under control.
On April 1, people of Hindu community held programs in Madaripur town, demanding recovery of temple lands from illegal occupiers and punishment to the criminals who injured devotees.
On 1 and 2 Arpil, residents of Sylhet city staged protest demonstrations and blocked different roads in the city and on its outskirts demanding immediate restoration of power and water supply.
People of Hindu community held protest programmes in Jessore town on April 1, demanding recovery of temple lands from illegal occupiers and punishment to the criminals who injured devotees.

Residents of Widh Widh staged a demonstration against the Government of Somaliland and Puntland. The residents were also joined by traditional leaders and local administrators. A2/Demonstration/(0/10)/ (00)//Widh Widh/Somaliland/20100406.910
Primary schoolteachers marched and held a demonstration outside the local press club to demand increases salaries and allowances.
Journalists across the country protested in solidarity with the PUJ who are demanding that doctors who beat journalists at Jinnah Hospital in Lahore be booked by police.
Journalists across the country protested in solidarity with the PUJ who are demanding that doctors who beat journalists at Jinnah Hospital in Lahore be booked by police.

The faculty of Punjab University went on strike for an indefinite period following an attack by IJT activists on campus. Some faculty members also held a protest walk from campus to Shaikh Zayeb hospital.

Primary school teacher candidates protested outside the MPAs hostel and demanded early issuance of appointment letters.

The Punjab Union of Journalists has protested in front of the Lahore Press Club to demand police book doctors involved in beating journalists at Jinnah Hospital on March.31.
A hunger-strike camp was established in front of the Punjab Assembly by contract employees of the University of Health Sciences.

Dozens of activists of the IJT attacked a senior professor at the Punjab University, critically injuring him, ransacking his office, damaging his vehicle, and attacking the Vice Chancellor's Office and VC House, after some IJT students were expelled. The IJT activists outnumbered guards at the scene who did not attempt to stop them.
Two groups of traders clashed with each other over disputes around the election to the market committee at Dhaka's Chandni Chawk market on April 1, injuring 10.
On April 1, two rival groups of AL workers clashed with each other after an altercation between activists from the two factions in Sharsha's Benapole.
Protests over motor vehicle tax
A clash erupted between UNF and UPFA supporters when the latter blocked UNF candidate from campaigning.
Protesters demanded release of Prime Minister who was being detained by the military
The BYA took to the streets to protest against the re-nomination of the leader of the (EXCOF) Executive Council of the Federation.
Protests against secession
A group of prisoners at Adiala jail observed a hunger strike against alleged torture of prisoners by a jail official.
The Khattak Ittehad held a hunger strike to protest against the deteriorating law and order situation in the area.
Hundreds of people staged a protest over the renaming of the NWFP as Pakhtoonkhwa Khyber
During a police raid in Aabpara Market, about 15-20 residents resisted police, leading to a brawl. Some of the rioters tried to steal weapons from the police.
Members of the National Party engaged in a march and demonstration outside the Quetta Press Club against power outages.

At least six students and two policemen were injured when a clash erupted during the science examination at the Satyadevi Higher Secondary School Bopur in Chainpur, Bajhang District. The clash occurred when policemen appeared for the exam and tried to submit pre-filled answer sheets in the exam hall. The other examinees demonstrated their actions and began chanting slogans. The police had to discharge a tear gas shell to bring the situation in the exam centre under control. In addition to the injuries, the roof and furniture of the school were damaged in the clash.

Different protests occurred outside the Hyderabad Press Club: SPLA members protested against police abuses suffered by their members during a protest in Karachi; members of the Highway Works Department protested for their promotions; peoples of the Parhiyar community protested to demand the release of a community youth; teachers of the ESRA Educational Project protested to demand regularization of their services.

Leaders and activists of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) at Rajshahi University (RU) in Rajshahi city on March 31 staged a protest and laid a siege to the office of the statistics department alleging secret liaison between a section of teachers and Shibir men.
Scores of primary school teachers marched to demand a raise in their salaries and allowances.

Medical staff of the Jinnah Postgrad Medical Centre staged a protest march from the hospital to Regent Plaza and blocked traffic for two hours to show their opposition of the transfer authority over the JPMC to the Sindh government.
Scores of lady health workers protested after they decided to stage a later protest and sit-in in front of CM House if they are not given a raise and have their salaries immediately released.
Members of the Sindh Professors and Lecturers Association protested in Sukkar against abuses suffered by their members during a protest in Karachi.

Members of the Sindh Professors and Lecturers Association protested in Karachi against alleged abuses suffered by their members at the hands of the police. The SPLA also boycotted classes in a number of areas of Sindh.
Staff nurses of the Chandka Medical College and Teaching Hospital in Larkana protested against their medical superintendent and staged a sit-in outside his office.
MQM-H members protested outside the Karachi Central Jail and Press Club following an adjournment of a criminal case, with verdict pending, against two MQM-H leaders.
Members of the All Sindh Education Department Lower Staff Association protested to demand the regularization of their contracts (specific location not given).

Mangnejo community members staged a sit-in protest at the National Highay near Dargah Shah Hussain (lat/longs not available) to demand the arrest of those responsible for killing a notable of their community in Madeji.

A Kolhi community member died from injuries sustained in a clash with the Rind community at Mirpur Khas hospital. Following the death his relatives staged a sit-in protest at Mirwah Road to demand those responsible be arrested.
Hundreds of members of the Baloch community protested and blocked the National Highway in protest against the occupation of 55 acres of land by WAPDA authorities (specific location not given).
Passengers affected by a highway robbery staged a sit-in protests on the National Highway near NF. They were peacefully dispersed by a DPO who assured them that the perpetrators would be arrested.
Leaders of different groups protested against the administration of the Naushahro Feroze hospital following the closure of its cardiac ward due to a lack of heart specialists.

Different protests occurred in Khairpur: Residents of Luqman Mohalla staged a sit-in protest at the Khairpur-Pir Jo Goth link road following a police raid which they say violated the respect of woman and children and led to the arrest of an innocent man; prsioners of the Khairpur central jail protested against the jail administration for not restoring supplies of water, power and gas to their facilities; traders protested against power outages and the poor law and order situation, they staged a sit-in and burned tires.
Residents protested to demand the arrest of accused killers.

Members of the Growers' Union, accompanied by at least one STPP member, protested outside the local press club against the Food Inspector for allegedly selling bags of seed which are supposed to be distributed freely.

Activists of the JSQM protested outside the local press club against a police raid on the Gulshan-e-Hadeed neighbourhood of Karachi and against the registration of allegedly fake cases against their chairman.

A complete strike was held in Umerkot against the registration of an allegedly fake case against a PPP activist. Residents of the Malhi community also engaged in a protest rally, which led to a clash between community-members and the police involving police using batons and tear gas to disperse the demonstrators.
The Shehri Action Committee and the traders of Tando Bago and Dio towns protested against the arrest of former UC Nazim Sain Bux Jamali (specific location not given).
Activists of the JSQM protested outside the local press club against the registration of allegedly fake cases against their leaders and their "disappearance".
Activists of the JSQM protested outside the local press club against the registration of allegedly fake cases against their chairman and the torching of their party's flags.

About 200 farmers laid siege to the local power supply office and locked the main gate of the office for about 2 hours demanding smooth supply of power for irrigation purposes at Faridpur district's Sadarpur upazila on March 31.
Members of the Hindu community formed a human chain to protest against the attack on devotees at a Hindu temple by alleged land grabbers, in Jessore town on March 31.

Dock workers staged a sit-in for an hour and a half demanding the Prime Minister's intervention in order to reinstate their jobs outside the Chittagong Port Authority office in Chittagong on March 31.
On Mar 31, two groups of transport workers clashed following an earlier altercation in Chapai Nababganj. No serious injuries were reported in the clash.
On Mar 31, hundreds of farmers demonstrated in district town Chapai Nababganj demanding power supply to save their boro-plants.
Protests over motor vehicle tax

Seven students were injured during a clash erupted between two groups of students of the National Diploma in Technology (NDT) at the Moratuwa University. The clash erupted as a consequence of disagreements on ragging.
A Muslim human rights group protests the deportation of suspected Islamic militants from Kenya.
Local traders carried out a protest rally and besieged the HESCO office in Sukkar due to power outages.
Residents and traders in Khairpur have staged a sit-in protest against power outages.
Protests occurred against PEPCO and increasing power outages, including protesters blocking traffic and burning tires, while chanting slogans against the government.
Protests occurred against PEPCO and increasing power outages, including protesters blocking traffic and burning tires, while chanting slogans against the government.
