Large numbers of demonstrators gathered in Swabi to protest against the name change of the NWFP, including people from Swabi, Dobian, Yar Hussain, Sard Cheena, and Ismailia. Ittehad Kashthkaran organized the protests.
Protests occurred against PEPCO and increasing power outages, including protesters blocking traffic and burning tires, while chanting slogans against the government.
Residents protested against the government for not releasing funds for the Lowari Tunnel project which is currently under construction.
Members of the Traders Action Committee stage a protest rally against the Islamabad Electric Supply Company due to power outages.
WPP members have protested to demand an end to the contract system for hiring public sector workers.

Different protests occurred in Islamabad: A protest rally was held by people from Hazara Division in Aabpara market in Islamabad to demand that Hazara Division be excluded from the NWFP if it is going to be renamed Pakhtunkhwa; medical students who took a scholarship from the Cuban Government and their families have protested in front of the Higher Education Commission in Islamabad due to the poor quality of the Cuban colleges and their inability to pass the Pakistan Medical and Dental Council test based on the education they received there.
Thousands protest outside the headquarters of the electoral commission, demanding the removal of its chairman before the next election, April 2011.
On Mar 30, at least 50 people were injured as rival villagers clashed over occupying a water body at Ichhapur village (Khaliajuri, Netrakona).
At least 15 activists of Bangladesh Chhatra League Islamic University (IU) unit were injured in a factional clash on the campus in Jenaidah on March 30.

On 30 March, Bangladesh Chhatra League activists staged a protest and halted the movement of Chittagong University bound shuttle trains in Chittagong University campus in Hathazai, Chittagong, against the attack on BCL CU unit leader Jahidul Islam Jewel on the CU campus by some outsiders Sunday afternoon.

assoc_actor_1: BCL: Bangladesh Chhatra League; Jubo League; Students (Bangladesh)
notes: Rival groups of BCL and Jubo League clashed with sticks over tender at Daudkandi in Comilla on March 30, leaving at least 12 people injured. Police fired rubber bullets into the crowd to disperse them.

Government college teachers of the SPLA decided to stage a protest march from DJ College to the Sindh Chief Minister's House. On the way they were intercepted by police in full riot gear who severely beat them with batons. Dozens were arrested by the police.
The Tank Union of Journalists staged a protest against political officials and tribal elders for blocking them from covering the proceedings of a jirga.

The Worker's Party of Pakistan and other progressive political parties and student organizations staged a protest demonstration in Aabpara market in Islamabad against the labour contract systems in all public and private organizations and expressed solidarity with the struggle by Baloch's for their rights.
Bangassou residents marched to protest operations by UPDF forces on the CAR territory since June 2009 and their link with LRA rebels.
On Mar 30, at least 20 people were injured in a clash between the activists of Awami League and its student wing Bangladesh Chhatra League in Singra upazila over money matters.
On Mar 30, in Gazipur, workers of a garment factory staged demonstration and put up barricades on Dhaka-Mymensingh highway to meet their 10-point demands, including pay-hike.
On Mar 30, At least 15 activists were wounded in AL-BNP clash when Shammi Akter Shifa MP of BNP was assaulted at Amuroad bazaar in Chunarughat upazila.

assoc_actor_2: CMEV: Centre for Monitoring Election Violence
notes: On 30 March, CMEV election monitoring staff was attack by UPFA supporters who grabbed their cameras. No injuries were reported.

assoc_actor_2: CaFFE: Campaign for Free and Fair Election
notes: The CaFE reported the alleged attack of one of its election monitoring staff by a UNP supporter who thought that he was attacking a UPFA candidate. Serious injuries were reported.
A clash between UPFA and UNF supporters took place in Valaichenai. Four UNF supporters were taken into custody.
The CMEV reported a clash between two groups of UPFA supporters in Anamaduwa.
The Muslim community in Benin protested on Tuesday against the Swiss governments decision to oppose the construction of minarets in mosques.
Staff of the Pakistan Ostrich Company held a protest outside the Karachi Press Club after a customs duty dispute which led to the death of ostrich chicks they had imported.

Different protests occurred in Karachi: Staff of the Pakistan Ostrich Company held a protest outside the Karachi Press Club after a customs duty dispute which led to the death of ostrich chicks they had imported; hundreds of trade union activists, primarily Christians, protested in front of the TMA offices to demand that the Lyari TMA pay their salaries before Easter Day.
Candidates of opposing political parties clashed in Nuwara Eliya, Central on 30 March.
Members of a scheduled caste held demonstrations outside the local press club related to crimes committed by some men against girls in their community.
Gas consumers protested outside the SNGPL offices against what they call highly inflated gas bills with unjustified charges.
Employees of the UHS, with the support of the APCA, staged a protest demonstration in front of the Chief Minister's Secretariat to demand regularization for contract employees.
Traders engaged in a complete strike, blocked roads and burned tires in protest against the WAPDA and power outages.
The Workers Party Pakistan
Civil and district courts in Chunian were closed due to a 3-working day strike and protest by judges to show solidarity with their Faisalabad colleagues.

Residents and shopkeepers of the Bazaar-e-Kalan area in Peshawar blocked roads and burned tires in protest against power and water shortages. Police used batons and tear gas to disperse the protesters and allegedly beat the protesters.

Assumed on 29 Mar 2010, in Rajshahi city (Rajshahi, Rajshahi), leaders and activists of the Chhatra League (BCL) in the Rajshahi University laid siege to the statistics department office accusing their teachers of alleged liaison with Shibir men who are linked to the Feb 9 violence in the campus.

assoc_actor_1: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship
notes: On 29 March 2010, UDD red shirts demonstrators, in front of the Government House in khwaeng Dusit (Dusit, Bangkok), demonstrated in front of soldiers who guarded the house. No violence erupted despite the tension.

At least 30 persons were injured when two factions of the Chhatra League (BCL), associate student wing of the ruling Awami League, clashed on the Islamic University campus near Jhenaidah on 29 March. Police broke up the clash.

assoc_actor_2: BCL: Bangladesh Chhatra League; Students (Bangladesh); Civilians (Bangladesh); Journalists (Bangladesh)
notes: On 29 Mar 2010, in Kushtia (Kushtia, Khulna), a clash involving brickbats and sticks occurred between Chhatra League (BCL) factions in the Islamic University campus over sitting in a classroom. They also damaged computers and documents. 30 were injured, including journalists. Police dispersed the groups and arrested 3 BCL.

Hundreds of women and children marched through Somalias capital Monday to protest the destruction of tombs of Somali clerics by Al Shabaab militants. Protesters chanted "Down with al-Shabab," as dozens of armed government troops kept watch and occasionally fired shots into the air.

assoc_actor_1: APCA: All Pakistan Clerks Association; Labour Group (Pakistan); Health Workers (Pakistan)
notes: Employees of the University of Health Sciences under the banner of the APCA protested and set up a hunger strike camp in protest against being denied entry to the university and lack of regularization of teachers jobs. Paramedics from across the province also protested in a related action in front of the Punjab Assembly.

source: Centre For Monitoring Election Violence CMEV
notes: A UNP party office was attacked and damaged by UPFA supporters while they were returning from a UPFA meeting. The office was reportedly empty.

source: Centre For Monitoring Election Violence CMEV
notes: The CMEV reported the alleged attack of a UPFA meeting by a group of 400 UNP supporters. UNP supporters reportedly broke the stage of the event and set fire to the decorations and furniture but did not target UPFA supporters.
On Mar 29, BCL activists staged a protest rally in Chittagong city against the attack on their leader. While protesting, the activists went berserk and also kidnapped two train drivers.
On Mar 29, an angry mob vandalized a private clinic in Thakurgaon town following the death of a mother after giving birth to a child due to alleged negligence of doctors.
On Mar 29, locals staged a protest in Chasara Balurmath, Narayanganj, against the persisting gas crisis in the area.
On Mar 29, rival groups of BCL and Jubo League clashed over tender at Daudkandi upazila town leaving at least 12 persons.

assoc_actor_1: AL: Bangladesh Awami League; BCL: Bangladesh Chhatra League; Jubo League; Students (Bangladesh)
notes: On Mar 29, AL, BCL and Jubo League activists staged a protest demonstration in Chittagong against the arrest of their members by RAB forces.

On 29 Mar 2010, in Jugirbhaban (Kahaloo, Bogra, Rajshahi), an armed clash involving sticks and locally made weapons occurred between 2 groups of villagers over a gifted land, killing 1 and injuring 35.

assoc_actor_2: UNP: United National Party; NUW: National Union of Workers; Labour Group (Sri Lanka)
notes: A UNP candidate and leader of the National Union of Workers and some of his supporters were attacked by some men. Injuries were reported and one worker was hospitalised.
A UNP candidate was injured - and subsequently hospitalised - by a group of people who attacked him while he was coming back from a meeting in Ramboda.
A clash erupted between two groups of UPFA supporters as they were canvassing Galgediyawa area. 8 people were reported injured.

Protesters engaged in aerial firing and forced shopkeepers to shut their businesses, as well as blocking roads and burning tires, after an MQM activists was killed in their area. They also attempted to attack the North Karachi Industrial Area police station but a large contingent of police prevented them and arrested 17 people belonging to the ASWJ who were later released.

On March 29, 2010, representatives of 160 families protested in front of the office of the Cambodian Veterans Association in Kampong Cham. The villagers alleged that the association is forcing them off their land.

assoc_actor_1: MJF: Madhesi Jana Adhikar Forum, Nepal
notes: The Madhesi Jana Adhikar Forum (MJF) staged a rally in Kathmandu this afternoon. The rally led by chairman Upendra Yadav went through different thoroughfares of the city before it reached Maitighar Mandala and converged into a corner assembly. MJF leaders including joint coordinator Jayaprakash Prasad Gupta took part the rally. They demanded that the government immediately implement the 22 point agreement reached with the party and 8 point agreement inked with the Joint Democratic Madhesi Front.

assoc_actor_1: ANTUF: All Nepal Trade Union Federation (Revolutionary)
notes: The All Nepal Trade Union Federation had called a one day bandh to protest the murder of a leader of their organisation Ram Ayodhi Yadav in Siraha on March 26. Workers vandalised Rijal Tashi Industry located in Ithari for allegedly defying the bandh. Three workers were injured in the incident, in which the Maoists claim that factory staffers attacked them.

Different protests occurred in Hyderabad: Jewellers went on strike, engaged in a march and staged a sit-in protest at the clock tower roundabout against police for not recovering their stolen merchandise; retired employees and widows of TMA workers demonstrated outside the local press club to demand payment of pensions; activists of Sujar Bar Tehrik protested in Hyderabad against the torture of their leader in Karachi by Bin Qasim Town police; residents of Phulelli protested outside the Hyderabad Press Club against the sale of drugs in their area; sacked SSGC employees protested outside the local press club to demand their salaries and issuance of job appointments.

Residents of Saleh Nagore village held a demonstration in front of the Halani Press Club against the absence of doctors from a local health centre which allegedly led to the death of an injured villager.
Passengers of vehicles looted by highwaymen on the Indus Highway demonstrated and blocked the highway for 3 hours to protest against insecurity.
Tehreek-e-Insaf members protested against what they call increasing influence by the United States over Pakistan.

2 students were injured when two groups of students from the Government Degree College clashed outside an examination hall. They attacked each other with knives and stones, while some fired guns into the air.
Lawyers engaged in a protest march towards the Chief Minister's Secretariat to stage a sit-in but were prevented by police.
Relatives of a young man killed in Sangi police custody staged a sit-in and blocked the national highway with burning tires.

assoc_actor_1: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship
notes: On 28 March 2010, at 6:30am, UDD red shirts demonstrators were mobilized by leader Praipana to stage a demonstration march to the 11th Infantry Division Base in Bangkok in protest against the government.

On 28 March 2010, journalists protested in Mehrabpur city (Naushahro Feroze, Sindh), against the DIO of Naushahro Feroze for not issuing press accreditation cards to journalists outside NF, including members of the Sindh Sahafi Sangat.
On 28 March 2010, residents of Shoukatabad Colony in Mehrabpur city (Naushahro Feroze, Sindh) staged a protest demonstration against poor sanitary conditions in the area.

A family protested against the doctors of Jinnah Hospital for alleged negligence which led to the death of one of their family members was attacked by doctors at the hospital. The doctors also allegedly attacked some journalists who had come there to cover the protest.
On March 28, 2010, in Phnom Penh, over 100 teachers and parents gathered to protest the length of skirts worn by female students in school.
Service delivery riot/protesters break all the windows of the mayors home. Soon after clashed began with police.

On 28 March, Bangladesh Chhatra League activists staged a protest and halted the movement of Chittagong University bound shuttle trains in Chittagong University campus in Hathazai, Chittagong, against the attack on BCL CU unit leader Jahidul Islam Jewel on the CU campus by some outsiders Sunday afternoon.

On 28 Mar 2010, in Dhaka City (Dhaka, Dhaka), Dhaka University students put up a barricade on the road connecting Nilkhet and TSC intersections and set woods on fire demanding uninterrupted power supply at the Sir AF Rahman Hall. They left as police and authorities went to the spot.

On 28 Mar 2010, in Khagrachhari upazila (Khagrachhari, Chittagong), a rally and non-stop agitation organized by the Awami League was held at the Khagrachhari Hill District Council (KHDC) to demand removal of current leaders in the town and vowing for a BNP-Jamaat free district council.

Local journalists staged a sit-in protest outside the Dargah of Hazrat Lal Shahbaz Qalander to demand the arrest of a man who stole from an RT journalist and to raise the issue with the advisor to the Chief Minister of Sindh who was visiting it.
Journalists of Sobho Dero protested outside the Ranipur Press Club to demand authorities arrest those responsible for the death of a journalist.

assoc_actor_1: Labour Group (Pakistan); Hindu Group (Pakistan); PPP: Pakistan Peoples Party
notes: Different protests occurred in Hyderabad: Pakistan Trade Union members protested against power outages and electricity surges; members of the Solangi Social Welfare Association protested against the open sale of narcotics in the city; workers of Bangle Glass Industries protested in favour of their demands; candidates who passed the IBA Test protested for reinstatement and their withheld salaries; members of the All Hindu Shagird Association protested to demand the arrest of an accused rapist; PPP workers protested against their local leadership; members of the Left Unity Hyderabad protested against inflation; students of the University of Sindh Jamshoro protested against what they call "Israeli aggressions and attacks on the Masjid-e-Aqsa."
Different protests occurred in Mirpurkhas: A protest demonstration was staged by women of Mirpurkhas to demand the issuance of BISP stipends.
A man was injured in a clash between two segments of the Umrani community over a land dispute in the jursidiction of the Saddar police station in Karachi.

Different protests occurred in Larkana: Workers of Khaksar Tehreek protested outside the local press club against social and civic problems; the family of a man killed by a drunk police officer staged a sit in at DPO Chowk to demand the arrest of the officer.
Different political, social and religious parties organized a protest rally to demand the transfer of an SHO (specific location not given, coded as Karachi at Geoprecision 3).

A complete strike and protests were observed following a clash between two religious groups. Workers of a religious party involved in the strike engaged in aerial firing and setting tires on fire in different areas. Police arrested 2 men related to the incidents. Youths also allegedly forced some shopkeepers to close their shops.
Prisoners at Khairpur central jail continued their continued their protests.

source: Centre For Monitoring Election Violence CMEV
notes: A clash erupted between two groups of UPFA supporters, while one of the groups blocked the procession of the other.

After a clash between doctors and journalists at Jinnah Hospital, about 100 doctors and paramedical staff ransacked the Saher Cable Network and injured 10 staff members of the network "for not blocking their service" in relation to the violence between doctors and journalists at Jinnah Hospital.

Journalists injured by doctors as well as at least 20 of their colleagues at Jinnah Hospital demonstrated against the doctors who injured them. In response, one of the leading doctors allegedly went on the intercom to call doctors to attack the journalists, leading to a clash where around 40 doctors attacked the journalists.
Doctors "severely tortured and thrashed" journalists while they were attempting to report at the Civic Hospital in Gujranwala.
Rioting youths take to the streets of Jos, violently protesting the alleged killing of a friend by police.
Police push back rioting youths, dispersing them.
Hundreds of people protested against prolonged power outages and blocked numerous roads leading into Jhuddo.
A march and rally were staged by member of differen parties in Islamabad to protest power outages in the Taxila and Wah Cantonment areas.
On Mar 27, two groups of rioting activists of transport workers clashed in Panchagarh following an altercation. 20 people were injured in the clash.
Assumed on 27 Mar 2010, in Mohanpur (Rajshahi, Rajshahi), around 200 farmers laid siege to a local power office at Naohata to demand adequate power supply for their boro field irrigation.

assoc_actor_1: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship
notes: On 27 March 2010, UDD red shirts demonstrators aiming to force an early election escalated their demonstrations in Bangkok, chasing away small units of soldiers around their rally site. Several thousand demonstrators besieged the Government House in khwaeng Dusit (Dusit, Bangkok), and the stand-off between demonstrators and soldiers remained tense for about an hour.
On 27 March 2010, around 100 members of the Lumpini Exercise Group marched in Lumpini park in kwaeng Lumpini, Pathum Wan district of Bangkok, Thailand, demanding political peace. [size=around 100]

A protest rally was held by journalists against the chairman of the Board of Intermediate and Secondary Education, Larkana for allegedly "misbehaving" with a local journalist.

assoc_actor_1: FNJ: Federation of Nepali Journalists; Journalists (Nepal)
notes: The Janakpur chapter of the Federation of Nepalese Journalists held a rally this morning demonstrating against the police attack on journalists during the recent demonstrations against the rape of a newly wed Indian woman.
A oil industry Workers Union protested the killing of one of their colleagues at the hand of cultists.

23 March 2010 BBC Monitoring- The riots that recently erupted in Birkhadem, GuT de Constantine and Eucalyptus, and ignited parts of Algiers resulted in the arrest of at least 40 people. Rioters were protesting the nsecure conditions of Algerian youth.
Relatives of 10 Kenyans being held by pirates protest over the lack of governmental intervention to free them. Police disperse the crowd.

Different events occurred in Ranipur: A protest was held outside the local press club against the allege police torture of 3 boys; on the call of the Sindh Citizens' Alliance, a complete strike was observed against power outages, unemployment, and the worsening law and order situation.

Different protests occurred in Karachi: Dozens of students who have not been able to obtain their admittance cards for secondary school certificate exams staged a sit-in on Jinnah road near the Tibet Centre to bring attention to the issue; a peace walk was organized in Jamshed Town to mark Pakistan Day, involving local officials and a large number of students.
Activists of the JSQM organized a huge march in Ghotki to create awareness about tribal fueds and lawlessness in the district and held a demonstration in the city's main roundabout.

Local people blocked the Rawalpindi-Murree-Kashmir highway following a shooting incident in the area related to a land dispute. They left after being assured a case would be registered against the accused.
The Citizens Police Liaison Committee organized a peace walk including members of political parties and NGOs.

Following an attack on a bus in the area, local people blocked Attock-Kamra road with the bodies of those who had been killed. When police arrived the demonstrators threw stones at them and blamed them for the violence.
The Peshawar chapter of PTI organized a walk in support of Dr. Aafia Siddiqui's release.
Traders and shopkeepers of Bara have protested to demand the opening of the main bazaar which has been closed for seven months.
Students at DUT violently protest campus food prices, clash with police. At least one injury.

Different events occurred in Faisalabad: Following an incident during which a lawyer slapped a civil judge, a boycott of court functions was called by judges in Faisalabad; residents of the Sadar area protested and threw stones at a police vehicle due to allege police inacton following the death of a villager.

assoc_actor_1: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship
notes: On 22 March 2010, the UDD red shirts called another major protest in Bangkok where thousands of vehicles joined the anti-government parade in protest of the current administration. The procession started at the Phan Fah Bridge, before proceeding to Petchburi Road, Ratchadapisek, Ladprao, Ramkhamhaeng, Rama 4 and Yaowarat.

Riots continued today for the third day in a row in response to the alleged rape of a teenage girl by a local police officer. Marketplaces remained closed and vehicles did not ply the roads of the city. At least 35 demonstrators were injured in separate clashes with the police today, and more in previous days, including journalists.

On March 22, a day-long hartal called by students and guardians was observed at Vendamari in Pirganj upazila of Rangpur where locals also held a protest rally, demanding a Higher Secondary Certificate examination centre at Vendamari Women's College.
On 22 March, people went out on violent demonstrations in Bogra town, demanding uninterrupted power supply and blocked the road stretch in front of the Government Azizul Huq College.
Riotous protesters clash with police over two days in Mamelodi over poor train service and housing in the area. Dozens of protesters were injured, most by being shot with rubber bullets.

A religious group Vishwa Ekata Parishad called a district shutdown demanding the restoration of a Hindu state ahead of the promulgation of a new constitution in May. Members set two buses and a motorcycle on fire in Kailali district for venturing out during the general strike that has affected nearly five remote districts.
Student protesters demanding admittance cards for exams demonstrated outside the Board of Secondary Education of Karachi. After they grew unruly, police used batons to disperse the demonstrators.

Following the death of a professor who was shot by unidentified gunmen, teachers and students of the Tameer-i-Nuo educational institutions rioted outside the Civic Hospital, throwing stones, blocking roads, and protesting against the government. Police fired tear gas and used batons to disperse the demonstrators, and arrested 3 students. The Professors and Lecturers Association of Balochistan declared a boycot of classes related to the death of Professor Fazal Bari.
The journalists of Sehwan Sharif protested to demand the arrest of those responsibility for robbing the house of a Regional Times correspondent.
On March 22, residents of Mehar and Chak protested in Sukkur city (Sukkur, Sindh) to demand the arrest of men accused of injuring their community members.
On March 22, various parts of Sukkar saw protests in Sukkur city (Sukkur, Sindh) against water shortages.
On March 22, residents of different areas of Sukkar protested in Sukkur city (Sukkur, Sindh) against HESCO officials over power outages.
On March 22, patients of the Civic Hospital in Sukkur protested in Sukkur city (Sukkur, Sindh) against lack of facilities, lack of cleaning, and non-provision of medicines.

Residents of Lounge Kolhi protested against allege negligence which led to high-tension wires collapsing and causing fires in their village.
Members of the SNP protested outside the Malir Press Club in Karachi to demand the restoration of the old status of five districts of the city.

Residents of different areas of Mirpurkhas protested outside the HESCO office against power outages. Protests later became violent, with some demonstrators attacking police and ransacking the utility's Mirpurkhas division office. Members of the PPP and residents of Jacobabad protested against unsanitary conditions due to stagnant water in the Eidgah Mohalla area which the concerned authorities have failed to remove.
Local residents protested following the allege robbery of a shp by the Taluka Administrator.
protest against attacks on Attorney General and Minister of Justice

On 22 Mar 2010, in Rajshahi City (Rajshahi, Rajshahi), Chhatra League (BCL) activists severely beat a student with sticks and handed him over to police for his alleged involvement in 9 Feb violence in the Rajshahi University campus.

Between 22-23 Mar 2010, in Parbatipur upazila (Dinajpur, Rangpur), miners of the Barapukuria Coal Mine Company Ltd (BCMCL) who are demanding increase in their wages attacked staff of Shapnopuri Traders, injuring 5. They also ransacked vehicles. The source did not mention the nature of injury.

On 22 Mar 2010, in Sylhet City (Sylhet, Sylhet), shop owners and employees hurled brickbats at police, with the latter firing tear gas shells and blank shots to control the situation. The clash started when one of the employees had an altercation with a customer. Police also arrested 5 in this connection.

On 22 Mar 2010, in Sylhet city (Sylhet, Sylhet), teachers, students and cross-sections of people gathered and formed a human chain at the Central Shaheed Minar to demand arrest and punishment to criminals who killed a Sylhet Government Women's College teacher.

On Mar 22, workers of Korean garment factory blocked highway in Dhaka city demonstrating and demanding increment in salaries. They vandalised various vehicles and injured a police constable during the demonstration.
On Mar 22, in Dhaka, a protest rally was staged by opposition BNP against price hike of essentials, repression on opposition and deterioration of law and order.

Assumed on 22 Mar 2010, in Cox's Bazar district (Chittagong), a clash occurred between factions of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) over shouting for serving meals at a luncheon in Motel Shoibal. 11 were injured. The source did not mention weapons used in the clash.
On Mar 22, workers of Chhatak Cement Factory protested the suspension of three CBA leaders in Chhatak, Sylhet.
16 demonstrators reportedly attacked the building of national broadcaster Sirasa and its employees with stones, causing damage to the building and other private properties and injuring employees.
Afghan refugees gathered outside the Afghan consulate to protest allege favouritism in selecting representatives from their communities for different forums.
Members of the PPP protested after being denied entry to an event due to security arrangements in place due to the attendance of the Punjab chief minister.

Different events occurred in Lahore: The body of Professor Fazal Bari was flown to Lahore from Quetta taken to the Punjab assembly as part of a protest demonstration against targeted killings; various protests against load shedding took place across Lahore, including in Madina Colony, Shahdara, Band Road, Shad Bagh, Gowalandi, Kot Lakhpat and Iqbal Town; Lakhu Dero residents protested outside the Lahore Press Club to demand the arrest of the killers of a man who was a witness in a murder case.
A protest meeting was organized by the United Front of Bahawalpur at the dried-up bed of the Sutlej river to demand action by the government against water shortages.
Hundreds of former governments employees protested to demand reinstatment. Police used batons and tear gas to disperse the peaceful protesters, causing some minor injuries.
Lawyers boycotted courts and engaged in a protest march to demand police free an adovcate held captive by kidnappers.
Riots continued today throughout Janakpur city in response to the alleged rape of a teenage girl by a police officer. At least five rioters were injured today after police fired upon them.
Twenty-nine arrested following service violent delivery protests in Leslie "at the weekend."

At least 10 people, including a journalist, were injured in a clash between the students of Bogra Institute of Health Technology (IHT) and police on March 21 in Bogra city. The unruly students also ransacked some vehicles and houses and put up a barricade on the road in front of the institute for about one and a half hours.

The police on Sunday foiled a protest procession of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party in Moulvibazar town against the arrest of the district BNP joint convener, Mujibur Rahman Chawdhury, and his brother Shamim Ahmed Chawdhury, president of Kamalganj upazila BNP unit.

Around 2,000 people gathered in front of the SMP office to submit a memorandum demanding immediate withdrawal of a case against Kucha union council chairman.

Members of the IJT protested against power outages in Toba and rural areas.

assoc_actor_1: CMDP: Civic Movement for Democracy and Peace

The protest, a part of 'Civic Satyagraha', was aimed at exerting pressure on the political parties to forge a consensus for promulgating a new constitution within the stipulated time. Earlier, the same group staged a 48 sit in.

A clash erupted between activists of the PML-Q and PML-N during a by-election, resulting in 2 injuries and 2 people arrested. The PML-Q allege that the PML-N had planned the fighting but this was denied by the PML-N.
Demonstrators blocked the RCD Highway near Sorab Town in the Kalat district following the kidnapping of a relative. Police were sent to disperse the protesters.

Students attending the entrance examination in Maharajgunj campus clashed with police on the campus. Irate examinees vandalised the campus by pelting stones and bricks. Students resorted to vandalism over allegations of the attempt by Dr Arun Sayami, the Dean of TUTH, to conduct the exam using force by mobilising security personnel in the campus premises. Students accused Dr Sayami of accepting bribes. Police arrested 15 students on the charge of vandalism.

Brawling among Christians and Muslims injures 31. Fires erupt in cars and homes. Fighting was said to have begun when Muslim residents threw stones at Christian construction workers they believed were building a church. Police make arrests.

Police intervened when Maoist cadre gathered to publicly declared the disputed plot a Martyrs' Memorial Park. Maoist cadres threw stones when police removed Maoist party flags from the land. Police baton-charged and also hurled stones at the Maoists.

Protesting contract employees of the National Program for Improvement of Watercourses (NPIW) clashed with police near the Sindh Assembly, resulting in injuries and 20 people arrested. The PML-N staged a protest in front of the Shikarpur Press Club against a recent clash between its members in Warah town.

Different protests took place in Hyderabad: Members of the Water Action Committee of Badin protested outside the Hyderabad Press Club against water shortages; JSQM members protested against HESCO authorities for grievances related to power bills and outages.
Former employees of the TMA protested outside the local press club to demand their reinstatement.
Resident protested against lack of provision of gas service to their area.

On Jan 28, in Dhaka, at least 20 BCL activists were injured when its rival groups clashed at Jagannath University and adjacent Kabi Nazrul Govt College in the old Dhaka city. Clash started when a group of BCL of JU entered Kabi Nazrul College to get admitted its supporters by force.

Assumed on 28 Jan 2010, in Sher-e Bangla Nagor (DCC (Kotwali), Dhaka, Dhaka), Chhatra League cadres and students of Sher-e-Bangla Agriculture University vandalized vehicles and looted valuables over police arresting students who were caught teasing girls and attempting robbery. Rioters pelted stones and brickbats at the police while the latter fired gunshots and lobbed teargas canisters. 20 were injured, including police. Vehicle owners also protested during the incident, demanding compensation from the damage.

On 28 Jan 2010, in Bhairab upazila (Kishoreganj, Dhaka), an unidentified group attacked a Bhairab Jubo League leader at Bhairabpur village as a sequel to previous enmity. The source did not mention the nature of injury. On the same day, the Jubo League held a rally demanding arrest of the attackers with a 31 Jan deadline.

On Jan 28, in Kushtia, activists of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) of Islamic University clashed with police and blocked a nearby highway to demonstrate against the arrest of one of their leaders that left 10 people injured.
On Jan 28, clash erupted between traders and hawkers in the port city's Jubilee Road area. Police fired tear gas shells to disperse the crowd. Many people were injured including policemen.

On 28 Jan 2010, in Bhairab upazila (Kishoreganj, Dhaka), an unidentified group attacked a Bhairab Jubo League leader (Haque Mithu) at Bhairabpur village as a sequel to previous enmity. The source did not mention the nature of injury. On the same day, the Jubo League held a rally demanding arrest of the attackers with a 31 Jan deadline.

Between 24-28 Jan 2010, in Baghai Chhari upazila (Rangamati, Chittagong), a road blockade is set up along Bagaihat-Sajek road by Sajek Nari Samaj (SNS), a body of indigenous women to demonstrate against lands allegedly grabbed by the settlers, causing suffering to some 40,000 people of the remote area.
Police quell a riot after people are injured and property destroyed.
Seven are injured and much property destroyed after a riot is incited by a disagreement between two motorists.
On Jan 28, at least 20 people were injured and several houses looted during a clash between two groups of people over a land dispute at Char Ananda-2 village (Sadar upazila, Bhola).
Balochistani security personnel, primarily police, protested again in Quetta. They fired into the air and broke the gates of the Chief Minister and Governor's Houses and occupied police stations.
Protesters march in the Delta State capital asking ill and unseen President YarAdua to formally transfer power to his deputy.
People engaged in pro-freedom protests in soldarity with Kashmiris.
Youths protest a drawn-out dispute over land meant for a federal housing estate in the Amakama area of Umuahia. The group blamed the state government for the bureaucratic delay.
Female MPAs belonging to the PPP, MQM and PML-F staged a sit-in to protest the attitudes of the lawyers defending an accused murder of a 12-year old housemaid.
At least six lawyers clashed with police while they were padlocking the Company Registrar's Office today demonstrating the increment of fine levied on company renewal.
Residents of Sebayeng hold a service delivery protest.

Activists of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) of Islamic University near Kushtia (city) Thursday clashed with police and blocked a nearby highway protesting the arrest of one of their leaders that left 10 people injured.

The Bangladesh Village Police held a rally at Muktangon in the Dhaka city on Wednesday to press for their eight-point demand, including increase in their salary. Village Police members under the banner of the Bangladesh Village Police Employees Union started gathering at Muktangon in the morning to attend the rally. Law enforcers resorted to baton charge on the participants to clear the road in front of Muktangon, leaving three Village Police personnel injured.

Cape Peninsula University of Technology students were barred from registering this morning as nursing student protests at the Bellville campus entered their second day. The first day of the protest was marred by violence and heavy police resistance.
Employees of the Army Sugar Mills badin continued their protests outside the Badin press Club.
On the call of the Citizens' Action Committee, STPP and JSQM, a protest strike was observed by residents to demand improved law and order. A sit-in was also held at the national highway.
Shaikh community members protested against the arrest of a man and demand of what they call a bribe for his release.

Opposing protests were held by the brothers and children of a woman who was killed. Her brothers claim her husband killed her and protested to demand his arrest, while her children protested against the registration of a case against their father who they say is innocent.
A sit-in style protest in Port Elizabeth over service delivery.

On 27 Jan 2010, in Dhaka University (Dhaka, Dhaka), two handmade bombs by aggrieved Chhatra League (BCL) men exploded inside the campus following the previous night's announcement of 85 newly filled up posts in the campus unit of the BCL, which was considered controversial by some activists.

assoc_actor_2: BNP: Bangladesh Nationalist Party; JCD: Bangladesh Jatiotabadi Chatra Dal; Students (Bangladesh)
notes: On 27 Jan 2010, in Shyamnagar upazila (Satkhira, Khulna), Chhatra League (BCL) activists clashed with Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) and Jatiotabadi Chatra Dal (JCD) members during a meeting and damaged the BNP's office furniture.

On Jan 27, a clash between ruling Awami League and BNP activists left at least 10 injured in Jhenidah town. Group of BNP activists was going in procession to attend a meeting in the party office. The procession came under attack by AL activists on way in front of Shilpakala Academy.
On Jan 27, hundreds of people blocked the Feni-Ramgarh and Feni-Parshuram roads at Ranirhat Bazar in Feni Sadar upazila following the death of a businessman in a militant attack.

On Jan 27, at least 15 people were injured in a clash between traders and hawkers at Station road in Chittagong city. Clash ensued between traders of Paristhan VIP Market and the hawkers over removing the hawkers from in front of the market.

Between 24-28 Jan 2010, in Baghai Chhari upazila (Rangamati, Chittagong), a road blockade is set up along Bagaihat-Sajek road by Sajek Nari Samaj (SNS), a body of indigenous women to demonstrate against lands allegedly grabbed by the settlers, causing suffering to some 40,000 people of the remote area.
A clash took place between two unidentified groups of people in Gampola.
On 27 Jan, a mob of at least 30 alleged Awami League men damaged a nursery owned by a BNP man in Lalmonirhat district area.
A service delivery protest of Soweto residents becomes violent, demonstrators light fires and pelt vehicles. Police fire rubber bullets and make several arrests.
Flower firm workers strike and stage protest over pay

On January 27, 2010, over 120 families protested outside their apartment in Borei Keila commune, Prampi Makara district, Phnom Penh. The residents will be forced to leave due to an agreement between a development company and city officials.

On January 27, 2010, approximately 100 market vendors protested their pending eviction from the Pouk market in Pouk district, Siem Reap province. A group of police officers were at the market to dismantle their stalls and forcibly evict the vendors. However, local officials stopped the forced eviction when the vendors started demonstrating.
Family and neighbours held a protest against the police following a post-mortem of a young boy who was allegedly tortured to death by the police, during which they blocked traffic.
Opposition members walked out of the NWFP assembly in protest following the passage of a bill that dissolved local councils and replaced nazims with administrators.

Villagers from Photharam and Baan Pong districts of Ratchaburi province gathered in front of a wastewater plant to voice their demand for a halt to its operation. The villagers said the plant has released wastewater into the Mae Klong River, which is the area's main water source. The demonstrators said the plant is polluting the public waterway while its burning of coal is also causing air pollution.

source: Centre For Monitoring Election Violence CMEV
notes: The CMEV reported the assault of a police man guarding a polling station by the son of a UPFA minister.
Protest over ruling party's control of media ahead of scheduled elections
Tshwane University of Technology students at the Soshanguve campus protest a slow registration process and dirty hostels by burning tyres at the main entrance of the facility.
At least 3 leaders and activists of opposition BNP were injured in clashes with ruling party (AL) men in Lalmonirhat town on 26 Jan.

In Gazipur (city), angry garment workers torched 15 vehicles and vandalised over 50 others January 26, shutting down production in all garment factories on Dhaka-Gazipur highway, after a bus crushed a garment worker. The workers clashed with police, leaving at least 40 injured and turned the Boardbazar area into a riot zone. Nearly 100 factories were forced to halt production.
On 26 Jan, the family of a teenage girl who died in hospital and local residents staged a protest in Karachi city (Sindh), against alleged negligence and demanding punishment of the hospital workers.

notes: Different protests were staged in Hyderabad: Employees of the Popultion Welfare Department protested outside the local press club against nepotism, unemployment and poverty; residents of Firdous Colony protested against occupation of their land; peasants of Sanghar protested against the actions of an influential landlord; contract-based employees of OGDCL protested to demand regularization of their services; a women protested to demand compensation for her husbands death; activists of the Sindh Peoples Students Federation protested against the actons of the local police; people of the Mallah community protested against the actions of the Hyderabad poolice; members of the All Pakistan Clerks Associationprotested to demand their grievances be addressed.
Residents protested to demand the reappointment of a transferred DSP.

Different protests took place in Moro: The SUP protested outside the local press club to demand the replacement of a burnt transformer; residents protested against a attempted kidnapping in Golo Potho in the Moro area.
The women of Unar Muhalla in the Larkana area protested against low gas pressure and the non-provison of their BISP stipend outside the local press club.

A protest was staged by the leaders of the PML-N, Sunni Tehreek, Citizen Action Comittee, PML-N ladies wing and other political, social and religious groups against the poor performance of district police. They staged a sit-in and blocked traffic.

Residents protested in front of the local press office against a police raid during which they allege police disrespected women and abused them and their children, while also not possessing proper search warrants.
Residents of Katachi Abadi in the Golarchi area protested against the bulldozing of their homes.

notes: A member of the JSQM and another of the STPP were killed in a clash with the MQM over a land dispute.
Tshepisong and Mnandine residents clash during a protest over the lack of electricity; one group had the service while the other did not.
On Jan 26, a constable was seriously wounded in a bomb blast while intervening in a clash between unidentified rival groups over eve teasing at Aldi bazaar, Munishganj.
Police arresed ST members who stormed an MQM office. A mob formed around the police van and threw stones at it, then some other shot at it, killing an ST member and injuring another.

On January 26, 2010, 4 villagers were injured in a clash between staff members and residents in Prey Nob (Preah Sihanouk). It is reported that 40 villagers were engaged in a 3-day land protest when they were attacked by staff members of the company that was given the land.

The All Parties Hurriyat Conference (M) Pakistan engaged in a sit-in outside the UNMOGIP offices to mark India's Republic Day and demand a pro-active role by the international community in solving the Kashmir dispute.
Durban University of Technology students clash with police during a fee hike protest.

Police personnel of Balochistan, including the Balochistan Constabulary, the Anti-Terrorism Force and other law enforcement agencies, participated in protests against a lack of increases in salaries, targeted killings and non-payment to descendants of policemen killed in terrorist attacks. The protesters blocked roads, fired into the air, and occupied the houses of the governor and chief minister.

assoc_actor_1: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship
notes: On 25 January 2010, a brief confrontation between police and the United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship's (UDD) "Rak Chiang Mai 51 Group" was reported in front of the Provincial Police Region 5 head office in the Muang district of Chiang Mai (MCM, CM). More than 100 members of the Rak Chiang Mai 51 Group gathered to demand the removal of the Police Leutenant General. Security measures were imposed on the spot to prevent demonstrators entering the police station but mounting tensions eventually erupted into a short clash. No injuries or damage were reported. The demonstration came after the chief showed a likelihood of appointing police officers affiliated with the People's Alliance for Democracy to replace those with ties to the UDD.
About 25 protesting KwaNokuthula residents gathered outside the Plettenberg Bay Magistrates Court to protest in support of people accused of vigilantism on a pair of thieves.
Prisoners at Nara jail protested against the jail administration. Jail personnel reportedly responded violently to the protest, severely injuring many prisoners.

On 25 Jan 2010, in Gazipur upazila (Gazipur, Dhaka), garment workers, rioted against the death of a factory worker who was run over by a bus. Rioters attacked police with sticks and iron rods. Police used truncheons and fired teargas shells.

assoc_actor_1: PASMA: Pan Africanist Student Movement of Azania; Students (South Africa)
notes: Western Cape College of Nursing students and PASMA supporters protest for more favourable working hours.
Paramedics staged a sit-in outside the Rural Health Centre to demand a resolution for their grievances.
Residents protested against prolonged power outages and alleged bad behaviour by HESCO officials.
Trainees of the Benazir Bhutto Shaheed Youth Development Program from the Technical Training Centre Larkana protested and blocked traffic to demand payment of their stipends.

Different protests were staged outside the Hyderabad press club: members of the Hill Sand and Concrete Association protested to demand the arrest of men accused of killing their drivers; members of the Shaheed Bhutto Welfare Society protested against the arrest of their leader Amir Zardari; wokrers of the PPP PS-48 Hyderabad protested to demand resolution of their grievances; a woman protested to demand the withdrawal of allegedly fake cases; a man protested to demand the arrest of alleged murders of his son; residents of Qasimabad protested to demand restoration of suspended officials and police in their area.
Hundreds of students from the Delta Steel Company Technical School protested an increase of school fees.
On Jan 25, villagers lynched a man at Metangghar Bazar in Muradnagar upazila suspecting his involvement in robbery.

On 25 Jan 2010, in Tangail sadar (Tangail, Dhaka), students of Tangail Textile Institute brought out a procession and held a rally in the campus, pressing school authorities to meet their 5-point demands to address irregularities in the admissions test.

Between 24-25 Jan 2010, in Jessore district (Khulna), students of Noapara College attacked students of Singia Ideal College on 24 Jan over a football match with 15 injured. On 25 Jan, students of Singia Ideal College blocked a road on the Jessore-Khulna highway and vandalised at least 15 vehicles to protest the previous day's attack on them.

On Jan 25, in Dhaka, Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL), student wing of ruling Awami League protested and demanded immediate withdrawal of the 'false' case filed against 14 leaders and activists of different DU hall BCL units.

On 25 Jan 2010, in Chapai Nababganj district (Rajshahi), transport workers put up barricades and blocked the Chapainawabganj-Sonamasjid highway to protest against authorities putting up an increase in bridge toll without prioer notice. This caused about three hours of traffic.

Between 24-28 Jan 2010, in Baghai Chhari upazila (Rangamati, Chittagong), a road blockade is set up along Bagaihat-Sajek road by Sajek Nari Samaj (SNS), a body of indigenous women to demonstrate against lands allegedly grabbed by the settlers, causing suffering to some 40,000 people of the remote area.
Durban University of Technology students protest a slow registration process on 22/01, 23/01, 24/01 and 25/01.

notes: WOZA protest against state of education

On January 25, 2010, over 40 villagers engaged in a land dispute protested in Prey Nob (Preah Sihanouk). Workers of the company involved in the dispute were also present at the location. This event is part of a 3-day protest.
Taxi drivers protested against high gas prices and gas load management by marching rom Faizabad to President House.
Traders struck and engaged in a protest rally following alleged abuse of their leader by police. They blocked the main road and clashed with police, who fired shots into the air to disperse them.

assoc_actor_1: UDD: United Front for Democracy against Dictatorship

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Nepal (2008-2015) Armed Police Force
notes: On 24 Jan, at least 32 persons, including women, children and seven policemen were injured when locals and police clashed in Matihani VDC. Violence ensued after police tried to pull down houses and huts built on plots of land belonging to Guthi Sansthan (a community organization). A joint team of Nepal Police and the Armed Police Force headed by Chief District Officer Sagarmani Parajuli had been deployed in the area to evict the people there. The police fired seven rounds of tear gas in an attempt to disperse the crowd. Two locals ended up in critical condition.
Durban University of Technology students protest a slow registration process on 22/01, 23/01, 24/01 and 25/01.

Students of the Chittagong Polytechnic Institute in Chittagong (city) went on the rampage in the port city following the death of their fellow and another killed in a road accident on Sunday. The agitated students blocked the Chittagong- Hathazari Road and damaged at least 30 vehicles, suspending traffic for more than three hours. On information, the police came to the spot and lobbed several teargas canisters, leading to a clash with the students. At least 15, including eight policemen, were injured in the clash.

Different protests occurred outside the Hyderabad press club: residents of the Khaskheli communtiy protested against PPP leader Ghulam Shah Laghari; residents of Bagri protested to demand the recovery of abducted girls; teachers who passed the IBA test protested to demand the issuance of offers of work.
Two groups of prisoners clashed at the Khairpur central jail, resulting in severe injuries to 5 people before prison officials broke up the fight.
Relatives of a man killed near the Khandhkot Bypass protested to demand the arrest of those involved.
Local residents protested against the worsening law and order situation after armed men raided a hotel and general store in the area.
Residents protested outside the local press club against unscheduled power outages and low gas pressure.
Former employees of the TMA Larkana protested in front of the local press club to demand reinstatement of their services.
Residents of Mirjat community protested against the lodging of allegedly fake cases against the organizer of the protest.

On 24 Jan 2010, in Rajshashi University (RU) in Rajashahi city (Rajshahi, Rajshahi), students of the folklore department protested against the lack of adequate classrooms in their department. They demand the university authorities to work on the problem as soon as possible.

assoc_actor_1: PCP: Parbatya Chattagram Pahari Chhatra Parishad; Students (Bangladesh)
notes: On 24 Jan 2010, in Baghai Chhari upazila (Rangamati, Chittagong), Parbatya Bangalee Chhatra Parishad activists attacked a group of indigenous women called Sajek Nari Samaj (SNS) over being barred from entering a road. The latter created a road blockade to demonstrate against their lands allegedly grabbed by the settlers. Security personnel went to the spot and dispersed the PBCP. At least 15 indigenous people were injured.
A JVP councillor was assaulted by an unidentified group of men while he was pasting posters relating to the presidential election on January 24. He died of his injuries on February 2.

assoc_actor_1: CDHR: Committee for the Defence of Human Rights
notes: CDHR protested the prolonged absence of President YarAdua with a march through Warri.

On January 24, 2010, over 40 villagers engaged in a land dispute protested in Prey Nob (Preah Sihanouk). Workers of the company involved in the dispute were also present at the location. This event is part of a 3-day protest.

On January 24, 2010, approximately 200 former residents of Tonle Bassac commune, Chamkar Mon district, Phnom Penh marched to their former residence to remember their violent eviction a year earlier. The residents also raised concerns about their relocation site which is 20 kilometers from the city centre.

Locals and kin of nine-year-old Santosh Karki who was killed in Gothatar shootout demonstrated in Koteshwor, Kathmandu on Sunday for two hours. The agitators demanded legal action against the culprits and compensation to the family of the deceased. The child had been an innocent bystander in a non-political shootout.
Residents of Sherpao captured an alleged kidnapper and destroyed the houses of his two accomplices. They also blocked the Tangi-Charsadda road for several hours to protest against kidnapping.
District council members walked out of council in protest against the appointment of administrators and the end of the local government system.
The Progressive Youth Front (PYF) held a protest against the lack of attention paid by the government to destruction caused by land slides in Gilgit-Baltistan.
Prisons at Kaduna State prison staged a violent protest against overcrowding in the facility.

On Jan 23, five people were injured in a clash between the workers of a local mini textile mill and the Abhilash Paribahan transport workers in Jalakandi area, Narayanganj.

On Jan 23, in Gaibandha, the interview of eligible candidates for the post of health assistant was foiled amid protest by unsuccessful candidates over allegations of irregularities.

On 23 Jan 2010, in Brahmanbaria sadar (Brahmanbaria, Chittagong), at least 30 Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) rivals lobbed cocktail bombs in a BNP member's house and during a BNP procession. No one was hurt. Police fired 11 rounds of blank shots to control the situation and also recovered 28 unexploded cocktail bombs from attackers.

Parents of children at the Oranjekloof Moravian Primary School in Hout Bay staged a protest this morning in their fight to save the school after the land was determined to be reappropriated.

An Egyptian soldier was shot dead during a violent protest at the Egypt-Gaza border.

Five activists of Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL) were injured in a factional clash on Rajshashi University (RU) (Rajshashi city) campus Tuesday, January 5.

assoc_actor_1: BCL: Bangladesh Chhatra League; Students (Bangladesh); Labour Group (Bangladesh)
notes: On 5 January, power loom workers and BCL workers clashed with the police during a demonstration at Bashail point in Narsindgi town, demanding the release of BCL leader Kaiyum Sarker. More than 50 buses, minibuses including police vans were damaged and more than 50 people were injured.

A college teacher was assaulted by the activists of BCL on the premises of Naogaon Government University College in Naogaon on January 5. The victim was identified as Subash Singh, Associate Professor of Physics Department of the college.

On 5 Jan 2010, in Sylhet city (Sylhet, Sylhet), a clash involving brickbats occurred between Chhatra League (BCL) and Islami Chhatra Shibir in Sylhet Agricultural University which started when a BCL member was beaten up by Shibir .
Private school students protested against calls to give preferential treatment from public schools in a particular area.

Assumed on 5 Jan 2010, in Kalmakanda upazila (Netrakona, Mymensingh), around 100 alleged Chhatra League (BCL) activists armed with lethal weapons brought out a procession and ransacked a Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) office at the upazila headquarters, damaging furniture. No one was reportedly hurt.
On Jan 5, workers of Nippan Garments of Tongi staged demonstration in front of BGMEA Bhaban causing a severe traffic jam in Dhaka's Karwan Bazar area.
Around 500 residents of Pemuyanwatta in Mirissa staged a protest demanding a water supply to their village. They warned they would boycott the election if the government failed the request.
Egyptian police on Monday rounded up 50 members of the opposition Muslim Brotherhood trying to demonstrate against Israels offensive in the Gaza Strip.

assoc_actor_1: NUBASS: National Union of Bauchi State Students Militia
notes: Students protest against a policy requiring them to appear for verification before they could be awarded scholarship.
On January 5, 2010, residents of Boeung Kak protested outside the commune office in Phnom Penh to demand that the government clear the sewage from their community.

assoc_actor_1: UCPN(M): Unified Communist Party of Nepal (Maoist)
notes: Activists of the UCPN (M) today captured 15 bighas of private land in Chhitaha VDC of Sunsari district. A large number of Maoist cadres, calling Baduwal a 'feudal landlord', announced the seizure by hoisting party flags on the land. They distributed the land among 30 tillers, who had been cultivating it for years.

assoc_actor_1: JCD: Bangladesh Jatiotabadi Chatra Dal; Students (Bangladesh)
notes: A faction of Jatiyatabadi Chhatra Dal (JCD) leaders stageda a protest against its new President Sultan Salauddin Tuku and BNP's former students' affairs secretary Fazlul Haque Milon on Dhaka University campus on January 4.
On Jan 4, eight people were injured in a factional clash of Chhatra League (BCL) in Bakerganj municipal area, Barisal over celebrating of 62nd founding anniversary of BCL.

On 4 Jan, 10 persons, including two women, were injured in a clash between two rival groups at Kaladangi village under Char Bishnapur union area (Sadarpur upazila, Faridpur) over a land dispute.

assoc_actor_1: ASWJ: Ahle Sunnat Wal Jamaat; Women (Pakistan)
notes: On January 4, women's wing of the ASWJ protested outside Karachi Press Club in Saddar town (Karachi, Sindh) to demand the arrest of the killers of Abdul Ghafoor Nadeem and his son.

On January 4, anesthesiologists went on strike and protested at the Karachi Civic Hospital in Saddar town (Karachi, Sindh) against the ongoing harassment of one of their colleagues, causing over 180 surgeries to be postponed.
A group of veiled women from Mianwali protested outside the National Press Club against a raid carried out by police on allegedly political grounds.

assoc_actor_1: JCD: Bangladesh Jatiotabadi Chatra Dal; Students (Bangladesh)
notes: JCD and BCL clashed in Patuakhali over the celebration of the New Year and observance of the founding anniversary of the JCD on January 3.

At least 15 activists of the Bangladesh Chhatra League (BCL), students front of the Bangladesh Awami League, Bhola College unit were injured, two of them seriously, in a clash between two groups of students in Bhola College (Bhola city) hostel recently. According to the sources, following the issue of participation in the Victory Day rally college unit president of BCL Siddique Parvej group attacked the secretary of Bappi group at Kobi Nazrul Islam Hostel group of BCL at night recently (January 3).

On 3 January, dozens of civil society members, traders, lawyers and doctors staged a demonstration outside the National Press Club against Pakistan's Institute of Medical Sciences (PIMS) doctors who were found negligent in the death of the MNA's Faiz Muhammad Khan.

assoc_actor_1: JCD: Bangladesh Jatiotabadi Chatra Dal; Students (Bangladesh)
notes: On 3 Jan 2010, at the Dhaka University in Dhaka City (Dhaka, Dhaka), post-deprived leaders of the Jatiyatabadi Chhatra Dal (JCD) brought out a procession which started on 2 Jan protesting alleged violation of member composition of the new JCD central committee.
On Jan 3, agitated people staged demonstration in the district town, Naryanganj, demanding uninterrupted supply of gas to the domestic consumers.

On Jan 3, about 50 people were injured in a clash between organizers of jatra gaan and police in a village of Dohar upazila. Police fired 10 rounds of gunshots when they came under attack by an unruly mob leaving 30 injured, including 10 policemen.
On Jan 3, five people were wounded in a clash with a group of Fazlur Rahman Hall students and book sellers of Nilkhet in Dhaka city.

assoc_actor_1: Prisoners (Sri Lanka); LTTE: Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam
notes: The eruption of a clash between two factions in the prison of Colombo caused the wounding of two LTTE suspects and the transfer of others.
A clash erupts between UPFA and UNP supporters. They pelted stones and glasses causing the damage of several vehicles and a large number of participants were injured.
On 3 January, a clash took place between rival factions - one of them from the UNF - causing damages to several vehicles and injuring civilians.
Two thousand Egyptians protested against lawlessness in North Sinai province after a man was killed by armed robbers.
On January 3, 2010, approximately 100 villagers protested at the site of an on-going land dispute in Kandal Steung (Kandal) and removed pole markers.

Members of MJ staged a protest rally against the suicidal attacks in Karachi earlier this week. The protesters rallied, then marched from Imam Bargah Yad-I-Hussain to Rehmanabad Chowk. They also burned tires and blocked traffic for a short while on Murree Road.

On 2 Jan, in the Segunbagicha area of Dhaka city, local leaders and activists of the Awami League brought out a procession carrying the dead body of a local Awami League leader who died in an attack by BNP activists. Demonstrators demanded punishment for the killers. Some activists attacked some car decoration shops and vandalised them. The police immediately controlled the situation.

assoc_actor_1: JCD: Bangladesh Jatiotabadi Chatra Dal; Students (Bangladesh)
assoc_actor_2: JCD: Bangladesh Jatiotabadi Chatra Dal; Students (Bangladesh)
notes: In Barisal a ward BNP office was ransacked and at least 8 people were injured in JCD factional clashes while observing its (JCD) founding anniversary at Palashpur area of Barisal (city) on January 2.

At least 10 people were injured in a clash between two rival groups of the ruling Awami League at Araihazar in Narayanganj on 2 Jan. Witnesses and the police said the clash occurred for not inviting local Awami League leader Sirajul Islam to a function marking distribution of books among the students at Rainadi Kalagacchia High School & College.

On 2 January, leaders of Bangabandhu Sangskritik Jote held a rally and formed a human chain at Jatyia Press Club in Dhaka city, demanding that the heads of state and governments of different countries to send back the self-confessed fugitive killers of Father of the Nation Bangabandhu Sheikh Mujibur Rahman to Bangladesh to face their punishment awarded by the country's Supreme Court in absentia.

assoc_actor_1: YDA: Young Doctors Association; Health Workers (Pakistan)
notes: The Young Doctors Association staged a rally to condemn the registration of criminal cases against their colleagues.

assoc_actor_1: JCD: Bangladesh Jatiotabadi Chatra Dal; Students (Bangladesh)
assoc_actor_2: JCD: Bangladesh Jatiotabadi Chatra Dal; Students (Bangladesh)
notes: On Jan 2, at least three leaders of Jatiayatabadi Chhatra Dal (JCD) were injured in a factional clash on the Dhaka University campus. The clash ensued following an altercation over elections of student body.

Assumed on 2 Jan 2010, in Satkhira District (Khulna), over 300 people formed a human chain organized by Satkhira District Landless Association to demand the government and the police arrest and punishment to killers of landless leader Saifullah Laskar.

Assumed on 2 Jan 2010, in Nilphamari town (Nilphamari, Rangpur), students of Nilphamari Government College held a procession and ransacked a bus stand after some of their fellow students were involved in an altercation and were assaulted by bus staff who demanded a higher bus fare from student passengers.

assoc_actor_2: Labour Group (Bangladesh); Police Forces of Bangladesh (2009-)
notes: Assumed on 2 Jan 2010, in Dhaka City (Dhaka, Dhaka), Dhaka University students ransacked 23 shops after hearing that 5 students were injured in a clash with booksellers at the Baku Shah Market. Shop owners and employees retaliated with bamboo sticks and brickbats. Police was able to control the situation.

On Jan 2, the agitated people, under the banner of Narayanganj Zila Unnayan Parishad, staged demonstration and formed a human chain in Chashara Balur math area, Narayanganj, demanding uninterrupted gas supply in the district.

On Jan 2, at least ten people were injured in a clash between two rival AL groups at Araihazar. The clash occurred when an AL leader was not invited to a function for the distribution of books among students at the Rainadi Kalagacchia High School & College.

Cadres of the All Nepal Peasants Association affiliated to the reconstituted CPN (Maoist) led by Matrika Yadav seized the Basulinga Sugar Mill at Chuha VDC in Kailali district on Saturday. The group, numbering 16, took the mill under their control by planting the party flags and banners. According to the party, the mill was seized in demonstration against the government writing off the loan of Rs. 400 million taken by Arun Chand, the proprietor of the mill.
A group of internally displaced people living in a camp protest living conditions.

assoc_actor_1: JCD: Bangladesh Jatiotabadi Chatra Dal; BNP: Bangladesh Nationalist Party; Students (Bangladesh)
notes: On 1 Jan 2010, in Patuakhali district (Barisal), an alleged group of Awami League (AL) cadres attacked a Jatiyatabadi Chhatra Dal (JCD) procession celebrating their 31st founding anniversary. 10 were injured, including a former minister of Bangladesh National Party (BNP).
On January 1, Shibir activists staged a protest against fee hike by the hall authorities at Room No 207 on the campus of Rajshahi University (RU).

source: Daily Regional Times (Pakistan); Right Vision News
notes: Religious and political leaders, including the Sunni Rehbar Council, called for a peaceful strike to express solidarity with "the affectees of 10th Muharram incident", nearly shutting down the city.
A large number of people including members of civil society and students, held a peace rally in solidarity with the citizens of Karachi following a deadly bombing in that city.

On 1 Jan 2010, in Moghia (Kachua, Bagerhat, Khulna), an unidentified group of 20-25 attacked a Jamaat office during an oath taking ceremony of the upazila Ameer, leaving 8 people injured. The source did not mention the nature of injury.

assoc_actor_2: JCD: Bangladesh Jatiotabadi Chatra Dal; Students (Bangladesh)
notes: On 1 Jan 2010, in Kachua upazila (Bagerhat, Khulna), 20-25 activists of Chhatra League (BCL) attacked a Jatiyatabadi Chhatra Dal (JCD) rally celebrating the 31st founding anniversary of JCD in Signboard Bazaar, leaving 8 people injured. The source did not mention the nature of injury.

assoc_actor_2: BNP: Bangladesh Nationalist Party; JCD: Bangladesh Jatiotabadi Chatra Dal; Students (Bangladesh)
notes: On 1 Jan 2010, in Morelganj upazila (Bagerhat, Khulna), 20-25 activists of Chhatra League (BCL) attacked a Jatiyatabadi Chhatra Dal (JCD) rally celebrating the 31st founding anniversary of JCD at the house of upazila Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) president, injuring 9 people. The source did not mention the nature of injury or weapons used.

assoc_actor_1: AL: Bangladesh Awami League; Jubo League
notes: On 1 Jan 2010, in Shailokupa upazila (Jhenaidah, Khulna), loyalists of a former Jubo League president attacked an Awami League (AL) activist who was formerly Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP). The two AL factions clashed, injuring 50, including 6 police. The police lobbed 9 tear gas shells and fired 9 shots to control the situation. The source did not mention weapons used in the clash.

Assumed on 1 Jan 2010, in Rajshahi city (Rajshahi, Rajshahi), students vandalized and damaged the principal's room at the Rajshahi Polytechnic Institute to demonstrate against the school authorities' decision of witholding exam results of some 60 students who failed in the practical examinations. The on-duty police was able to control the situation.

assoc_actor_1: JCD: Bangladesh Jatiotabadi Chatra Dal; Students (Bangladesh)
assoc_actor_2: JCD: Bangladesh Jatiotabadi Chatra Dal; Students (Bangladesh)
notes: On 1 Jan 2010, in Patuakhali district (Barisal), two factions of the JCD clashed during the 31st founding anniversary of Jatiyatabadi Chhatra Dal (JCD), leaving 8 injured people. The source did not mention weapons used in the clash.

assoc_actor_1: UNF: United National Front; SLFP: Sri Lanka Freedom Party
notes: A group of residents from the Makawita area staged a protest condemning the alleged attacks on a politician and the destruction of UNF offices by a group of people. 200 individuals took part in the protest - including UNF and SLFP supporters.
Protests occurred in Hyderabad in solidarity with those in Karachi against the bombing of a religious procession earlier in the week.
